loans.name: Mente Positivo Group

texts.es:
El comité se encuentra trabajando dentro del sexto ciclo del Programa de comité de Mujeres de Emprendedoras.
Cada una de las integrantes realiza una actividad diferente y todas se están muy contentas con su trabajo ya que mediante el mismo consiguieron ayudar a sus familias.
Así una de las integrantes es la señora Elvira M. quien tiene como actividad principal la atención de su librería  que le genera un ingreso diario.
En su librería ella ofrece útiles escolares como cuaderno, lapices, varios tipos de papeles, carteras escolares, cartucheras y otros.
 Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas útiles escolares para renovar sus mercaderías ademas desea ofrecer nuevas mercaderías como remeras, pantalones, polleras todos para los colegios.
texts.en:
This committee is working on its sixth loan cycle as part of the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs Program. Each member is involved in a different business activity. They are all very happy with their work and hope to continue in the same manner so that they can support their families.

One of the members is Sra. Elvira M.. Her main business activity is managing a bookstore so that she can generate a daily income. At her store she offers school supplies such as notebooks, pencils, different types of paper, school satchels, pouches, and other products.

Elvira is requesting a loan to buy school supplies to revamp her inventory. In addition, she wants to offer new merchandise such as T-shirts, trousers, and skirts that are used for school uniforms.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school supplies & uniforms

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more pants and quail eggs.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina F. is 51 years old. She is married and has two children. She is a very active woman. Ten years ago, Madina started the business of poultry breeding. She raises the chickens and then sells them at the local market, usually to local restaurants. With the income she generates, she provides a better quality of life for her children.

Despite recent success, since her business is still quite small, it doesn't generate enough income for the whole family. Madina would like to request a loan to expand her business and increase her family income. She will use the profit generated from the business to repay the loan on time. She is asking for a loan of 600 AZN in order to buy more chickens to sell when they are fully grown.

loans.use: To purchase more chicken

loans.name: Elizabeth   Auma

texts.en:
Elizabeth O. runs ECD Nursury School in Kisumu. She is 32 years old and married to Amos Mbadi, a taxi driver who provides for most of the family's basic needs. Together they are blessed with two children, 11 and 5 years of age.

Elizabeth has been in this business for two years and her monthly income is Kshs.22,000. She learned about KADET LTD through their marketing awareness and is now applying for her first loan from KADET microfinance to add more small plastic chairs for children and learning charts for teaching. She intends to utilize the income generated to pay back the loan and expand the classroom. In the future she plans to have a big school that will cater to many pupils.

loans.use: To buy small plastic chairs for pupils and charts for teaching

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem lives in a small city of Pakistan called Vehari, which is famous for its agriculture industry. She is a working woman who sews clothes to supplement the income of her family. She sews clothes as per customer requirement and also gives a good look to the clothes by using colorful laces and designs. Her clients feel happy to be her customer and give her regular orders.
 
Her husband's name is B. A. and he is involved in the animal-selling business. He first buys animals like goats or cows of a young age and keeps them in the house and takes care of them until they've grown up. Then he sells them to animal markets for a good profit. 

Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan amount, her husband will buy animals (goats and cows) of a young age and grow them up for reselling. 

She is hopeful that this investment will bring positive change to her husband’s business and he will be able to make his income double in size. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Naseem.

loans.use: To buy animals for reselling

loans.name: Maria Hilda

texts.es:
María Hilda es una madre de 61 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el caserío Muy Finca del distrito de Mochumí, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a mas de cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pavos, patos, pollos, palomas y cuyes. Ella cría estos animales en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales y cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta en el mercado de la ciudad de Lambayeque. Este negocio es una fuente importante de ingresos para su familia, por lo que siempre trata de dar lo mejor de si para sacarlo adelante.

María desea adquirir más animales y alimentos con los cuales alimentarlos. Con esta inversión ella espera aumentar sus ventas, especialmente durante la navidad, que es cuando la demanda aumenta. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer bastante trabajadora y emprendedora. Su anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Hilda is a 61-year-old mother who lives with her family in the village of Muy Finca in the Mochumí district, an agricultural zone that belongs to the province of Lambayeque and located more than forty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She raises small animals to sell such as turkeys, ducks, chickens, pigeons, and guinea pigs.  She raises these animals in the back of her home.  They are naturally grain and grass fed and when they have reached a good level of development, they are offered for sale in the market town of Lambayeque.  This business is an important source of income for her family, so she always tries to do her best to succeed.

María wants to purchase more animals and food to feed them.  With this investment she expects to increase sales, especially at Christmas, when demand increases.  To achieve her objective, she has decided to apply for the first time to Kiva field partner Edpyme Alternativa for 1000 soles.

María is a very hardworking and enterprising woman.  She desires to continue growing as an entrepreneur to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase more animals and feed for them.

loans.name: Honesty Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the Honesty Group. They run small scale businesses based in Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of 800,000 leones each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Bai K. who is in the middle. Bai is age 28 and was born in Makeni city. He is single with no children. Bai has been a businessman for two years now. He runs a telephone booth. With his share of this loan, he will buy top-up cards for all four mobile companies, mobile phone accessories, etc., to sell in his telephone booth.

loans.use: To buy top-up cards for all four mobile companies, mobile phone accessories, etc. to sell

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia B. is 43 years old, married and has four school-aged children. She is from the village of Tambagan within the municipality of Medina, Misamis Oriental province on the Mindanao islands. Amalia runs a specialized retail store from which she primarily buys and sells coconuts for a copra business in the local community. Amalia has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2010 Amalia joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. Amalia successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional coconuts to buy and sell. Amalia is requesting a new loan, her third from HSPFI, of 10,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Hope To God Ii Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Hope To God II” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Adama K. is the leader of this group. Adama was born in Gbintin village. She is 29 years old. Adama is married to a businessman and they have three children: two in primary school and one in secondary school. Adama sells palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), nut oil (lesser in value to palm-oil), garri (fast food made out of cassava roots), etc. With the help of this loan, Adama will buy palm oil, nut oil, garri, etc. at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, nut oil, garri, etc. at wholesale to add to her business

loans.name: Altangerel

texts.en: Altangerel T. is 49 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in their own ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, in Uvurhangai province, central Mongolia. Her oldest daughter is a university student while her youngest daughter works as a private businesswoman. Since 1999, she has been operating a milk, dairy products and grocery trading business in a rented stall at the local market. During the summertime she sells mare's milk (fermented milk) and has become quite experienced in the trade over the many years. She hopes to continue operating her business with stability.  In the future, she dreams of establishing her own dairy product processing factory. Altangerel is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase dairy products and other goods at wholesale prices for her trading business.

loans.use: To purchase dairy products and other goods at wholesale prices

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita P. is from the village of Bug-ong, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 41 years old. Warlita is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Warlita owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making and selling snacks & other delicacies like "bibingka" & rice cakes in the local community. Warlita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Warlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Warlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Warlita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Warlita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Bilal

texts.ar:
بلال عمره 24 سنة يعمل سائق عام موظف متزوج وله ولدان له في عمله 15 سنة يحب عائلته كثيرا وهي كل اهتامه 
يسعى دائما الى تعليم اولاده بصورة جيد حتى يكونوا ذات مركز جيد في المجتمع طموح ويحب ان يعلم اولاده يعلم بكد
ونشاط لكي يؤمن القوت اليومي له تاريخ جيد في المجموعة كان يلقى الدعم دائما من عائلته وكان له اثر جيد
على زيادة مدخوله يريد ان يؤسس عمل خاص له كفتح محل جديد للأحذية يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة
الى شراء بضائع جديدة لفتح محل احذية
texts.en: BilA. is 24 years old and married. He has been working as a driver for 15 years. BilA. loves his family and seeks to educate his children well and enhance their sociA. standing. He is ambitious and works diligently to secure his daily income. BilA. has a good history with A. Majmoua. He has the full support of his family. BilA. seeks to establish a private business. He would like to own a shoe store. Through his loan from A. Majmoua, BilA. wants to purchase new merchandise for his store.

loans.use: To purchase new merchandise (shoes and bags)

loans.name: Saima's Group

texts.en:
Saima lives in a small housing colony in the city of Kamoki which is located in Punjab, Pakistan, which is known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there for over ten years. She is a housewife and she prefers to stay at home and take care of her household responsibilities. She has given birth to a daughter who is two years old. 

Her husband’s name is A. M. and he operates two businesses. He runs a grocery store in the market through which he offers daily use items to his clients, which include cooking oil, rice, sugar and spices, etc., and he has also put seasonal vegetables outside of his shop to sell to his clients.
 
Saima has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s businesses. With the loan, he will buy groceries and some seasonal vegetables which will help him in increasing his sales and in earning a good income as well. He has been in this business for over ten years, and Saima is hopeful that this investment will be a profitable one for him. 

She is a new loan user of Asasah. She is confident that the loan investment will help her husband in improving his business conditions which will help her family to live a better life. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Saima.

loans.use: To buy groceries and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 26 años, vive con su esposo en su casa propia. Se dedica a la agricultura desde que era niña, pero desde hace 3 años decidió cultivar de manera independiente junto con su esposo. En la actualidad esta a cargo de sus terrenos y contrata peones para sembrar y cosechar los productos que llevará a vender al mercado central de su ciudad, o como también hay personas que ofrecen comprar todo el terreno ya cultivado, pero depende de Elizabeth cual es mejor opción de elegir siempre y cuando recure la inversión y pueda ganar a la vez. Para el futuro desea tener más terrenos de cultivo y aumentar  la cantidad de semillas a sembrar. Es el crédito número 5  con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes y semillas para la próxima siembra de maíz.
texts.en: Elizabeth is 26-years-old and lives with her husband in their own house. She has been working in agriculture since she was a child. For the past three years she has been working independently with her husband. Actually, she is in charge of the land. She hires workers to plant and harvest products that she brings to the central market of her city to sell. There are people who wish to buy all of the products on her cultivated land.  It is up to Elizabeth to decide on the best alternative for her products. She looks at which option will give her the greatest profit. This is her fifth loan with MFP. She is very happy to have financial support. She has always been responsible with her payments. Also, she is grateful to the community bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people. She is grateful to the people that provide her with this loan that she is requesting, as it will be very helpful with her business. With this loan that she is requesting, she will buy fertilizer and seeds for cultivating corn.

loans.use: She will buy fertilizer and corn seed.

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Mr. Long P., born in 1982, is a villager who lives in Preaek Hour Kaeut village in Kandal province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he grows rice for a living. In order to support his farming business, he is requesting a loan so that he can add to his savings in order to eventually buy two oxen to help him plow his rice field. 

His wife, Mrs. Hean Chanthorn, earns a small income as a vegetable seller in the local market. The couple has a small child who is still too young to study or work.

loans.use: To add to his savings in order to eventually buy two oxen to help him plow his rice field

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr: Dame  Adjowa  est  mariée.   Elle  a  28  ans  et  habite  quartier  Baguida.  Elle exerce  la  vente  de charbons de  bois à la devanture de sa  maison.  Elle  cumule dans  cette  activité  10 ans d’expérience et achète  ses  marchandises à Tsévié.  Elle  demande  un prêt  pour  acheter  4  sacs de charbons de  bois et de ce fait  satisfaire  beaucoup  de  clients.
texts.en: Dame  Adjowa is 28 years old, married and lives in the Baguida quarter. She sells charcoal from her home, and has been involved in this business for ten years. She purchases these goods from Tsévié. She is seeking a loan in order to purchase four bags of charcoal, thereby satisfying her customers' growing demand.

loans.use: purchasing charcoal

loans.name: Dalia

texts.en: Dalia is a 33-year-old married woman with two children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in product for 2 years. She started by selling 4 bags of coffee per month and now sells 9 bags of coffee per month. Her challenge is high coffee prices. Her vision is setting up a coffee store. Dalia intends to use the loan to buy coffee.

loans.use: to buy coffee

loans.name: Ulmas

texts.en:
Ulmas is 47 years old. She is married and she has three children. Her husband works as a builder. She is a hardworking woman who trades in the market winter, summer and autumn slippers. Ulmas buys the goods from the Dushanbe, Korvon market.

She has been in this business for 20 years. She has a good location in the central market and her products sell well, and she often travels to buy new goods. Ulmas would like to get a loan of 6,500 Somoni to purchase new goods for expansion of her business and commodity circulation. Her greatest wish for the future is to keep improving her house and for her children to have good careers.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy slippers

loans.name: Buraima's Group

texts.en:
Buraima M., 65, is the leader of this group. She is one of the respectable women in her local community, and has forty years of experience in cattle breeding and dairy business. She has lived in her hometown of Aravan for sixty-five years and knows best of all the pleasant conditions for cattle breeding that this area provides. Many head of cattle have passed through her care. 

Nowadays she owns a cow with a calf. It yields fresh milk every morning which she distributes to her regular customers. Buraima remembers how, being a young lady in 1971, she started with the purchase of her first cow, in which she put big hopes, and spent the last savings in her family budget. At that time, she and her husband were a young couple and her husband was farmer. Since that time, milk products bring in a significant portion of Buraima’s income. 

Thanks to those financial assets, she raised three kids, helped with their employment and finished major repairing at her house. She invests her monthly income of about $215 back into her business. This time she needs some financial assistance in purchasing one more cow. In future she dreams of having a large fruit orchard. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase another cow

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rene J., 50, is a single man from the village of Brgy. Barat, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. 

He has been a farmer for 30 years. He plants and harvests variety of vegetables for sale. With these activities he earns 4,000 PHP a month.

He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to be used in his farming activities. He will use the amount to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raised. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raised.

loans.name: Oxidio

texts.pt:
Oxidio André Cuco nasceu na Cidade da Matola, Provincia de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, tem 29 anos de idade vive maritalmente pai de 4 filhos de  2 aos 12 anos. os três primeiros é que vão a escola. Fez 8ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições finaceiras. Vive na casa própria com sua familia e sustenta sua mãe enviando lhe diheiro ou sexta básica mensalmente no valor de 1000.00mt.

 Muda se para Distrito de Namaacha com seus pais que foram transferidos numa missão de serviço. Ele junta se com sua esposa e fixa sua residência. Trababalha no Minicipio da vila há 1 ano como seguranca, em turnos das 7:00h as 20:00h no periodo da manha e das 20:00h as 7:00h no periodo da noite  tem um salário de 2,080,00mt  que aplica nas dispesas da casa e ainda poupa algum porque conta com ajuda da sua esposa que trabalha nas aguas da namaacha.


Nunca teve empréstimos em outros Bancos, conhece a Hluvuku atraves do seus amigos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e segundo com Kiva no valor de 15,000,00mt com aqual pretende comprar material de construção(cimento, barrotes e chapas de zinco) para dar continuidade da sua obra.o empréstimo anterior foi de (7.000.00 e 10.000.00)mt para a obra que agora se encontra numa fase de acabamentos.

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tenpo previsto  para poder aceder a outros para construção de um estabelecimto de vanda de produtos comestiveis aumentando assim a renda familiar.
texts.en:
Oxidio André Cuco was born in the city of Matola, state of Maputo in southern Mozambique. He is 29 years old, cohabites with his girlfriend, and has 4 children, aged from 2 to 12 years old. Three of them attend school. He droped school after concluding 8th grade due to financial lack of conditions.He owns the house they live in. He also supports his mother, sending her money or supplies in the amount of 1000.00mt/month (33$).

He moved to the district of Namaacha with his parents who were relocated due to professional reasons. He then went to live with his current wife. He works at Town's Hall for a year as a security guard, working shifts from 7am to 8pm or 8pm to 7am. He has a monthly income of 2,080,00mt (68,63$) which he applies in housing expenses, and still manages to save some, because his wife works at Namaacha Water Company and helps with the expenses.

He never asked for any other loan. He got to know Hluvuku through his colleagues who are also clients of this institution. This is his third loan at Hluvuku and second one at Kiva, in the amount of 15,000,00mt (500$), with which he plans to buy construction materials (cement, beams and zinc plates) to proceed with the building of his house. His previous loans (231$ and 330$) were used in the building of his house which is almost finished.

He is confident that he will be able to pay the loan before deadline, so he can then ask for another loans to build a grocery store to increase his family's income.

loans.use: buy construction materials (cement, beams and zinc plates)

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Caroline has a business of selling clothes, which she has had for two years.  She also has a second business of arts and crafts.  

To help expand her business, Caroline has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Caroline hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Caroline hopes to expand both of her businesses.   Caroline is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her get more capital to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 65 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Yolanda is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Yolanda has been raising pigs for seven years and earns additional income from buying and selling  petroleum products.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy more feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.

Rosalie has a shop that sells snacks, beverages and canned goods. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy snacks, canned goods and beverages.

Rosalie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rosalie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, canned goods and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new welding machine & spare parts

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is from the village of Didi Jikhaishi, West Georgia. She is 44 years old, married and lives with her family:  husband, Victor; 16-year-old son and 76-year-old father. Nana works as a foreign language teacher in a local school. Victor serves in the army. Nana’s son goes to school and her father is retired. 

Nana is running the agricultural business of the family. They have six milk cows and two calves. She sells approximately 120 kg of cheese per month at a local open market. Also, the family owns a pig and sells 12 - 14 piglets per month. Nana’s husband works in the family-owned cornfield, where 2 - 3 tonnes of maize are harvested for the season. The total harvest is used on the farm for feeding the animals. 

With the requested loan, Nana plans to purchase construction materials for a new cattle shed. The existing one is already too small and doesn’t allow Nana to plan future expansion of the family’s farming activities. In the future, Nana is going to purchase additional cows so she can produce and sell more cheese. In a year, Nana will need more financial resources, as she will have to pay school fees for her son.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for cattle shed construction.

loans.name: Xochilt Maria

texts.es: Xochilt Maria es una persona muy emprendedora y se siente muy feliz. Su actividad es la venta de cerámica disfruta de realizar este tipo de actividad. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos para mejorar su negocio la mayoría de sus clientes saben que ofrece muy buenos servicios, pues siempre esta preocupándose por satisfacer la demanda. El crédito es para la compra de azulejos de porcelana, cuadros, ladrillos, entre otros productos  pues actualmente tiene bastante demanda.
texts.en:
Xochilt Maria is a cheerful and enterprising individual. She sells ceramic tiling and enjoys being in this type of business. This is not the first time she has received financing in order to improve her business. Most of her customers know her because she offers good service. Xochilt Maria is always concerned about being able to meet the demand.

This loan will be used to buy porcelain tiles, frames, bricks, and other products that are currently in great demand.

loans.use: to purchase porcelain tiles, frames, bricks, and other products.

loans.name: Margot

texts.es:
Margot, de 25 años, es una joven madre de familia muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 02 queridos hijos Nalyz de 08 y Rubén de 05 años de edad, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Los arduos trabajos que realiza Margot en su chacra, han hecho que sus cultivos estén muy bien cuidados y que los días de venta en la ciudad de San Francisco, sus productos sean rápidamente comprados. Su principal fuentes de ingresos son la venta de cacao, café y plátano, ya que son frutos de muy buena su calidad.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, lleva 05 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es deshierbar la maleza que crece en su campos agrícolas. Con el dinero del crédito contratará jornaleros para acelerar el trabajo en la cosecha. Con el tiempo, desea adquirir nuevas tierras, para ampliar sus cultivos. Este es el noveno crédito con MFP, por lo que espera el apoyo de todos ustedes. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, contratará jornaleros para que lo apoyen en la cosecha.
texts.en:
Margot, 25, is a young mother who is very simple and hardworking. She lives in her own home with her two cherished children - Nalyz, 8, and Ruben, 5 - to whom she hopes to give a better quality of life. The hard work that Margot has done on her farm means that her crops are very well cared for and that her products sell quickly on market days in the city of San Francisco. Her main source of income is from selling cacao, coffee and plantains, because they are very high quality fruits. 

What she likes most about her job is the harvest. She has been doing this for 5 years and considers the most difficult aspect to be removing the grass and weeds that grow in her fields. With the money from the loan she will hire temporary workers to make the harvest go faster. With time, she hopes to acquire new lands to increase her crops. 

This is her 9th loan with MFP and she hopes for all of your support. With the 3000 nuevos soles that she has requested, she will hire workers to help her with the harvest.

loans.use: to hire temporary workers.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “FUENTE D. VIDA” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito D. Huanchac, en la Provincia D. Cusco y Departamento D. Cusco.

La  socia Fortunata; tiene 54 años D. edad,  la socia es casada; la socia tiene 3 hijos los cuales son independientes; La  socia  trabaja con la venta D. alimentos ella tiene una picantería en la cual venD. todo tipo D. extras que son comidas típicas D. la región y también chica D. maíz llamada chicha D. jora, también la socia produce una chicha rosada a base D. frutillada la cual la llaman frutillada; La socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra D. carne y papas al por mayor para incrementar sus ventas. La socia solicita el préstamo en la compra D. papa al por mayor y carne para elaborar los diferentes platos.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir D. manera disciplinada con los pagos D. las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "FUENTE D. VIDA.” The bank is located in the District of Huanchac, in the Province of Cusco and the Departmento of Cusco.

The member Fortunata is 54 years old. She is married and has 3 children who are grown. She works selling food, and she has a restaurant in which she sells every type of special local cuisine and also corn drink called "chicha D. jora." She also makes a pink drink maD. from strawberries which is called "frutillada." She wants to invest the loan in the purchase of wholesale meat and potatoes to increase her sales. She asks for a loan to purchase wholesale potatoes and meat to prepare various entrees. 

She is grateful for the support which has been given to her and she also promises to comply with the terms of the agreement in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy wholesale potatoes and meat to prepare various dishes.

loans.name: Mirtha Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Mirtha tiene 38 años, vive en la ciudad de Concepción, tiene tres hijos menores, ella es separada hace mas de 5 años.
Ella tiene una peluquería, en la cual trabaja hace mucho tiempo, exactamente hace 5 años, es un negocio no muy grande pero bien surtido. Ella comenta que tiene muy buena clientela, puesto que ella es muy amable a la hora de tratar con los clientes. Se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, comenta que todo el sacrificio que realiza es por darle a sus hijos un futuro mejor al que ella pudo acceder, desea que ellos se conviertan en personas de bien y útiles a la sociedad.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos necesarios para el abastecimiento de su peluquería, como ser tintes, químicos, tijeras y otros, con lo cual podrá renovar sus equipos. Está agradecida con la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda, pues de obtener el crédito le será de mucha utilidad.
texts.en:
Mirtha, age 38, lives in the city of Concepción.  She has three minor children, and she has been separated for over five years.

She has a beauty salon, and she has worked there a long time, exactly five years.  It is not a very big business, but it is well stocked.  She says that she has very good customers because she is very nice when she deals with her customers.  She defines herself as a very hard-working and entrepreneurial woman.  She says that all of the sacrifice she makes is to give her children a better future than she was able to attain.  She wishes for her children to become good people who are useful to society.

She is requesting the loan to buy the supplies needed to stock her beauty salon.  She will buy things like dyes, chemicals, scissors, and others.  With these items she will be able to update her equipment.

She is grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity that they are offering her.  Getting the loan will be very useful to her.

loans.use: to buy things like dyes, scissors, and other supplies to stock her beauty parlor.

loans.name: Victor Raul

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “AMANECER ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Victor Raul; el tiene 55 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agricultura, el tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra papa,maíz,vainitas y tomates, el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en Mollepata y también el socio trabaja como docente en el nivel secundario, el socio por medio de su negocio y de su trabajo el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de agricultura y mejorar en su trabajo. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para las tierras de cultivo.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "Amanecer Anteña". The bank is located in the district of Anta, which is part of the province of Anta and the department of Cusco.
The member is Victor Raul. He is 55 years old, married, and has 3 children. He mixes his household responsibilities with an agricultural business. He has land where he sows potatoes, corn, green beans, and tomatoes. His land is located in Mollepata and he also works as a teacher at the secondary school. He is building a better life for his children by means of his work. He wants to grow and improve his agricultural business and to improve his job. He is requesting the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for his fields.
He is happy to receive this loan and promises to make the repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for his crop fields.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es: Rosa Elvira se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos, desde hace mas de 3 años que tiene este negocio es madre soltera tiene 4 hijos y solamente 1 de sus hijos esta a su cargo. Inicio este medio de vida por sus padres que le enseñaron este tipo de actividad para que ella pudiera obtener un medio de ingreso, actualmente ella esta enseñándoles a sus hijos  este negocio para que el día de mañana tengan su negocio propio. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de cerdos. Esta inversión le ayudara para superarse, a través del esfuerzo y el préstamo podrá conseguir una mejor condición.
texts.en: Rosa Elvira has worked for more than three years raising and selling pigs.  She is a single mother of four children and only one of her children is in her care.  She started this work when her parents taught her so that she would have a way to earn money.  She is currently teaching her children this work so that one day they can have their own business.  She is requesting this loan to purchase pigs.  This investment will help her overcome, and with effort and this loan, she will be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Jumanazar

texts.ru: Чуманазар примерный семьянин. У него трое детей и двое внуков. Его жена -  предпринимательница. Он вместе с сыном занимается откормом крупного и мелкого рогатого скота.  Он хочет увеличить свой скот и запастись кормом на зиму. Для этих целей ему надо получить займ и продвинуть свое дело намного вперед. Он надеется на получение займа.
texts.en: Jumanazar is an exemplary family man.  He has three children and two grandchildren.  His wife is an entrepreneur.  Together with his son he fattens cows and sheep/goats.  He would like to increase his livestock count and to stock up on feed for the winter.  For these goals he needs to get a loan and to move his business forward significantly.  He hopes that he will receive a loan.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and feed

loans.name: Basemera

texts.en:
Basemera is 46 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past seven years, Basemera has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells food and various household supplies. 

To help expand his business, Basemera has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food products like sugar and flour, and will help Basemera to generate greater profits and improve the quality of life for his family. Basemera hopes that in the future he will be able to turn his shop into a full grocery store. 

Basemera is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Basemera who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more food products like sugar and flour

loans.name: Baterdene

texts.en: Baterdene is 31 years old and lives alone in Ulaanbaatar City, Mongolia. He started his taxi service business in 2006 with his own car. Since then, he has renewed his car and bought a yard with the profit. Also, he runs a meat retailing business. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says "The cab business is pretty much the same everyday so I rented a counter at the market and hired somebody to run the business. It is going surprisingly well so I need to increase my supply in order to run my new business successfully". He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more meat.

loans.use: To purchase meat

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a coconut selling business, selling as retail to her neighbors and passersby. In addition she also operates a vegetable stall business, which contributes to her other source income. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business.

With this loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables for resale.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last four years. He is 25 years old, married to Ann, and they have one child.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy more cattle to boost his milk production as well as his farming.

In the future, John hopes to become a major dairy farmer and one of the leading distributors of milk to the milk-producing companies in Ndunyu Njeru and other towns.

loans.use: to buy dairy cattle.

loans.name: Tukazban

texts.en:
Tukazban is a 62-year-old farmer from the village of Birliki. She is married and lives with her husband and 29-year-old daughter-in-law.

Tukazban and her husband have a milk cow and two calves. The family sells milk in the village. They also have a plot of land where they grow greens. Tukazban sells their harvested greens in Tbilisi, Georgia’s capital. The family’s total average monthly income is 450 GEL.

Tukazban has requested a loan to purchase two calves. She will feed them for four months, then sell them at a higher price. This will bring in additional income for the family, which will be used to improve the family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase two calves.

loans.name: Gladiz Maruja

texts.es:
Gladiz es socia del Banco Comunal Pampachacra, es madre de un hijo, es socia de Finca Peru desde hace 14 años.
Gladiz se dedica a la venta de tara, cochinilla y abarrotes en Panpachacra, agradece mucho la ayuda que le brindan con semilla ayudan que las mujeres puedan salir adelante, invirtiéndolo bien en sus negocios, en su Banco Comunal aprendió como trabajar, logró comprarse un terreno en Mollepata, las capacitaciones le ayudan a poder valorarse, todo lo que se hace en Finca le ayudo a poder tener una buena familia, ahora con el préstamo que esta sacando lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Gladiz, the mother of a son, is a member of Pampachacra Communal Bank.  She has been a member of Finca Peru for 14 years.  Gladiz works selling tara [a tree native to Peru], cochineal, and groceries in Pampachacra.

She is very grateful for the help they offer with seed money.  They help so women are able to get ahead, investing well in their businesses.  In her communal bank she learned how to work.  She managed to buy herself a plot of land in Mollepata.  The instruction helps her to be able to assess herself.

Everything that is done in FINCA helped her to be able to have a good family.

With the loan she is getting now she will invest in buying groceries.

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Tabetta

texts.en:
Tabetta is a 34-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She has had a business selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Tabetta is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more fish for resale. She will use the extra income she earns as a result of this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Hajar

texts.en:
Hajar is a 22 year old married woman from Al Aqaba Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to pay for her home improvements, She wants to maintenance of the rooms and to buy a new furniture. In the future she hopes to expand her home. 
Sinc Hajar is under 30 year old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to bay for her home improvements

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es: Es un señor amable de 48 años de edad, casado con 3 hijos en edad escolar. Trabaja desde hace 25 años como docente de educación primaria en esa área laboral. Debido a su bajo salario y a la urgencia de comprar uniformes para su trabajo y cubrir los gastos de graduación de uno de sus hijos. Solicita financiamiento para comprar telas, para la elaboración de sus uniformes y cubrir los costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es construirle a su familia una vivienda de concreto, ya que es de mayor durabilidad.

loans.use: para comprar telas, para la elaboración de sus uniformes y cubrir los costos de mano de obra

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is 61 years old, married with two children.

Ma. Fe works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, spices, coffee, drinks, noodles, snack foods and etc.

Ma. Fe has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Ma. Fe aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, spices, coffee, drinks, noodles, snack foods and etc

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Auntie Emily lives in Dodowa in the Dangme West District of Ghana and operates in a High School Community as a food vendor. Due to the delicious meals and the hygienic conditions under which she prepares her meals, students and the general public take delight in her meals. she has received training on good health and sanitation from KSF to enable her attract customers. She supplies to a large group and therefore needs a loan of $750.00 from kiva. She also attended training sessions on good loan management and record keeping from KSF.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria Paula Martina

texts.en:
Maria Paula has been in sales for 23 years. It was her inability to provide for her basic necessities that motivated her to work as a street vendor. After much work and dedication, she was able to rent a shop space in the market in Mérida and that is how she was able to have her own business. She has a 20 year-old son and this business has allowed Maria to support her family all this time. They have been difficult times, but with love and the strength of her family they have been able to conquer all adversities.

Maria requires a loan in the amount of $250, which she will use to buy inventory for her store in order to offer better variety and increase her sales. You can be part of the growth of this business. Have no doubt, you can help someone in need.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 23 años la señora Maria Paula se dedica a las ventas, la falta de recursos para satisfacer sus necesidades fue lo que la impulsó a trabajar como vendedora ambulante, después, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, le fue posible rentar un local en el mercado de Mérida y así es como logró tener su propio negocio. Ella tiene un hijo de 20 años y este negocio le ha permitido a Maria sustentar a su familia todo este tiempo. Han sido tiempos difíciles, pero el amor y la unión de la familia han podido vencer todas las adversidades.

Ahora Maria requiere un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 250 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para su local, para ofrecer una mayor variedad e incrementar sus ventas. Tú puedes ser parte del crecimiento de este negocio, puedes ayudar a quien mas lo necesita, no lo dudes.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her store

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya has been able to combine her love of the outdoors with her small business where she sells hats and assorted outdoor clothing. An avid skier and mountain climber, she has enjoyed working for herself and having the flexibility to pursue her outdoor activities. She has developed a stable and profitable enterprise in the twelve years she has been in business. Currently, she has about $2000 worth of inventory on hand and makes around $400 each month.

In a typical month, Nataliya will buy new inventory twice a month. She has requested a loan to give her some extra capital to use for purchasing new supplies of hats and coats. She hopes to see a profitable summer season and would like to be prepared with an adequate amount of inventory to meet the demand.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en: Ludmila P. is a hard-working entrepreneur from Pavlograd, Ukraine. After losing her husband in an accident, Ludmila decided to leave her previous job and start her own business. She has been self-employed for five years now. Her business provides the only income for Ludmila and her 15-year-old daughter. Despite difficult circumstances, Ludmila has done well with her business. A convenient location for her store and her energetic attitude and respect for her customers have been keys to her success. Ludmila would like to continue developing her business and has requested a loan for $1,000 to help her purchase new shoes so that she can expand her product selection.

loans.use: Purchase inventory for shoe sales.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses started his business of selling children’s clothes in 2003 after the civil war.  He started by selling second-hand clothes but with his previous loans he was able to change over to imported clothes from China.  Those loans enabled him to increase his stock and he is now requesting a  loan of US$ 200 to purchase women's clothes.  Moses is a thirty-year-old father of two children. He says his customers have been requesting him to include adult clothes and he would like to take the opportunity to do so.

loans.use: Diversify the clothing he sells so that he can better satisfy his customers' demand

loans.name: Suiti

texts.en: Suiti is 42 year old mother from Puipaa Center. She has 4 children, 2 of whom are in school and 2 of whom are working. She runs a plantation of fresh vegetable and sells her produce at the Fugalei market. She was able to purchase the seeds of various kinds of vegetables, mainly cabbages, tomatoes and cucumber, which she was trained to pot. She sells at the market 2 day a week, on Wednesdays and Fridays. She can earn $100 after all costs are deducted, which she uses to support her family and pay back her loans.  Her husband helps her with the vegetable business and also works as a carpenter. He is a foreman and can earn $112 a week. Suiti is applying for a $500 loan to expand her vegetable garden and to help her pay for kids’ school fees.

loans.use: To buy equipment and supplies for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Hadia

texts.en: Hadia is 31 years old  and lives in the Bekaa with her husband, who suffers from a physical handicap. Hadia owns a grocery shop which is the main source of income for her family. She  is requesting a loan with which to buy merchandise for her store. This is the second time Hadia is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Loutfi

texts.en: Loutfi is 67 years old and lives with his family in the Borj Barajneh region of Lebanon. Loutfi owns a shoe store, and has applied for a loan to buy more merchandise to sell to his customers. This is his fifth loan from Al Majmoua, and we are proud of the way our loans have allowed him to provide for his family and expand his business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Icah

texts.en: Icah is 33, married, and has two children. Everyday, she goes door-to-door to sell household goods on credit, earning $15.00 a week. Her husband is a butcher at the market who earns $15.00 a day. She will use this loan to expand her business.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Tuhfa

texts.en:
S. Tuhfa is a 46-year-old married woman and has three children. Tuhfa works in a tailoring shop sewing the national quilts. Her shop is well known in the neighborhood. As a result of this she gets lots of orders. Tuhfa has been in this business for 25 years. The business has been successful and generates a stable income allowing Tuhfa to contribute a significant amount to the family budget.

Tuhfa wishes to purchase additional materials required for the production of the quilts. With this purpose she's requesting $1000 for a term of 12 months. Tuhfa expresses her gratitude to everyone that's supporting her and promises to manage the loan with accuracy.

loans.use: To purchase fabric for sewing the national quilts.

loans.name: Zehra

texts.en: Zehra was born in 1959 and she is married. Her husband has a private job and his monthly income is 950,00KM. They have 2 children. Zehra wants to use this loan of 700,00KM ($575 USD) to buy poultry, in order to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: For buying poultry.

loans.name: Marta Mayra

texts.es:
Ms. Marta C. is a 49-year-old widow who lives in the Sabana Grande neighborhood. She has a 30-year-old daughter who lives with her and helps out with the family expenses. She makes “cosa de horno” (sweet corn bread) for a living. With 35 years of experience, this delicious corn bread business has become a tradition in her family.

She started making the bread at a young age. Her mother passed on her cooking tools to her so that she could get ahead in life, and she has been able to do so despite the difficulties that always emerge along the way.

With this loan, she intends to purchase the ingredients necessary to make her sweet corn bread, thus increasing her sales. One of her short-term goals is to repair the oven she currently uses since it has been in use for over 50 years. She would also like to help her daughter raise her grandson and give leave them a good inheritance.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Marta tiene 49 años de edad, habita en el barrio Sabana Grande, es viuda y tiene una hija de 30 años de edad que vive con ella y con quien comparte los gastos familiares. Su actividad es la elaboración de cosa de horno, ella tiene 35 años de experiencia en el negocio que ha sido tradicional en la familia la elaboración de este rico hornado.

Comenzó desde muy pequeña y su mamá le heredo las herramientas para que siguiera adelante, y lo ha podido hacer pese a las dificultades que siempre salen en el camino.

Con el préstamo pretende comprar materia prima para ampliar el nivel de venta. Uno de sus planes a corto plazo es poder remodelar el horno que actualmente usa, porque éste ya tiene más de 50 años de uso. También desea poder ayudar a su hija en la crianza de su nieto, y poder dejarles un buen patrimonio a ambos.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make sweet corn bread

loans.name: Bianeth

texts.es:
Bianeth and Roberto are a young married couple and are parents of an enchanting girl named Anaí, who is the light in their eyes and the driving force that pushes them to make progress. Bianeth sells fruit in the small towns that border the city of Juliaca and, with this business, is able to cover an important part of her household expenses. While she does this, her husband Roberto works as a construction supervisor. Both are making an effort and are succeeding at improving their quality of life. In addition to these professions, this diligent couple rents out tricycles, earning income that is important for the well-being of their home. Bianeth would like to increase the variety and quality of her products and is certain that making this investment will optimize her income.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

Bianeth y Roberto, son una pareja de esposos jóvenes y padres de una encantadora niña llamada Anaí, quien es la luz de sus ojos y el motor que los impulsa a progresar, Bianeth se dedica a la venta de frutas en los pueblitos aledaños a la ciudad de Juliaca y encontró en este negocio la manera de cubrir parte importante de las necesidades de su hogar. Mientras ella se dedica a esta labor su esposo Roberto trabaja como maestro de construcción y entre ambos con esfuerzo están logrando mejorar su calidad de vida, adicionalmente a estos oficios esta diligente pareja se dedica al alquiler de triciclos, obteniendo ingresos indispensables para el bienestar de su hogar. Bianeth tiene en mente aumentar la variedad y calidad de sus productos y está segura que haciendo esta inversión optimizará sus ingresos.

loans.use: To raise capital to increase her merchandise and profits

loans.name: José Bismarck

texts.es:
José Bismarck lives in the neighborhood 3-80 of Managua, a poor area lacking basic necessities such as a sewage system. José is married and has a 6 year old son, whom he has to watch over, especially his health.

As a result, José Bismarck needs a loan to install a sewage system in his house. Currently, José deposits the sewage in the patio or in the street like the rest of his neighbors, but this is a problem because the sewage brings disease.

Two years ago, José Bismarck began working as a solicitor for a private company. During these two years he has been able to improve his house and hopes to continue working so that he can offer the best to his son.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

José Bismarck habita en el barrio 3-80 de Managua, un barrio pobre y carente de servicios básicos como aguas negras. José es casado y tiene un pequeño de 6 años, por el cual tiene que velar y sobre todo garantizar salud.

Es por eso que José Bismarck necesita el préstamo porque quiere invertir en la instalación de aguas negras en su casa de habitación, ya que actualmente las aguas residuales las tiene que regar en el patio o regarla en la calle al igual que todos sus vecinos, y esto es un problema para su familia ya que esto conlleva enfermedades.

José Bismarck desde hace 2 años se ha venido desempeñando com gestor de cobro en una empresa privada. Y durante estos dos años ha venido mejorando su casa, y espera poder tener siempre trabajo para darle lo lo mejor a su hijo.

loans.use: Install an in-house sewage system

loans.name: Rosa Guadalupe

texts.es:
Rosa is married with 3 children, Juan Roberto (5), Edga Oziel (9) and Jessica Berenice (14). Her husband works in construction. She began her business 1 year ago through a friend whom invited her to make tortillas in her house which they would later sell to a local store.

Rosa needs a $500 loan which she will repay in 6 months to remodel her business. With your support Rosa will finish on top.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa esta casada, su esposo trabaja en una constructora y tiene tres hijos de 5 , 9 y 14 años, que se llaman Juan Roberto, Edgar Oziel y Jessica Berenice. Inicio su negocio hace un año por una amiga que la invito a asociarse haciendo tortillas en su casa que después le vendían a una tienda cercana a su domicilio.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para remodelar su negocio, con tu apoyo Rosa saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Remodel her business

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es:
La Señora Ingrid, socia del Banco Comunal “Maria Auxiliadora”, vive en la región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de pasamanería en general y ropa. El negocio lo realiza en el puesto de venta que tiene en el mercado “Las Palmeritas Nº 01”, de la ciudad donde acuden  diariamente los clientes para adquirir sus productos.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual pagará en 06 meses, comprará  productos como relojes de diferentes marcas y modelos para damas, caballeros y niños, sandalias también de diferentes tallas modelos y colores, calculadoras, ropas para damas, caballeros y niños, para surtir el negocio y cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes.

Ingrid tiene 24 años, se considera una mujer muy entusiasta y trabajadora. La  meta en el futuro es contar con un local mas amplio para surtir bien el negocio, quiere que sus clientes se sientan cómodos y a gusto cuando la visiten.
texts.en:
Ingrid, a member of the Community Bank 'Maria Auxiliadora', lives in the region and province of San Martin, in the district of Tarapoto. She sells general tassels and braids, and clothes. She sells from her market stall in the market 'Las Palmeritas Nº 01' in the city where most of her clients come from daily to buy her products.

With the loan of $1000, which she will repay over a period of 6 months, she will buy products like different makes and types of watch for women, men and children, as well as sandals of different makes and colors, calculators and women's, men's and kid's clothing to stock out her business and meet the needs of her clients.

Ingrid is 24 years old and she is considered to be an enthusiastic and hard working woman. Her aim in the future is to have a bigger store to stock her business out well, and she wants her clients to feel comfortable and pleased when they visit.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy watches, sandals, women's and men's clothing/Compra de relojes, sandalias, ropa para damas y caballeros, etc.

loans.name: Ismayil

texts.en: Ismayil was born in 1980 and lives in Baku city. He is a young man, who is not married. Ismayil has been in the business for 3 years. He is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy the hardware necessary to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy hardware to improve his business

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr:
BABACAR S. HABITE AU QUARTIER NDAYANE DE DIOURBEL. IL EXCERCE COMME ACTIVITE LE COMMERCE DE ¨RODUITS COSMETIQUES DEPUIS 15 ANS. 
AVEC LE PRET IL COMPTE RENFORCER SES ACTIVITES. IL EST MARIE.
texts.en:
Babacar S. lives in the Ndayane district of Diourbel. He has been selling cosmetics for 15 years.

With the loan, he intends to bolster his business. He is married.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolstering his working capital

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the Generosidad (“Generosity”) Village Bank. She is 43 years old and is married with four children. Sonia is involved in several businesses and works, depending on market demand, in different areas. She travels to regional villages and buys vegetables and grains from local producers. She resells her wares at the Abastos Market in the city of Ayacucho. She also has a market stall in the city of Huanta.

Sonia also produces firewood: she buys the trees from villagers and transports the wood to the city of Lima. Sonia needs a loan of 3000 soles to buy vegetables. Sonia dreams that her children will graduate with professional degrees, of having her own investment capital, and of building her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal Generosidad. Sonia es casada, tiene 43 años y 4 hijos, Sonia realiza diferentes negocios dependiendo de la demanda, Sonia viaja a los diferentes pueblos de la región y compra de los productores, verduras, cereales, sus ventas los realiza en un puesto propio del mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, también tiene un puesto en el mercado de la ciudad de Huanta. Además Sonia manda hacer leña, compra árboles en los pueblos y luego lo transporta a la ciudad de Lima. Sonia necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de verduras. Sonia sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener capital propio y construir su casa.

loans.use: Buy vegetables for re-sale

loans.name: Sopheach's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sopheach K. is the group leader for four people who all live in Choeung Khnar village in Kampong Chhnang province. She and her husband, Mr. Sen Sophal, are pig breeders. Since their pigs are getting bigger and bigger, they do not have enough money to feed them. Thus, Mrs. Sopheach K. decided to ask for a loan to add to her own money to purchase more pig feed for her pig-breeding business. She is 46 years old and the mother of three children who are attending the local school.

loans.use: to purchase more pig feed for her pig-breeding  business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine E. sells beef. She has been in this business for a long time. She is married with three children.

Josephine is requesting a loan of 120,000 to purchase more beef to sell. By expanding her business, she hopes to increase her profit margin. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more beef to sell

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina es socia del Banco Comunal Corrí Ayllu que significa Familia de Oro en quechua.
Catalina es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 3 hijos, Catalina tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, cerveza, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Catalina realiza tejidos de chompas de acuerdo al pedido de sus clientes.
Catalina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Catalina son mejorar su negocio y tener una bodega surtida.
texts.en:
Catalina is a member of the “Corrí Ayllu” Communal Bank, which means Golden Family in Quechua. Catalina is married, is 35 years old, and has 3 children. Catalina has a store in her home where every day she sells groceries and beer. In addition Catalina knits sweaters according to her client’s requests. Catalina needs a loan for 1000 soles to invest in buying rice and sugar. Catalina dreams of improving her business and having a well-stocked store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru:
Гадоева  Саодат закончила свой очередной займ , и подала заявку на очередной кредит. Она хочет использовать его на закуп весеннего ассортимента тканей. Её точка продажи расположена в центре рынка тканей. Её товар пользуется хорошим спросом. За товаром Саодат ездит в Бишкек сама два раза в месяц.
.
texts.en:
Saodat G. has paid off her last loan and applied for another one. She wants to use it to buy an assortment of fabrics for the spring. Her vendor space is located in the center of the fabrics market. Her merchandise is in high demand. Saodat travels to Bishkek by herself to buy merchandise twice a month.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Azucena

texts.es:
AZUCENA B. D. RODRÍGUEZ, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Atenas Portillanas” con domicilio ubicado en el AA.HH. Pedro Portillo Mz. I Lt. 29  tiene 45 anios y 4 hijos, su esposo trabaja en un Hotel.

	Ella se encuentra trabajando desD. el 2002, con Manuela Ramos, y el primer préstamo que tuvo fue D. S/. 300 nuevos soles, con el que dio comienzo a su actividad en ventas D. comida, y debido a la atención amable que reciben sus clientes, siempre están acudiendo a su pequeño local, en un tiempo comenta ella que estuvo en el negocio D. moto taxis, pero no le resulto, por lo que siguió con las comidas.
	
	El préstamo D. S/. 1,500 nuevos soles, que invertirá en la compra D. vajilla, mesas, e insumos para sus platos, también comprará mesas, sillas y ambientara su local.
texts.en:
Azucena B. D. Rodríguez is a member of the communal bank “Las Atenas Portillanas”, and resides in the Pedro Portillo Martinez district, Lot 29. She is 45 years old, has four children, and her husband works in a hotel.

She has been working since 2002 with Manuela Ramos, and her first loan was for 300 PEN with which she began selling meals. Owing to the friendly attention that her customers receive, they are always coming to her small location. At another time she tells us that she had a business of motorcycle taxis, but it did not have results, so she started selling meals.

The loan of 1,500 PEN will be invested in the purchase of plates, tables, and food for her dishes. She will also buy tables, chairs and liven up her location.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of plates, tables, and to improve the ambience of her location

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị M. 45 tuổi. Gia đình chị có 3 con trong đó có 2 con đã trưởng thành và 1 con đang đi học. Năm 2006 chị thma gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Hiện tại đây vẫn là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị với thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để tiếp tục đầu tư cho công việc chăn nuôi lợn của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs Nguyen Thi M. is 45 years old. She has 3 children, 2 of them are grown-ups and the youngest one is still going to school. In 2006, she joined TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) and borrowed money to invest in raising pigs. Currently this is the main source of income for her family, which is about 2,000,000 VND per month (or 117 USD per month). Mrs. M. would like to borrow 9,000,000 VND (or 600 USD) to continue to invest in raising pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Eley Yamileth

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León la señora Eley M. se dedica arduamente a trabajar para lograr su sueño de reconstruir su vivienda el cual a raíz de los años se ha venido deteriorando y hoy en día necesita reconstrucción.

Hoy en día ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción y así continuar con el mantenimiento de su vivienda y el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
In the Telica municipality, in León City, Mrs. Eley M. is working arduously to achieve her dream of reconstructing her home. With the passage of time her house has deteriorated. Now, it needs reconstruction. She is aking Ceprodel for a loan to buy construction materials. This way she can continue with her home maintenance and impact her family’s well being.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Rorn

texts.en: Rorn S. is forty-nine years old and lives with his forty-eight-year-old wife, Vet Ren. They grow vegetables on their plot of land, from which they earn $2 a day. Vet Ren buys additional vegetables that she sells at the local market in their provincial town, making approximately $5 a day. This provides them with a moderate standard of living and also supports the education of their three children. They would like a loan to buy a motorbike and a trailer to transport large amounts of vegetables to their stand at the market. He hopes that he can expand his business over time, and that he will be able to build a new house and pay for further education for their children.

loans.use: To buy a trailer and motorbike for transporting vegetables to market.

loans.name: Mkasi

texts.en:
Mkasi has been a retail saleswoman in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for 5 years. She sells different items like charcoal, firewood, clothes and other items, She belongs to Tuew sote imara group loan (Group code 2050). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately US$ 80. Every day she works at her business for 9 hours.

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal, firewood, clothes and other items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Mkasi is married, and has two children, ages 10 and 8.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal, firewood, clothes, and other items for her business

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is single and has no children. Currently she is dependent and lives in a rented apartment.  
She lives in Sefwi in the western region of Ghana. She is a 26-year-old trader who trades in clothing materials. She is a very hardworking young lady who works very hard to cater to herself and her business. She trades in garment cloth and lace materials. This is a business she has done for seven years. Lace material is very useful in room and office decorations. She treks to Kumasi to buy her stock of goods. For lack of adequate working capital, Millicent buys a few stocks of lace materials and garment cloth and sells through hawking. She sells her goods through hawking and she does that during the market days in the surrounding communities. For this reason she requests loan support to make business progress. She believes the loan will enable her to grow her business to the expected level. With the loan, she wants to purchase in bulk lace materials, garment cloths and textiles. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Doduo’, which means plenty.

loans.use: To purchase products in bulk

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es: Raúl tiene 27 años, es un hombre sereno y responsable, vive con la madre de su único hijo en la casa de su tía. Desde niño se dedica a la siembra y cuidado de sus plantas y ahora con su pareja se han propuesto trabajar en mutuo acuerdo porque tienen anhelos de progresar mediante sus cultivos. Por ello, han alquilado chacras donde sembrarán papas y arvejas y por las cuales pagarán entre 280 a 340 soles por cada siembra. Asimismo, se han inscrito en los terrenos de la comunidad para que en años posteriores puedan pasar a ser copropietarios. Raúl está muy contento con sus trabajos agrícolas, por ello que se levanta muy temprano para que a las 8 de la mañana ya deba estar iniciando sus labores, mientras que su esposa le da el alcance después con el almuerzo. De realizar muy buenas cosechas esta temporada, espera tener la oportunidad de comprar terrenos de fácil acceso para los carros y así evitar mucho trabajo con el transporte durante los meses de cosecha. Sus compañeros de banco comunal ingresan al noveno crédito con MFP, mientras que él se incorporó después y para este 5to préstamo hace el compromiso de seguir pagando con puntualidad sus cuotas. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para su siembra de papa.
texts.en:
Raúl is 27 years old, is a calm and responsible man, and lives with the mother of his only son in his aunt’s house. Since he was a child, he has worked in agriculture and has taken care of his plants. Now, he and his partner have decided to work together because they want to go forward by means of their crops. For this, they have rented farms, where they will sow potatoes and peas. They will pay between 280 and 340 soles for each planting. At the same time, they have joined the community lands so that in later years they will be able to become co-proprietors. Raúl is very happy with his agricultural work. For this, he wakes up very early so that at 8 in the morning he can begin his work, and he catches up with his wife at lunch. To achieve very good harvests this season, he hopes to have the opportunity to buy land that is easily accessible by cars, so that he can avoid transportation work during the harvest months. Though he joined later, his peers at the community bank got their ninth loan from MFP. For this, his fifth loan, he will continue paying his installments punctually. The money he is requesting will be invested to buy chemical fertilizers for his potato crop.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: William De Los Reyes

texts.es: El señor William Sánchez M. tiene  37 años de edad, es casado y actualmente tiene un hijo el cual es menor de edad.  Su esposa labora en una zona franca  por lo que ambos trabajan para mejorar la vida de sus hijos. El señor William M. posee un negocio de venta de productos veterinarios, los cuales vende en la zona norte del país. Don William Sánchez dio inicio a su negocio hace 4 años, porque tuvo la necesidad de sustentar a su familia.
