These are the local designs of the area. Pascuala also has a small business in her house in which she sells fruits and vegetables to the people in her community. The rest of the ladies in the group sell their jewelry to the local stores and among tourists that visit the area.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer

PASCUALA AL IGUAL QUE LA OTRAS INTEGRANTES DE SU GRUPO TRABAJA COMO ARTESANA CONFECCIONANDO MANTELES , COJINES, SERVILLETAS Y POSTERIORMENTE LAS BORDA CON LOS DISEÑOS TIPICOS QUE CARACTERIZAN LOS BORDADOS DE LA ZONA DONDE ELLA VIVE .ADEMAS PASCUALA TIENE UN PEQUEÑO NEGOCIO EN SUS CASDA DONDE VENDE FRUTAS Y VERDURAS A LAS PERSONAS DE SU COMUNIDAD . EL RESTO DE LAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO COMERCIALIZAN SUS PRENDAS ARTESANALES ENTRE LOS TURISTAS QUE VISITAN LA ZONA

loans.use: Purchase of  knitting materials for wholesale and materials to make their own jewelry

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Mrs. Felicia I. is 70 years old and married with 9 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She needs the loan of $525 to buy more goats for sale. She has been in business since1987.

loans.use: To buy more goats for sale

loans.name: Kit

texts.en: Mrs. Kit V., 52, is married with 5 children and works as a farmer making on average about $3.50 a day of profit. Her husband, Mr. Ka Sa, 54, owns a plot of land growing a variety of vegetables and normally earns around $2 a day. This couple has five children. Two are car mechanics earning around $200 a month and three others are students. This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase a plot of land to grow some vegetables in order to gain more profit. In the future, this couple plans to open a garage for their son.

loans.use: This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase a plot of land to grow more vegetables.

loans.name: Budumuli East A E Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Rose B.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to purchase a fridge and add more stock. Rose is 35 years old and is married with a husband who is a driver for work. She has 2 children aged 10 and 14, and both of her children go to school. Each week, Rose makes approximately UGX 70000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save and also pay the school fees for her children. Rose has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 500000 in order to buy a public pay phone and more stock and the loan was paid back on time.

Rose is joined in her small group by Ruth N. and Aida N.. Ruth N. has a business in tailoring and wants to buy another sewing machine. Aida N. is currently operating a business in used clothing sales and wants a loan to stock more clothes.

loans.use: To add capital to retail shop and boost it

loans.name: Munevera

texts.en:
Munevera is a 31-year-old woman from Babići, a small village near the town Gračanica. She is married and she has two children, ages 7 and 10 years old, who go to primary school.

This is her third loan from MCO WWI (Women for Women International). The first loan was for 5 000 KM, the second loan was for 1000 KM and this loan is for 500 KM. Munevera is taking this loan to buy food for her livestock. Her wish is to expand her livestock business.

loans.use: To buy food for livestock.

loans.name: Kisumu Ndogo Upendo Self-Help Group

texts.en:
Millicent A. is a mother aged 43 with 3 children. She lives with 1 orphan child of her late brother who perished 2 years ago.

Millicent started her shoes business 3 years ago after accumulating savings from her former work place in a local hospital located in Eldoret town. She currently deals in ladies’ shoes but would like to diversify to children’s and men’s collections as well. As she is the bread winner for the family, it would enable her to support both her children and her husband, whose job is low-paying.

With the little profit that she gets from the business, Millicent still struggles to pay her house rent and to feed and clothe her children. But with the help of her loan, Millicent will be able to add more stock and increase her monthly sales.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand shoes in bulk

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco works as the technical director of the Club Bolivar’s football schools and he is responsible for his two children. He lives in the area of Miraflores in the city of La Paz. This is the second time he requests a loan with Impro, and it will be spent on a costly medical treatment for his son who has started suffering from anaemia and he does not have sufficient resources for the treatment. His work and responsibility give him the opportunity of obtaining this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Francisco trabaja como director técnico en las escuelas de futbol que tiene el Club Bolívar, tiene dos hijos que están a su cargo. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, el mismo que será destinado para el tratamiento medico de su hijo ya que está con principios de anemia y necesita una gran colaboración y no cuenta con los recursos suficientes para ese tratamiento. Su trabajo y responsabilidad le dan la oportunidad de obtener este crédito.

loans.use: Costs related to medical treatment for his anaemic son.

loans.name: Tautala

texts.en:
Tautala S., 41, is married with 4 children. She has 10 years of experience in the fishing business. She sells fish in the village and to the general public 5 days per week. Her husband helps her with the business.

Tautala has never had a loan through SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (~250 USD). SPBD loans are Tautala’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use the loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Born

texts.en:
Born S., 50, is a widow and earns approximately US$ 6 in profit per day from selling groceries in front of her house. She has six children, three of whom are employed as garment factory workers with a salary of US$ 70 each per month. The others are students and help their mother with housework and selling products.

Born has requested a loan from Kiva to add grocery inventory to meet her customer demand.

loans.use: To add grocery inventory to meet her customer demand

loans.name: Hila Patricia

texts.es:
Hilda es casada y tiene 3 hijos: Sergio de 8 años, Adriana de 6 años  y Mia de 2 años. Ella quería apoyar a su esposo con los gastos escolares de sus hijos ya que desean darles una buena educación para que puedan salir adelante en un futuro; por lo que hace 2 años inicio con la venta de zapatos por catalogo, y tambien otros articulos, y ha obtenido buenas ganancias.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 4 meses para tener mas surtido de mercancía y poder darles mejor servicio a sus clientes entregándoles mas rápido la mercancía.
texts.en:
Hilda is married and has three children: Sergio (8 years old), Adriana (6 years old) and Mia (2 years old). She wanted to help her husband cover the cost of sending their children to school -- to give them a good education so they can get ahead in the future. Two years ago Hilda began selling shoes from a catalogue, as well as other goods, and has made good profits. Hilda needs a loan for $250 -- which she will pay back in 4 months -- to increase her stock of merchandise. This will help her offer better service to her clients by delivering their orders in less time.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima M. was born in 1949 and comes from Derventa. She is married and her husband is in retail. Fatima is an owner of a local store, and her husband works with her part time. Fatima takes care of everything and the business in the store is good. She is is satisfied because she doesn`t expect too much. She hopes to earn, every day, enough for their costs. She is taking a loan through WWI to provide bigger offerings in her store and to keep selling on this level.

loans.use: To buy products for reselling

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.en: Sharofat is the mother of 2 children. Her husband is a simple worker and doesn’t earn much. So to help her husband she started cooking cakes and selling them at the markets. Her cakes were so tasty that clients started to order cakes right in her house. Now since she has many regular clients she wants to buy good cooking equipment and thus produce more cakes.

loans.use: Purchasing cooking equipment.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es: Lucio tiene 40 años, está separado de su pareja, vive con su único hijo mayor de edad. Es agricultor, se dedica al cultivo de  café, actividad que  viene realizando por  30 años, además es una actividad que le agrada hacer  porque le gusta vivir  junto a la naturaleza, y disfrutar del fruto de su trabajo al ver sus plantaciones de café, producto que por cierto es muy rentable,  por la gran demanda  y el costo  alto que tiene de  venta. Sin embargo, lo difícil es cultivar, estos productos deben llevar un adecuado procedimiento, hasta tener el producto terminado. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. Lucio  invertirá en la compra de  plantas de café para aumentar sus  hectáreas de terrenos.
texts.en:
Lucio is 40 years old, is separated from his partner and lives with his only son, who is grown up. He is a farmer and works cultivating coffee, an activity he has practiced for 30 years. He enjoys his work because he likes living close to nature and seeing the fruits of his labor in his coffee plantation. Coffee is a very profitable crop thanks to strong demand and a high sale price. Nevertheless, the challenge is in the cultivation, these crops need to have an adequate development through to harvest. This is Lucio's first loan with MFP. He will invest in the purchase of coffee plants to increase the hectares of his terrain.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase coffee plants to increase his production

loans.name: Im

texts.en: Im S. is 62 years old and a resident of Siem Reap Province. She runs a small laundry in her house to provide her services by washing clothes for her customers, for which she can receive $0.50 a set. She started the business in 1995. She is married to Soam Lo, 72, who also works with her. She has three children, all of whom are married and are employed: the eldest son is a soldier, the second son is construction worker, and the last son helps his mother to wash clothes. To make the family healthy, S. would like to apply for a loan to build a bathroom. The bathroom is a very important place for good hygiene.

loans.use: To build a bathroom

loans.name: Balongi Group

texts.en:
Thérèse is 30 years old and single. She lost her mother in 1991 and her father in 1997. After her parents passed away, no one could help her come out of the horrible economic situation she was experiencing without her family. Thérèse had to quit her studies and start a business. With just $100 in starting capital, she began selling canned goods, such as canned tomatoes, margarine, corned beef, milk, and sardines in 2004. With hard work and good management, she succeeded in stabilizing her business.

In November 2006, Thérèse heard an announcement at her church about Hope’s microfinance program, and she decided to join the community bank, Balongi. She has been a faithful client of Hope, receiving six loans that she regularly and completely paid back. Thérèse is now happy because she has taken control of her financial life.

loans.use: To diversify her business by adding clothing

loans.name: Maria De La Concepcion

texts.es: La señora Maria de la Concepción C. tiene la edad de 42 años habita en el barrio los Ríos ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo, el trabaja como ebanista para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen a su cargo un hijo  el cual le apoya con el mantenimiento de sus cultivos, doña Maria desde hace veinte años trabaja sus tierras y comercializa sus cultivos, ella esta muy contenta con el apoyo que le brindamos ya que ha podido establecer mas cultivos y ha mejorado las condiciones de la piña. Con esta solicitud va a comprar insumos agrícolas para los cultivos para tener una mejor cosecha y vender a mejor precio.
texts.en:
Maria de la Concepción C. is 42 years old and lives in the Ríos neighborhood of Ticuantepe with her husband, who works as a cabinetmaker to support her with the household expenses. They have a son who they support through their crops. For 20 years Maria has worked her land and sold her crops. She is very happy with the support we provide to her as she has been able to grow more crops and improve the condition of her pineapple crop. With this loan she will buy agricultural consumables for her crops in order to have a better harvest and sell at a better price.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy agricultural consumables for her crops

loans.name: Mkasi

texts.en:
Mkasi is a soap seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar. She belongs to Kutoa Ni Moyo group (Group code 2045). She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$50. Every day she works at her business. She is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more soap for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Mkasi is 30 years old, married, and has two children: ages 5 and 1.

loans.use: To buy more soap for her business

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en:
Kofi A. is forty-three years old. He is a married man and has two children, both girls. Both of his daughters are in the basic school. He says that, as the man of the house, he needs to work very hard to make income to support the family. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Kofi’s wife is a trader. She runs a cold store in the local market to support him financially.

Kofi deals in second-hand textiles and unisex clothes. He buys bales of second-hand clothes from Kumasi and treks to sell in markets in the nearby communities. He has been in business for three years. Kofi wants a loan to procure more bales of textiles. He is hopeful to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy second-hand textiles and clothing

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира – женщина 40 лет. Замужем и мать 2-х детей. Занимается продажей детской одежды на рынке Фаровон г. Гафурова. Её муж работает подсобником мастера отделки и ремонта квартир. В зимнее время такого вида работы очень мало. Но летом он будет зарабатывать лучше. Замира тоже старается вложить свою долю в бюджет семьи и повысить уровень жизни своей семьи. Замира закупает товар на оптовом рынке города Истаравшан. Цель ее займа является расширение ассортимента ее товара. Она очень надеется что кредитование поможет для достижения ее цели.
texts.en:
Zamira is a 40 year old woman. She is married and is the mother of 2 children. Zamira sells children’s clothing at the Farovon market in Gafurov. Her husband works as an assistant to a contractor who finishes and repairs apartments. In the winter there are very few jobs like this, but in the summer he will have better earnings. Zamira also tries to contribute her share to the family budget and to increase the quality of life for her family. She purchases products at the wholesale market in Istarashvan. The goal of her loan is to increase her product assortment. She has high hopes that the loan will help her to reach her goal.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase product assortment

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en: Leonisa C. is fifty-eight years old and lives in Navalan, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur.  Her husband, Jesus C., works on the farm, but the income from their farm is not enough for their daily needs.  She started a sari-sari store so that she can generate income to help provide for their daily needs.  She realizes how helpful the profits generated from the sari-sari store are.  She decided to apply to one of Kiva's field partners, Paglaum Coop, for a loan of 10,000 PHP. This is her second loan cycle, payable in six months, and is for purchasing more stock requested by her customers.  Because of the progress of her sari-sari she plans to renovate the store and add a video player to attract more customers.

loans.use: Additional capital for sari-sari store

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna has been operating a general store and a hog-raising business for many years. She is hoping that her request for a loan of PHP 15,000 will be granted so she can buy more inventory for her store. The income from her business greatly assists her in providing education for her children. She hopes that all her businesses will become sustainable in the future, so the family can have a progressive and comfortable way of life. She works hard so that she can help her husband to meet the needs of their family.

Myrna is married to Virgilio Villanueva. They were blessed with seven children. Four of her children are already married. Two of the children work in a factory. Her youngest child is 13 years old and still studying. Her family lives in the agricultural community of San Pablo Alicia, in Isabela, Philippinwa. She is thankful for her happy family and disciplined children.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her store

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en: Abigail is 45 years old and married with 3 children. She has a shop where she sells foodstuffs and drinks. She hopes for a loan to purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 42 years old and she is married with two children. All her children are in the junior high. Her husband has been very supportive in taking care of the children.  She works very hard and approaches her business with commitment. For four years, Agnes has been trading in gari sale. Gari is produced from cassava and it is one of the carbohydrate supplements. She obtains her supplies from the farming communities and retail to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy bulk of gari to meet the daily demands of her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to pay her children educational fees. She belongs to the village bank called “Nyame Nsawom” which literally means God has a hand in it.

loans.use: To buy maize and gari in bulk

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa, seventy years old, is widowed with seven grown up children. Currently five are working and the rest are schooling. She lives at Sefwi Bekwai in the Western Region of Ghana.

Adwoa is a petty trader and sells items like salt, ginger, spices, shear butter, etc. for thirty years now in taking care of the home (shear butter, or shea butter, is a popular natural face and hair cream and is also used as a cooking oil in West Africa). Her husband died through a prolonged sickness. She has to depend on her business to support her kids who are in school. She sells at the community market where she lives.

Adwoa complains that business is doing well but that she needs the loan to upgrade her inventory. With the loan she would buy salt, shear butter, ginger, etc. in bulk to retail to her customers. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy salt, ginger, spices, etc. in bulk

loans.name: Dialika

texts.fr: Dialika C. est jeune mariée de 28 ans, mère de 2 enfants. Elle achète du savon artisanal qu’elle revend en détail au marché hebdomadaire de Diaobé avec l’aide de son mari conducteur de camion. Elle aimerait renforcer son activité pour mieux participer aux dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Dialika C., age 28, is a young married mother of two children. She buys artisanal soap that she sells retail at the weekly market of Diaobé with the help of her husband, who is a truck driver. She would like to bolster her business in order to help further with covering family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For buying and reselling hand-made soap

loans.name: Opeyemi

texts.en:
Opeyemi is 45 years old and married with four children. She resides at Lagos State, Nigeria, where she sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs.

Having been with LAPO Microfinance for over a year, Opeyemi is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Arif

texts.en:
"Thank you very much Kiva! Good luck Kiva!"

Arif is applying for his second Kiva loan. He has improved his business and started a taxi business. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy spare parts to improve his taxi business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Birjinia Del Socorro

texts.es: Birjinia del Socorro O. Dávila tiene 40 años. Su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que la ubicación de su negocio está en su vivienda, en donde es transitado por varias personas y además enfrente queda una escuela en donde la mayoría de clientes son alumnos que estudian en este colegio. Ella poco a poco logro incrementar su mercadería por lo que supo muy bien administra su negocio ya que le importaba que sus hijos lograran tener la oportunidad de estudio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, paletas, caramelos, bombones, chicles, pan jugo, refrescos y jugos. El sueño de Birjinia es que a sus hijo no les falte el pan de cada dia.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel has been managing her village store for five years.  However, her store was temporarily closed due to lack of capital.  This is the reason why she is now asking for financial support from the KIVA lenders to lend her a loan of PHP5,000.  She will use the loan to purchase different commodities like canned goods, biscuits, toiletries and other basic commodities that are very in demand in their village.  With her business, she believes that she can help her husband in supporting the needs of their children.  

Maribel is 33 years old, married and blessed with three children.

loans.use: Additional capital to continue her business

loans.name: Abdul Ghafar Group

texts.en: Abdul Ghafar is the group leader of the Abdul Ghafar group. There are two members in this group. Each of them wants to take a loan to expand their business. So they are requesting a group loan of 20000 Afghani. Abdul Ghafar and Mohnasa want to take a loan for their general store business because they want to support their family and children.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Mais

texts.en: Mais N. is a 34-year-old farmer who lives with his wife and two sons in the Southern part of Azerbaijan, in Sabirabad. Mais raises cattle and sells them for meat product to the local traders. He has 11 years of experience in raising and selling cattle. Mais 's cattle are in very high demand in his village; however two calves is not enough to meet the demand. Mais is, therefore, applying for a loan of 1606 AZN to purchase additional cattle and fodder. Mais is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to improve his standard of living through this loan.

loans.use: To purchase four cattle and fodder.

loans.name: Samia

texts.en:
Samia is a 31 year old woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her husband. She has been selling children’s clothing from her house since 1997.  Her clients are her family members, friends and neighbors. 

Samia settled on this business because she wanted to be independent in her work and also to supplement her husband’s income. When she first started her business, Samia had some financial issues and couldn’t purchase a lot of merchandise. Now, however, she is special in her field because she owns a large variety of merchandise. 

Samia has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase more merchandise for her business. This is her third loan cycle and she has always paid on time.  In the future, she plans on expanding by opening a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise for her business

loans.name: Penn

texts.en: Penn S. is 49 years old and married to Vin Sok, 45, a local fisherman. The couple has been married for many years and is blessed with five school-aged children, all dependent on their income. Penn S. owns a medium-size store next to her house where she sells Chinese noodles and soft drinks. She starts her business in the morning and sells to customers who are her nearby neighbors. To improve her business, Penn S. has decided to seek a Kiva loan to decorate her shop and to buy more essential materials for her enterprise.

loans.use: To decorate her shop and to buy more essential materials for her business

loans.name: Yola

texts.es:
La Sra. Yola es una cliente y muy puntal D. la institución, ella se dedica a la venta D. cotillón en su puesto ubicado en la ciudad D. Oruro, su mercadería esta compuesta D. piñatas, canastitas, cuetillos, globos, y todos aquellos cotillones que se utilizan en las fiestas D. cumpleaños, bodas. quince años, etc. Vive en casa propia, con su esposo y su hija que está en la universidad, su esposo se dedica a la música, es integrante D. un grupo musical, y con este ingreso ayuda en los gastos D. la casa. El crédito solicitado en esta oprotunidad será para la compra D. petardos y juegos artificiales ya que se vienen las fiestas D. fin D. año y tiene demanda D. estos productos.

La ciudad D. Oruro ha sido designada por la UNESCO, como patrimonio  cultural e intangible D. la humanidad debido a su fiesta D. Carnaval.

http://www.bolivia.com/Turismo/ciudades/oruro/index.html visite está página para obtener mayor información sobre Oruro.
texts.en:
Yola is a very responsible client of our organization. She sells party favors in a stand located in the city of Oruro. Among her items you can find piñatas, baskets, fireworks, balloons, and party favors for birthday parties, weddings, sweet sixteen parties, etc. She lives in the house that she owns with her husband and daughter, who’s in college. Her husband is a musician in a band, so her job helps cover the house expenses. She will use this loan to purchase fireworks as they are on high demand during the holiday season. The city of Oruro has been inscribed in the list of intangible cultural heritage of humanity by UNESCO, thanks to its Carnival festivities. Visit http://www.bolivia.com/Turismo/ciudades/oruro/index.html for more information about Oruro.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fireworks and party bags

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and sell generic pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Just like other farmers, 44-year-old Remedios I. wants to grow a bountiful harvest. Currently, she tills a hectare of rice field, but she needs additional money to buy all of the farming necessities. She would like to apply for a loan of 6,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy additional fertilizers and farm supplies.

loans.use: Fertilizers and farm supplies

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan Pablo T. O., Labora como Vigilante en el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua.

 El tiene tres hijos a su cargo, y dos se  encuentran en  edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante cuatro años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido cuatro  crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL. El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc,  perlines, y pintura para el techo de su casa de habitación  por lo que anteriormente el techo de su casa se encontraba en mal estado y en invierno el agua se pasaba.
Juan dijo que gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por ceprodel su vivienda ha venido mejorando ahora es mas segura y mi familia vive en mejores condiciones que antes.
texts.en:
Juan Pablo T. O. works as a security guard in the Mayoreo market in Managua. He has three children in his care, two of whom are of school age. He is married and has worked with CEPRODEL for 4 years. In this time, he has invested his 4 loans in improving his home, thanks to the financial support provided by CEPRO. The loan he is soliciting is for construction materials like iron, beads and paint for the roof of his house as before his roof was in bad condition and in the winter water leaked. Juan said that thanks to the financial help from CEPRODEL, his home has improved and is now more secure. His family lives in better conditions than before.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home Improvements

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 43-year-old married man with 4 young kids. He is the only one to support his family with his business. He has been working in water refining for the past 13 years. And in 2009, he opened his own shop after seeing a need for such services in the region. Today, Hussein is requesting a loan of $1,000 to add more decor to his shop, in addition to buying water bottles for his work, in order to develop his business and make a good income.

loans.use: To add more decor to his shop in addition to buying water bottles

loans.name: Abraham Plus Group

texts.en:
“Abraham Plus” is a group of 27 owners of small businesses chaired by Alain. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Alain sells packaging in the north and most populated area of Kinshasa. He became a micro-entrepreneur in 2008. He already received five loans from the microfinance institution HOPE DRC and fully repaid them. 

He intends to use this loan to expand his inventory. He will buy some packaging to resell at a profit. Currently he earns a profit of $70 per week.  

Alain is 34 years old and single.

loans.use: Purchasing some packaging to resell in order to increase his working capital

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita C. is a 42-year-old woman living in the town of Brgy 9, Isabela, Negros Occidental.  She is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Anecita owns and operates a business venture in the sector of operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling animal feed and farm-related products in the local community. Anecita has been engaged in this business for over 14 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 1997, Anecita joined NWTF to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anecita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 19,000 PHP from NWTF. Anecita is now requesting a new loan of 19,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 17th loan taken out from NWTF. Anecita plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc., has answered the calls of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Bunthun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Bunthun C. is 50 years old. She was selected as village bank president by a group of 15 members.  The members of this group loan live in  Preak Doung village in Kandal province. With the loans, they hope to increase income to improve their families' standard of living. 

Mrs. Bunthun C. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice.  She also sells sugar cane.  With these 2 businesses, she earns a small income to support her family.  Her husband, Mr. Meng Tuy, is a wedding chef.

Mrs. Bunthun C. is requesting a loan to repair her vehicle and to buy more sugar cane to increase her business activities. This couple has eleven children; two are seamstresses in the garment factory, three are laborers at a pig farm and five are attending in the local school while the youngest one is 3 years old.

loans.use: To repair her vehicle and to purchase more sugar cane

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Don Carlos Z., cuenta con un Taller de 6 Máquinas para Confeccionar Palayeras,  lleva 6 años de trabajar en la Sastrería  él y su esposa  laboran para el mismo oficio como también su  hijo en donde gracias a ello los ha podido sacar adelante dándoles una mejor calidad de vida y así poder obtener mejores ingresos y poder aumentar su capital 	ya que su numero de su clientela a aumentado por lo que nos solita su préstamo para dicha Artesanía, su residencia es en el Paraje Chichaclan del Cantón Paquí, Totonicapán.
texts.en:
Carlos Z. has a shop with six machines for making t-shirts. He has worked as a tailor for six years. He and his wife work in the same field, and their son does as well. Thanks to this work they have been able to get ahead and have a better quality of life. They have been able to get better earnings, and they have increased their capital. The number of customers they have has increased. He is asking us for a loan for this work. They live in Paraje Chichaclan in the Paquí canton, Totonicapán.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material

loans.name: Buhchuluun

texts.en:
Buhchuluun T. is 40 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Hovd province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger (a Mongolian nomadic tent). Two of his children attend a local secondary school and one is a university student.
Buhchuluun operates a meat-trading business in his town with his wife's help. In his business, his wife sells the meat. Buhchuluun and his wife have been operating this business since 1990, and have gained significant experience over the past 20 years. In addition, Buhchuluun works in Shim Us LLC. During his holidays, he collects meat from the countryside at wholesales price and resells them for a profit. With his business profit, he has been paying his eldest child's university fees. Buhchuluun is a very hardworking person who has a great business mind. He is requesting a 2,300,000 MNT loan to purchase more meat from the countryside to sell to his many customers.

loans.use: To purchase more meat to sell

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: Elvira de 55 años, con ese negocio que es la venta de granos básicos mantiene a su familia. Pues sus hijas todavía están a su cargo y necesitan de ella. Ahora Elvira trabaja en su tienda desde las 7 de la mañana  a las 6 de la tarde todos los días, Cuando por producto de las lluvias mi casa se derrumbo y quedamos viviendo en casa de una cuñada por un buen rato, hasta que con mi esfuerzo y el de mi esposo logramos construir una casa ahora de bloque concreto.  El negocio ha venido creciendo gracias a Dios.  En ocasiones vende al por mayor sus productos, pues llegan muchos clientes que son de comunidades muy largas. Con el préstamo quiere comprar aceites, azúcar, arroz, frijoles, maíz, concentrado, harina entre otros productos. En un futuro quiere agrandar su tienda.
texts.en:
Elvira, 55 years of age, works selling basic necessities in order to support her family. Her daughters are still in her care and depend on her. Elvira works in her store from 7 am to 6 pm every day. When their house collapsed due to heavy rains, they ended up living with a sister-in-law for some time. With great effort on her and her husband’s part, they managed to build a new house made of concrete blocks. Thanks to God, the business has grown. On occasions, she sells her products at wholesale, and she has customers that come from far away communities. With this loan, she plans to purchase cooking oils, sugar, rice, beans, corn, concentrates, and flour, among other products. In the future, she would like to enlarge her store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Mutunga

texts.en:
Mutunga M. is 32 years old. He is married and has one child who is five years old. Mutunga's business is located in Kamukunji, in a very busy market in Nairobi. He has a business selling metal boxes and other items to the local people for the past two years. He says that this business is profitable and the only major challenges he has are that there are very many people in the area doing the same kind of business as his, hence customers are spoiled for choice, and high prices of raw materials. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. 

Mutunga is using his loan of Kes 50,000 to buy more scrap metal to make the metal boxes to sell. In the future, he hopes to open other outlets. He describes himself as hardworking, focused and dedicated.

loans.use: To buy scrap metal to make metal boxes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pants, blouses, and fabric

loans.name: Caltex Development, Mubende Group

texts.en:
Hard work and a social nature with a sense of determination have made Frister N. what she is today. This all began after she took a training course in the same business to become a professional tailor. This developed her skills in the tailoring business, which she operates from Kikoma Trading Centre in Mubende. 

This seems to be fulfilling for her as she is in position to get 200,000 Ugandan shillings as profits on a monthly basis. This has made the 45-year-old married mother of three children have the ability to cater to her family needs as she looks forward to achieving her dream of owning a big business in the area and buying herself more sewing machines. With this loan, she hopes to buy a sewing machine and more stock of materials that she can make into good designs for the customers. She also wants to look at business expansion.

Frister N. is the lady seated in the front row, far right in a purple blouse.

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Jimmi Alberto

texts.es:
Jimmi nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba y actualmente vive en la ciudad del Cusco. Jimmi estudio en la Universidad  Andina del Cusco la carrera profesional de Odontología y tiene 31 años. Al terminar su carrera profesional se asocio al consultorio “SMILE” de tres amigos de su misma carrera profesional.  

Con su próximo préstamo, Jimmi espera recibir $800 USD. Por el momento, el consultorio esta modestamente equipado con las necesidades más básicas. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar un equipo de ultra sonido, aparato eléctrico para remover placa y para una cuota inicial de una máquina de rayos x.  

Jimmi pertenece al banco comunal  “El Amanecer”. Ya son varios ciclos que participa en el banco comunal y le han reafirmado la confianza para los préstamos.  El sueño del socio es abrir consultorios en las ciudades de Quillabamba y Urubamba.
texts.en:
Jimmi was born in the city of Quillabamba and currently lives in the city of Cusco. He is 31 years old, and he studied the professional specialty of Odontology at the Andean University of Cusco. Upon finishing his degree, he associated himself with a clinic called "SMILE," run by three friends with the same professional specialty. For his next loan, Jimmi hopes to receive $800 U.S. dollars. At present, the clinic is modestly equipped with the most basic necessities. He would like to use the funds to buy ultrasound equipment and an electric apparatus to remove plaque, and to make an initial payment for an x-ray machine. Jimmi belongs to the communal bank called “El Amanecer” ["The Dawn"]. He has participated in his communal bank through several previous loan cycles, and they have reaffirmed his confidence in the loans. His dream is to open clinics in the cities of Quillabamba and Urubamba.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying an ultrasound machine and an electrical apparatus to remove plaque, and making an initial payment for an x-ray machine

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan K., age 51, is the village bank president selected by the twelve members of this group, located in Toul Krang village in Kandal province. All members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Chan K. is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice on. Her husband is a wedding musician and also helps his wife with the farm. With both of these occupations, they are able to earn a small income to support their family.   

Mrs. Chan K. is now requesting a loan to build a lavatory for family use. This couple has two children, who both are seamstresses in a garment factory.

loans.use: To build a lavatory for family use

loans.name: Lesbia De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Doña Lesbia se dedica  a la venta de comida, pues su negocio es un pequeño comedor que desde hace seis año logro tener ya que su mama dejo para que se ayudara. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo el trabaja de electricista. Y juntos se esfuerzan para tener un techo digno para sus dos hijos.

Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic ha logrado las mejoras la construcción de su casa que con cada préstamo logro hacer algo como: construcción de paredes, y con este último término de cerrar su techo de perlines.
Y ahora hará un sumidero en el fondo del patio logrando a si la instalación de un inodoro para mejor higiene de su familia.
Ya que no cuentan con las aguas negras y que le es de gran necesidad.
texts.en:
Lesbia has sold prepared meals in a small eatery that her mother left her six years ago so that she’d have a way to support herself. Her husband, who works as an electrician, contributes to the household. Together they struggle to provide a proper home for their children. Thanks to loans from Afodenic she has made some home improvements. Each loan has been for a specific project like erecting walls and the last one was to finish sealing the roof with metal tubing. Now she will dig a septic tank in the rear of the yard so that she can install a toilet for better hygiene for her family since they don’t have a sewerage system and this is a great need.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy a toilet and dig a septic tanc in order to build a bathroom and have better hygiene conditions.

loans.name: Katty Cecilia

texts.es:
Katty tiene un puesto de carnes y vive en una zona periurbana llamada la Perimetral esta rodeada del estero salada.  Inicio vendiendo carnes para seguir con el mismo negocio que la mama tenia. Poco a poco con esfuerzo ella a podido comprar un congelador y distintas carnes para la venta. 

El trabajo lo realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su mama ya que ella tiene experiencia en vender carnes. Para seguir con su negocio ella quiere comprar mas carnes con el préstamo y así tener mas clientela.  

En el futuro quiere tener un local de carnes mas grande y surtida con varias carnes conocidas por todos los comerciantes.
texts.en:
Katty has a meat store and she lives in a periurban zone called La Perimetral, which is surrounded by salt marsh. She started selling meat to continue in the same business that her mother had. Bit by bit, with effort, she was able to buy a fridge and different meats to sell. She works during the day with her mother's help, since she has experience selling meat. In order to continue with her business she wants to buy more meat with this loan and thus have more customers. In the future she wants to have a larger meat store, stocked with various meat and known by all the merchants.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: meat

loans.name: Elda

texts.en:
Elda B. is from the village of Lower Lilingayon, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 50 years old, married and has three adult children. To make a living, Elda owns and operates a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing general alteration and tailoring services like curtains to local community members. Elda has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Elda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This will be the first loan that Elda has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and materials

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim Mohamed is a 44-year-old bicycle repairer and spare parts dealer in Kibaoni Kilifi. He is married to Said Mohamed who contributes to their income and together they have three children. He has been in this business for the last twenty years and has done well. 

He is now requesting his third loan with which he intends to purchase bicycle spare parts for resale. He will use the anticipated profit to buy a plot of land and build residential houses for rental.

In the future he would like to open up a retail shop for his spouse.

loans.use: To buy stock of bicycle spare parts for resale

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sabougnouma est un constitué de quatre  femmes du village de   Sienso, Préfecture de San  Région de Ségou. Elles ont en moyenne 48 ans,  sont toutes mariées et sont mères d’au moins 4 enfants. Les membres du groupe Sabougnouma font la vente de condiments et diverses marchandises. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis deux ans. Le groupe est à son deuxième  prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursé le premier prêt. 
Behan T. qui est la présidente du groupe compte acheter, 5 cartons de cube maggi, 4 sacs de sel de cuisine, 5 paniers de piment, 3 paniers de Sounbala.  
Elle espère réaliser un  bénéfice de 20.000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et venir en aide aux conjoints dans les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The Sabougnouma group is made up of four women from the village of Sienso, in the San prefecture of the region of Ségou.  The women are, on average, 48 years old; they are all married and are the mothers of at least four children.  The members of the Sabougnouma group sell condiments and assorted merchandise.  In order to grow their businesses, the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit program two years ago.  The group is now on its second loan, having reimbursed the first loan on time.  

Bahan T., the group's President, plans to purchase five cases of Maggi cubes, four bags of table salt, five baskets of peppers, and three baskets of Sounbala.  She hopes to make a profit of 20,000 francs per month, which will be used to reimburse the loan and to help her partners with family expenses.

loans.use: To buy condiments

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher MwaT. T. is a 38-year-old electrician and retail shop owner in Bakarani Mombasa. He is married to Kache Jefwa, who contributes to the family’s total income. They are blessed with two children. He has been in this businesses for the past year and has a steady income.

With this, his first loan from KADET, he wants to purchase more electrical gadgets for services in his shop and use the anticipated profit to renovate his shop.

In the future he hopes to become very successful in life.

loans.use: To purchase electrical gadgets

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores S. is a 60-year old widow who supports her family by operating a food vending business.  She lives in San Roque, Ginatilan Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard Dolores is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5000. Dolores is now borrowing PHP 17000 so that she can purchase raw materials. This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Dolores aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way.

 About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for her food vending business

loans.name: Ma. Socorro's Group

texts.en:
Ma. Socorro A. is from the village of Carabatan Chica, Cauayan City, Isabela. Ma. Socorro is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Ma. Socorro is 37 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Socorro owns and operates a  general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Ma. Socorro is just starting this business.

In 2010, Ma. Socorro joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Socorro has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ma. Socorro is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be Ma. Socorro's second loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Los Comerciantes De Virgen Asunta Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “LOS COMERCIANTES DE VIRGEN ASUNTA”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de iscuchaka, provincia de Anta, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Eugenia; La socia tiene 36 años de edad, la socia tiene 3 hijos, y la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa paralelo a esto en su mismo stand ella vende pasamanería, la pasamanería consta de un surtido de artículos tales como, pasadores  para zapatos y zapatillas, betún, espejos de todo tamaño, peines, click y otros. La socia desea invertir su crédito en la compra de mercadería de tipo menaje ría;  la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería.

En la foto de grupo sale el asesor Hernán junto con ellos y la esposa del socio eduardo también esta en la foto.

La socia valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Eugenia belongs to the "LOS COMERCIANTES DE VIRGEN ASUNTA" community bank which is located in Iscuchaka district, in Anta province, in Cusco department.  

Eugenia is 36 years old.  She has 3 children and her business is buying and selling clothes.  In addition, from the same stall, she sells an assortment of articles such as shoelaces for shoes and sneakers, shoe polish, mirrors of all sizes, combs, pens etc.  She would like to invest her loan money in buying merchandise: household items.  She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise.

In the group photo, their advisor Hernán appears with them and the wife of Eduardo, one of the group's members, also appears in the photo.  Eugenia appreciates the loan that she is being offered and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To invest in buying merchandise

loans.name: Miriam Wanjiru

texts.en:
Miriam has been practicing farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 30 years.  She is 56 years old, married to Isaac M., and they have three children.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend.  This will be her first loan.  She is planning to use the loan amount to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer.

In the future, Miriam hopes to practice large scale farming.

loans.use: To buy potato seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Ana Deysi

texts.es:
Doña Ana, tiene 44 años de edad, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, residen en Chinameca departamento de San Miguel, se dedica a vender tortillas, negocio que tiene ubicado en su casa, ella inicio con su propia iniciativa hace 6 años, tiene un horario de trabajo de 10:00am a 3:00pm.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de maíz y leña, con este préstamo le ayudara en la compra de materiales para realizar las ventas de tortillas, su intención es mejorar su producción realizando más para dar abasto a la demanda y aumentar la clientela.
El objetivo de doña Ana es tener el negocio por un largo tiempo, ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, juntos trabajar por mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ana is 44 years old.  She lives with her husband and two children in Chinameca, in San Miguel department.  She owns a tortilla business which is located in her home.  Ana started this business through her own initiative 6 years ago and she works in her business from 10.00am to 3.00pm.

Ana is requesting a loan to buy corn and firewood.  This loan will help her to buy the supplies she needs to sell her tortillas.  She intends to improve her production, producing more in order to meet demand and increase her customer base.

Ana's goal is to have her business for a long time and to help her husband with their household expenses.  Both Ana and her husband work so that they can improve their children's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy corn and firewood

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin P. is from the village of Sampaguita, Solana, Cagayan. He is 32 years old. Martin is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Martin owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Martin has been engaged in his business for over 18 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP every harvest season.

In 2011, Martin joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Martin is requesting a loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Martin from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Jose Roberto

texts.es:
JOSE ROBERTO C. M., ES DE LA CIUDAD DE MANAGUA  EL TRABAJA DIARIO COMO COLECTOR, ES PADRE DE FAMILIA DE DOS HIJOS, Y ESTOS  ACTUALMENTE DEPENDE DE EL Y SE ENCUENTRA EN EDAD ESCOLAR.
DON JOSE ROBERTO ACUDE   A LAS OFICINAS DE CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN PRESTAMO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU VIVIENDA PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: ARENA, CEMENTO, PIEDRA, PIEDRIN Y HIERRO PARA LA CONSTRUCCION DE UN CUARTO PARA SUS DOS HIJOS EN SU CASA DE HABITACION.
TODO ESTO PARA BRINDARLE MEJORES CONDICIONES DE VIVIENDA A SU FAMILIA.
texts.en: Jose Roberto C. M. is from the city of Managua and works everyday as a collector.  He is a father to two school age children that are currently still dependent on him.  Don Jose Roberto came to the CEPRODEL offices to request a loan to purchase construction materials such as sand, cement, stone, gravel and iron to add a bedroom on to his house for his two children.  All of these efforts are to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Lizet

texts.es: Lizet, de 28 años. Es una mujer feliz, pues ama a su esposo Oscar con quien tiene una hija, Jatniel de 4 años, a la que educan en unión familia. En su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Unión Palomar. Para cuidar adecuadamente de su familia, dejó su trabajo de profesora de inicial; donde cuidaba a niños menores de 5 años. Asimismo su esposo trabaja en el gobierno local como ingeniero agrónomo, en proyectos de desarrollo rural. Consiente de los gastos que ocasionó dejar su trabajo. Ella abrió una pequeña librería en su casa, vendiendo papeles, lapiceros, cuadernos y demás útiles de escritorio. Pero la actividad que apasiona a Lizet y Oscar es la agricultura. En sus 4 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas siembra café, el cual cosecha una vez al año, vendiendo su grano a la cooperativa de la localidad de Sanchirio Palomar, por intermedio de su padre, que es uno de los socios de la cooperativa. Ahora ella desea mejorar su producción y seguir progresando con su negocio. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “desarrollando para el progreso de prisma”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde está segura que concretará sus objetivos. Lizet, se está preparando para la campaña escolar y la cosecha de café; por ello con el crédito está pensando comprar abono orgánico, útiles de escritorio, y con lo que resta pagará el salario de los peones que contratará para la recolección de los primeros granos de café.
texts.en: Lizet is 28 years old.  She is a happy person and she loves her husband, Oscar, with whom she has a 4-year-old daughter named Jatinel who they educate together.  They live in their own house located in Unión Palomar.  In order to properly care for her family, she left her job teaching pre-school, where she cared for children under 5 years old.  Her husband works for the local government as an agricultural engineer for rural development projects.  Aware of the expenses she caused in leaving her job, she opened a small bookstore in her house where she sells paper, pens, notebooks, and other desk supplies.  However, she is most passionate about farming.  She grows coffee, which she harvests once a year, on her four hectares of farmland and later sells the grains to the Sanchirio Palomar area cooperative through her father, who is one of the members of the cooperative.  Now she wants to improve her production and continue progressing with her business.  She belongs to the Desarrollando para el Progreso de Prisma Communal Bank and this is her first loan with MFP, where she is sure that she will meet her goals.  Lizet is getting ready for the school year and her coffee harvest.  For this reason, she plans to use the loan to purchase organic manure, office supplies, and use the rest to pay the farm workers that she will hire to collect the first coffee beans.

loans.use: to buy school items and materials to sell for the school year, as well as to hire workers to pick coffee beans

loans.name: Olive

texts.en:
Olive M. is 25 years old, married to a barber and has two children who are three years old and two months old. They have a barber shop which Olive has owned for the past three years. This business has enabled them to meet their family’s needs and develop themselves.

Olive is requesting a loan to buy a shaving machine and a battery to charge the shaver. With the profits she plans to pay her child's school fees.

loans.use: To buying a shaving machine and a battery

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y tiene hijos adultos e independientes. Vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Pitipo que se encuentra en la provincia de Ferreñafe, a menos de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Su esposo labora como profesor en la sierra. Desde hace más de 10 años, Marina se dedica a la siembra de maíz amarillo y distintos tipos de frutas que le generan ingresos semanales. Maria puede cobrar un buen precio en el mercado para su maíz lo que le genera un buen margen de ganancias. Adicionalmente, cuenta con animales menores que cría y engorda para luego venderlos a sus vecinos y comerciantes que suelen visitar la zona. Desea invertir su crédito en la compra de más insumos como semilla y herramientas de labranzas para su cultivo de maíz. Por ello, ha creido conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles. Marina ha manejado otros prestamos y tiene un buen historial de pago.
texts.en:
Marina is 46 years old, married, and has adult children who are independent.  She lives with her husband in the District of Pitipo in the Ferreñafe province, less than an hour from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.  Her husband works as a teacher in the mountains.

For over 10 years, Marina has been planting yellow corn and different types of fruit to generate weekly income.  Marina can charge a good price
in the market for her corn, which in turn generates a good profit margin.  Additionally, she raises small animals to later sell to neighbors and merchants who often visit the area.  Marina wants to invest the loan in purchasing more inputs such as seeds and tools for growing crops of corn.  She has therefore deemed it proper to request a loan of 1500 nuevos soles.  Marina has managed other loans and has a good payment history.

loans.use: To buy more seeds and tools for growing crops of corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more bags of tomatoes to resell.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Deborah has a business of outside catering, which she has had for five years.         

To help expand her business, Deborah has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more food for cooking for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Deborah hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Deborah hopes to buy a motorcycle.   Deborah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her get capital for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more food to cook and resell.

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en:
Sophorn (in the photo) is 33 years old, and her husband, Sam Oeun, is 31 years old. They live along National Road 2, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have one daughter who is in school. 

Sophorn is a garment-factory worker, while her husband is a motor-taxi driver. He hopes to change his business from motor taxi to tuk tuk because a tuk tuk could carry more goods and people than a motor taxi.

Hence Sophorn is asking for a loan of $1,000 to help purchase a tuk tuk for her husband.

loans.use: to purchase a tuk tuk for her husband

loans.name: Norberto

texts.en:
Norberto, age 58, lives with his wife in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. He is a farmer and tills his own land. He primarily grows rice crops to sell. Norberto works hard to support his family and to improve their living conditions.

Norberto will use his loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. He is confident that this loan will help increase his harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Mushfiq

texts.en:
Mushfiq has always been a hardworking man. He has made sure, from his young age, that his family never goes without their daily bread. He is married with three children. Mushfiq has a grocery store where he sells various kinds of food products. He began this enterprise 10 years ago and his current monthly profit is about $350. Thanks to his perseverance and dedication, his business has expanded. 

Today he needs to buy additional food items to increase the variety of goods that he sells. For this purpose, he is requesting a loan of 1,500 AZN. With the first loan from AqroInvest CU he was able to expand his profit and improve his business. He already has completed his first loan successfully and we believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors with his small business.

loans.use: to buy additional food items to increase the variety of goods he sells.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a single, 26-year-old businessman. He is aggressive, persistent, hardworking and knows what he wants in life. He has been selling secondhand clothes for the last two years to make a living for himself. In the next five years, he wants to have moved to a permanent stall. His dream is to start selling new clothes. 

Isaac is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy secondhand clothes. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for training him in prudent management skills.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Jacinta Mercedes

texts.es: Jacinta Mercedes se dedica a una pulpería. Tiene más de 5 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora. Inicio este medio de vida cuando no tenía el medio de ingreso necesario para mantener a su familia y necesitaba proporciónale el pan de cada día. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como golosinas, detergentes, granos básicos, jugos, gaseosas entre otras cosas. Sueña con mejorar cada día sus ingresos pues siempre le ha gustado trabajar y proporcionar lo necesario.
texts.en: Jacinta Mercedes runs a grocery store and has been in business for over five years.  She is a hard worker who started the business when she realized she did not have enough income to cover household expenses and put food on the table every day.  The loan will be used to buy merchandise such as sweets, detergents, basic grains, juices, and sodas, among other items.  Her dream is to increase income daily.  She has always enjoyed working and providing everything that is necessary.

loans.use: To buy sweets, detergents, basic grains, juices and sodas.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 58 years old and married, with 9 children. With 2 children in school, Pacita works very hard to provide for them.  

Pacita runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy stock to sell in her sari-sari store.  Pacita has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries.  In the future, Pacita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stock for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Evelia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC I”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Avelia; ella tiene 56 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de elaboración y venta de productos lácteos como yogurt, chocolate y miel, la socia vende en forma ambulatoria repartiendo a diferentes clientes, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de productos lácteos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para hacer los chocolates, leche y azúcar.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “IMASUMAC I". It is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member's name is Mrs Avelia. She is 56 years old. She is single and has 3 children. The member divides her time between her daily activities and her business of making and selling dairy products such as yoghurt, chocolate and honey. She sells door-to-door, delivering her products to different customers. Through this business, the member has managed to get her children ahead in life. The member wants to expand and improve her business of selling dairy products. She is asking for a loan to buy consumables, milk and sugar, to make chocolate.

The member is happy to be receiving the loan and agrees to make the repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy consumables, milk and sugar, to make chocolates.

loans.name: Doralisa Asunción

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 22 De Julio se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Doralisa, tiene 35 años de edad,  mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos de de 16, 13, 8, 6 y 3 años de edad, los dos mayores  estudian en colegio y los dos menores en escuela. El marido es comerciante.
 
Nuestra amiga además del hogar y atender a sus pequeños hijos también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también  se desplaza a otros cantones donde tiene clientes a los que les deja sus productos. Trabaja todos los días de lunes a viernes por su localidad en las  noches y los fines de semana todo el día cuando se va a otros cantones, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  se la traen de  Guayaquil cada vez  que necesita. Lleva 9 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va bastante bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal hace más de tres años y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho para salir adelante en su negocio. 

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The 22 of July communal bank meets every two weeks in Picoaza parish in Portoviejo, a popular place known for its traditional fiestas of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the congeniality of its people.

Doralisa, 35,  lives here, is in a communal marriage and they have five children, 16, 13, 8, 6 and 3.  The two oldest are in high school and two of  the younger ones are in school.  Her husband is a merchant.

Besides taking care of her small children and the home, our friend sells all types of clothing door to door.  She also goes to other cantons where she leaves her products with the customers she has there.  She works nightly from Monday to Friday in her area and on the weekends she goes to the other cantons.  She leaves the clothing with her customers on credit and collects payments every two weeks.  She brings the merchandise from Guayaquil whenever she needs it.  She has been working in this business for 9 years and it’s going quite well.

She will use the loan to buy: pants, blouses, t-shirts and children’s clothes.  She has been with the communal bank for more than three years and she likes it because the loans have really helped her get ahead with her business.

Her dream is to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Venus has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stock for her shop .
Venus is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Venus hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Doña Teresa, de profesion costurera y venta de ropa nueva y de segunda mano, pues sigue creciendo en inventario, ya que solo la costura no resuelve sus gastos del hogar.
Su esposo comerciante de granos basicos, y muy responsables con sus tres hijos, los dos mayores ya estan trabajando, y la menor esta cursando la universidad.
Hoy en dia, sus ventas han aumentado, al vender mas ropa, lo que con este nuevo financiamiento comprara, una paca y telas para seguir haciendo su costura, y vender su ropa nueva, manteniendo su clientela. Y que gracias  ah estos prestamo, sigue equilibrando sus ventas y sus gastos en  su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
Teresa is a seamstress and sells new and used clothing. She continues to increase her inventory, as she can't earn enough sewing to cover her household expenses.
Her husband sells staple grains and takes good care of their three children. The two eldest children are working, and the youngest is studying in the university.
Today her earning have increased and she sells more clothing. She will use this new loan to buy clothing in bulk and fabrics to keep making new clothing for her customers. Thanks to this loan, she'll be able to balance her earnings and expenses for her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk and fabrics to keep making new clothing for her business.

loans.name: Alhaji. M.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from the eastern city of Koidu/Kono. Like their counterparts in other regions of the country, they have applied for a loan of 11,900,000 leones in order to meet their immediate financial needs. At the end of each month, through their school’s bursary, they will then repay the loan using their monthly salaries. 

The leader of this group is Alhaji. This 42-year-old was born in Kono. He is married and has two children who are attending primary school. Alhaji has served in the teaching profession for 10 years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy house building materials for the construction of a family house and to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy house building materials for the construction of a family house and to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité se ha formado gracias a la iniciativa de una de las miembros que era ex integrante de otro grupo. Ella contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para conformar el grupo en la zona. El comité se denomina “La Esperanza”. Están en el Tercer Ciclo y está constituido por 16 integrantes; es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unido y responsable. Las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que están al día con las cuotas, trabajan en conjunto en  la realización de actividades para recaudar fondos que puedan salvaguardar al comité en caso de necesidad.
Una de ellas es la señora Rosalina, ella tiene una herrería bien equipada, comenta que le va muy bien en el negocio, justamente por tener buena clientela que acude a ella por el buen servicio que presta y también por el buen trabajo. Quiere seguir abasteciendo su negocio, por lo que solicita el crédito, para la compra de indumentarias y utensilios necesarios para la herrería, como ser hierros, chapas, pinturas y demás. Está agradecida a la fundación y kiva por la oportunidad que le dan.
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to the initiative of one of its members who used to belong to another group.  She contacted her friends and neighbors to form this group in her area.  The committee is called 'La Esperanza' (Hope) and its sixteen members are in their third loan cycle.  This is a group which stands out in the neighborhood for its unity and responsibility.  The members of the group have a great entrepreneurial spirit.  They are up to date with their repayments and they work together on different activities to collect funds which can save the committee should the need arise.

One of the members of the committee is Rosalina, who has a well-stocked blacksmith's.  She tells us that her business is going very well because she has good customers who come to her for the good service that she provides and for her good work.  She would like to continue stocking her business and so is requesting a loan to buy clothing and tools which she needs for her blacksmith's such as iron, sheets of metal, paints, etc.  She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity that they are giving her.

loans.use: to buy iron, sheets of metal, paint and other products

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 50 years old and lives in Canubay, Oroquieta City. She is married with 1 child. Susan has a sari-sari store business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of 3,000 to purchase more stock for her general store. She has been a member of PMPC for a year.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Yury Alexandra

texts.es:
Yury de 25 años, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo que estudia en escuela fiscal.Se dedica a la venta de mercadería al por mayor y por menor de articulos para el hogar como almohadones, adornos, cuadros etc.

Realiza su trabajo todos los días sin horarios fijos, tambien vende productos y cosmeticos para mujeres los realiza por pedidos. Su único problema es el atraso de los pagos de sus clientes, ya que ella da a credito la mercaderia.

Su prestamo lo requiere para comprar mercaderia de hogar como almohadones, cuadros, bisuteria. Su meta es establecer su propio local comercial para su mayor comodidad en sus ventas.
