texts.en: Yury is 25 years old and a single mother with a son who is in public school. She sells wholesale merchandise as well as household items like pillows, ornaments, pictures, etc. She works every day without a set schedule, and she also sells women’s products and cosmetics by special order. Her only problem is late customer payments since she extends credit for the merchandise. She needs this loan to buy household products like pillows, paintings, and jewelry. Her goal is to have her own shop to to conduct her business more conveniently.

loans.use: to buy pillows, paintings, and jewelry

loans.name: Mukim

texts.ru: На снимке мужчина 37 лет, Мукимчон. Он торгует фруктами в центре города Худжанда на рынке Панчшанбе. Мукимчон закупает товар у оптовиков, и его ассортимент составляет бананы, яблоки, мандарины, груши и т.п. Его жена работает учительницей в средней школе и её заработная плата составляет всего 300 сомони  в месяц, что не хватает на жизнь. Сам Мукимчон, кроме розничной торговли, также занимается оптовой перепродажей крупных партий фруктов с рук дехкан в руки торговцев фруктами в розницу. Его доход с розничной продажи очень маленьки, поэтому он хочет увеличить на следующий кредит 500 сомони  он хочет под новый год завезти разновидности цитрусовых фруктов и бананов.
texts.en: The photograph shows a 37 year-old man, Mukimchon.  He sells fruits at the Panchshanbe market in the city center of Khujand.  Mukimchon buys his product from wholesalers, and his selection includes bananas, apples, tangerines, pears and the like.  His wife works as a teacher at a secondary school, and her salary amounts to only 300 somoni per month, which is not enough for life.  Besides retail sales, Mukimchon is also involved in wholesale resale of large inventories of fruits from dekhan farmers to retail sellers of fruits.  His income from the retail sales is very small, and he wants to increase his income.  He wants to use his next loan of 500 somoni to bring in varieties of citrus fruits and bananas before the New Year's.

loans.use: to purchase citrus fruits and bananas

loans.name: Claire

texts.en:
Claire is a married woman with one child. She is 20 years old and resides in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines. 

Claire owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living. She's been in this business for three years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Claire has been a member of GDMPC for nearly two years. In the future, Claire wants to make improvements to  her house and save reserves for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La  socia Maritza; tiene 37 años de edad,  la socia es soltera; la socia tiene 1 hija; La socia ahora se esta dedicando al negocio de restaurant,ella prepara desayunos,almuerzos y cenas,ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo,el sueño de la socia ampliar el local de restaurant . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz,azucar,leche,aceite y galletas al por mayor.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Maritza is 37 years old, single, and has a daughter. She now manages her restaurant business where she prepares breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Maritza works from 8am to 7pm. Through this business, she is able to help her child move forward. Maritza dreams of expanding the site of her restaurant. She is requesting a loan to buy products for cooking such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, and crackers in bulk.

Maritza is grateful for the support that has been provided and promises to complete her loan payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, oil, and crackers in bulk.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a thirty-seven-year-old hardworking man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children and build a permanent house. He sells clothes, a business he started with his personal savings which he earned while working as a casual laborer. His major hardships include price fluctuations, inflation and the high cost of transporting to different markets. He has a vision of buying land to grow crops, and expanding his business to new markets. Francis needs the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Didas

texts.en:
Didas is 29 years old. He is married with 2 children aged between 2 and 4 years, Not yet go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 4 years. While his wife is a business woman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to buy a motorcycle.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Hare

texts.en: Hare is a married man. He describes himself to be humble. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a busy area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be breakdown of motorcycle. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to have more motorcycles within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.en:
Daniela G. has a child and the only income for the family is from the café. Her husband is unemployed. 
Daniela G. and her family have opened in their ancestral property a café in the village of Zafirovo. The loan will be used for goods and purchase of a coffee-machine.

loans.use: Purchase of a coffee-machine and goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pay school fees

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia M. is a single mother who raised 10 children on her own and is the proud grandmother of 22 grandchildren who all still reside close together in Samana. One of her oldest sons helps her run a store selling food staples. Her store features her renowned chicken that Julia claims is the freshest around. She purchases live chickens from local markets, then plucks and prepares them for resale from her store. Her neighbors in the community of Teson purchase chicken thighs, breasts, and legs to cook in their homes for their families. Julia also cooks chicken with rice and beans that she serves to people for lunch. She is very proud of her products and she looks forward to continuing the growth of her business. With the help of this loan, she will buy more chicken, as well as rice and beans in bulk.

loans.use: Purchase rice, beans and live chickens to prepare, cook, and sell.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.en:
Graciela’s round, smiling face is the first thing that greets customers as they walk in the door of her modest grocery store. She lives with her husband and two sons in Ayacucho, Peru. She has single-handedly managed this store for almost 3 years, with the exception of her older son who occasionally helps out after school.

Her love and pride of her family is obvious when she talks about the good grades they receive in school and how they help out around the house. The conversation is interrupted only when neighbors stop by to pick up household necessities or ask for directions. While her smooth skin and big smile exhibit youth, Graciela is clearly a reliable source for both dry goods and information. Pointing to the stack of carefully placed bricks, she talks about how she wants to add a room to her home so that her extended family has a proper place to stay when they come to visit. Graciela hopes to receive a $400 loan so that she can undertake this home-improvement project as well as purchase more products for her store.

loans.use: Pointing to the stack of carefully placed bricks, she talks about how she wants to add a room to her home so that her extended family has a proper place to stay when they come to visit. Graciela hopes to receive a $400 loan so that she can undertake this home-improvement project as well as purchase more products for her store.

loans.name: Carolay

texts.es:
Carolay is a young mother of 26 years old, and she works with her husband selling wood from 6am. Her husband cuts and works the wood and she sells it. He has to travel to the highest point of the city to get the best wood, and it is for this reason that they decided to start a small workshop. They have 2 kids who are not yet at school and they would eventually like to buy their own piece of land to build a house and a larger workshop so that they could sell more. Right now they rent the space for the workshop, but they also need to buy tools to condition the wood in order to give it a better finish. It is for this reason that they would like a loan of $500 which they will pay back in 6 months so that they can buy tools. She trusts in us to be able to give their business the investment that it needs to have a good future and provide a good quality of life for their family.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Carolay es una joven madre de 26 años trabaja con su esposo, desde las 6 de la mañana en la venta de madera a sus clientes actividad comercial a la que se dedica en vista de que su esposo se dedica a la extracción de madera por lo que tiende a viajar diariamente a las alturas de su ciudad a fin de extraer la madera más fina para su comercialización por tal motivo ambos decidieron poner un almacen modesto que poco a poco esta creciendo.Son padres de dos niños que no están en edad escolar. y los planes de esta familia con el tiempo es poder contar con un terreno propio para poder construir su casa y poder contar con un local más grande para las ventas. Debido a que actualmente han alquilado un espacio para almacenar la madera y venderlos desde ahí. Necesitan comprar herramientas para acondicionar la madera y ofrecerlos en mejores presentaciones por tal motivo desean obtener como capital de trabajo el importe de 500 dólares financiados en 6 meses con el fin de poder cubrir el gasto que les ocasionará la compra de herramientas. Ella confiá en nuestra institución para poder hacer del negocio una inversión estable a futuro en bien de la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: To buy tools to improve the presentation of the wood and the workshop area/La compra de herramientas para mejorar la presentación de la madera y la adecuación de un espacio especial  para el almacenamiento harán  que el negocio de Carolay se convierta en una fuente estable de ingresos familiar.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a 55 year old widow and mother of 4 children. She started with Al Majmoua in 2003 to help her pay the university tuition fees for her children. Fatima lives in the south of Lebanon, in the region of Saida. She is striving to provide for her family through her tailoring work. She needs to buy a new sewing machine to increase her productivity and better support herself and her family.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Adela Malvina

texts.es:
Adela is 41 years old, she completed first grade in elementary school, she has 6 children but only 2 depend on her. She lives in the Esperanza district, Trujillo province, Libertad state.

Adela has various activities: she sells alfalfa and she has become well known because she is the only person in this area that sells this product. She also sells clothing, she buys the items in Lima according to her customers' orders and later sells the clothing to them on credit; she also braids reeds (dried) to make furniture.

She is a member of the "Mujeres Valerosas" Communal Bank, and it is from this bank she obtained her first load of 300 soles (approximately US$100) and with this money she purchased dried reeds. The current loan from Manuela Ramos for 500 soles (approximately US$167) will be repaid in 4 months; she will use it to travel to Lima and buy clothing, now that she has had various customer orders with the change in the seasons.

Adela dreams of opening a boutique in her home so that she doesn't have to travel house to house to sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Adela tiene 41 años de edad, estudió solo el primer grado de primaria, tiene 6 hijos pero solo 2 dependen de ella. Vive en el Distrito de La Esperanza de la Provincia de Trujillo del Departamento de La Libertad.

La señora Adela realiza varias actividades: vende alfalfa (yerba) y se ha hecho muy conocida porque es la única de esa zona que vende este producto, también vende ropa, compra en Lima según los pedidos de sus clientes y luego los vende a crédito; también trenza junco (planta seca) para confeccionar muebles.

Es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valerosas”, en este Banco Comunal obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.300 (aproximadamente $ 100) con este dinero compró junco. El reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.500.00 (aproximadamente $167) el cual será cancelado en 4 meses; lo utilizará para viajar a Lima y comprar ropa, ya que tuvo varios pedidos de sus clientes por el cambio de estación.

La señora Adela sueña con poner en su casa una boutique para que ya no tenga que salir a ofrecer sus productos casa por casa.

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Doña Francisca owns a store where she sells soft drinks, groceries, candy, bread, and other products suitable to sell at a local store. Her home and store is located in the zone of Obispo Indaburo, City of La Paz.

It is the sixth time she is requesting a loan from IMPRO and the second time from KIVA. She has repaid all previous loans regularly. The amount requested will be used to buy merchandise in order to meet expectations from her customers.

She is recommendable for this loan as she has experience in selling her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Historia del Cliente: Francisca tiene una tienda donde vende refrescos, abarrotes, dulces pan y otros productos ofertables en una tienda de barrio. Su domicilio y tienda se encuentran ubicados en la zona Obispo Indaburo de la ciudad de La Paz.

Es la sexta vez que solicita un crédito en IMPRO y la segunda vez que solicita la ayuda de KIVA. Las cancelaciones del crédito anterior las realizó en forma regular. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de mercadería y así surtir de sus productos para las necesidades de su clientela.

Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en la venta de mercadería.

loans.use: Purchase of a variety of merchandise for a local store.

loans.name: Kaloian

texts.en: Kaloian H. breeds two cows in his house in the village of Manastirishte near Vratza. He also works as a constructor. Kaloian is married and has two kids. His wife is a housekeeper. Kaloian wants to buy another cow because he produces his own fodder and it is enough for breeding one more cow.

loans.use: To buy another cow

loans.name: Wanyange Lake F A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Safina T.. She is currently in the business of running a kiosk and is requesting a loan to add working capital. Safina is 30 years old and is married. She has 4 children ranging from age 15 to 18 and her children go to school. Each week, Safina makes approximately UGX 42000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save for future use. Safina has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 150000 in order to set up a kiosk and the loan was paid back on time.

Safina is joined in her small group by Alisati T. and Annet N.. Alisati T. has a farming business and wants to purchase farm fertilizers. Annet N. is currently operating a business in poultry keeping and wants a loan to purchase poultry feed.

loans.use: To increase inventory in kiosk

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr:
Mrs A. Kossiwa was born on January 1, 1970 in Lomé. She is married and a mother of three children. She is a seamstress and opened a workshop in the district of Agoè where she also sells fabrics and other sewing materials. Currently, her supply of fabrics has been exhausted and she should like to replenish it. To this end, she is asking for a first credit of $300 to buy two cartons of sewing thread, twenty four rolls of poplin, ten rolls of lace and some zippers.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Madame A. Kossiwa est née le 1er janvier 1970 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. Elle a ouvert son atelier de couture et de vente des produits de mercerie dans le quartier d’Agoè. Actuellement son stock de mercerie est épuisé et elle désire faire un approvisionnement. A cet effet, elle sollicite un premier crédit de 300.000FCFA pour acheter deux (2) cartons de fil à coudre, vingt quatre (24) rouleaux de popelines, dix (10) rouleaux de guipures et quelques fermetures.

loans.use: Purchase of sewing thread and poplins

loans.name: Joyo

texts.id:
Joyo S. is a person who is in the recycling business. He has been in this business for 5 years. With this loan, Joyo S. would use as capital to expand his business. From current business he could save Rp10,000 (about US$1.10)/day. Since he is not yet married, the business income is sufficient to pay for his own needs, like paying house rent and also for daily food and drink expenses.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Joyo S. adalah seorang yang mempunyai usaha sebagai pemulung. Usaha ini sudah ditekuni selama 5 tahun. Dengan pinjaman kali ini, Joyo S. akan menggunakannya sebagai modal untuk mengembangkan usahanya. Dari usaha ynag dijalaninya dia mampu menyisihkan Rp.10.000 per hari. Karena saat ini dia belum menikah, penghasilan dari usahanya cukup untuk kebutuhannya sendiri seperti membayar biaya sewa rumah dan juga untuk makan dan minum sehari-hari.

loans.use: To add business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Kick Poor United Group

texts.en: Yeabu K. is very grateful to Kiva for her first loan of $175. She is one of the first Kiva clients in Magburaka and has diligently paid back her loan. Yeabu said that she has benefited a lot from the loan, as her business expanded and profits increased. With the profit, she was able to meet her children's educational expenses. With 7 children, she needs to work hard to generate income for their needs and supplement her husband's income. She is the Kick Poor United group leader, and their goal is to kick poverty out of their families. The group said that a loan of Le. 1,900,000 will enable them to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of rice, palm oil, beans, chili peppers, etc

loans.name: Chhean

texts.en:
Chhean H., 46, works with her husband in Kampong Cham. They work out of their home and purchase stone that they use to construct small grinding mills. They typically make US $3 each day and have been constructing mills for the last eight years. They have five children, two of whom are still living at home and who help to support the family with their income.

Chhean H. has asked for a loan of US $500 to purchase more stone to increase her mill production. She believes that together with her husband, she can easily meet the demands of her customers by increasing her production. She sees this loan as an opportunity for business expansion and looks forward to the long-term benefits. Chhean H. was unavailable for a photograph at the time of the interview, so her husband, Kub Hang, is pictured here above.

loans.use: Purchase stone to build mills

loans.name: Choeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Choeun C. (not in the picture) and her husband, Mr. Bory Ban (shown in the picture), who live in a small village off of National Road Two about seventeen kilometers south of Phnom Penh, married in 2001 and have one daughter.

Choeun has been working in a garment factory for thirteen years, while Bory has been a garment factory worker for two years as well. Now Choeun wants to create her own business selling fruit and needs the money to start her fruit-selling. So, she is requesting a loan of US$ 200 to purchase fruit for resale at the village market.

loans.use: To purchase fruit for re-sale

loans.name: Alida

texts.es:
Alida tiene 45 años, vive en compañía de sus 3 hijos y su esposo.
Hace más de 6 años trabaja en la venta de cosméticos por catálogo, de las marcas más famosas de su medio, como ella trabaja de manera dependiente, aprovecha la oportunidad de ofrece estos cosméticos a sus compañeros de trabajo, es responsable para administrar su tiempo de venta y repartición de sus cosméticos y de su trabajo en esta entidad.La dificultad con que a veces se encuentra Alida, es cuando da crédito y se demoran en pagarle la cuenta, por ello, previene, y trabaja con dos capitales: el recuperable, y el fijo, con el que vuelve a comprar la mercadería, para que de esa manera ella pueda continuar trabajando en la venta de cosméticos.
Alida se  esfuerza porque desea seguir adelante con sus metas para que sus hijos sigan progresando, sin detenerse en el camino hacia la superación.
Ahora, necesita incrementar su mercadería, para lo cual solicita este prestado que invertirá netamente en ello.
texts.en:
Alida is 45 years old and lives with her 3 children and husband. For more than 6 years she’s been a sales rep for a cosmetics catalogue that offers the best brand names available. She works dependently, so she is able to offer her cosmetics to colleagues at work, is responsible for administering her own sales and delivery time, and all other tasks related to the job. The difficulty Alida finds in this work is that she gives credit and then her clients take a long time to pay the bill. To alleviate this, she works with two incomes: the money from outstanding invoices and her fixed income, which she then reinvests in stocking up on merchandise so she can continue her work as a sales rep. Alida works hard because she wants to continue moving forward with her projects and so her children can continue moving toward a better future. Currently, she needs to stock up on merchandise and is asking for this loan so she can begin reinvesting in her business. Alida tiene 45 años, vive en compañía de sus 3 hijos y su esposo. Hace más de 6 años trabaja en la venta de cosméticos por catálogo, de las marcas más famosas de su medio, como ella trabaja de manera dependiente, aprovecha la oportunidad de ofrece estos cosméticos a sus compañeros de trabajo, es responsable para administrar su tiempo de venta y repartición de sus cosméticos y de su trabajo en esta entidad.La dificultad con que a veces se encuentra Alida, es cuando da crédito y se demoran en pagarle la cuenta, por ello, previene, y trabaja con dos capitales: el recuperable, y el fijo, con el que vuelve a comprar la mercadería, para que de esa manera ella pueda continuar trabajando en la venta de cosméticos. Alida se esfuerza porque desea seguir adelante con sus metas para que sus hijos sigan progresando, sin detenerse en el camino hacia la superación. Ahora, necesita incrementar su mercadería, para lo cual solicita este prestado que invertirá netamente en ello.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase quantity of merchandise (cosmetics) for sale.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Née en 1958 à AGOUEVE dans la préfecture de Golfe, dame D. Ablavi est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Elle a ouvert un magasin de lavage à sec (pressing). Dans son magasin elle vend également des bijoux. Elle est souvent aidée par son premier enfant qui a terminé ses études et n’a pas encore trouvé du travail. Dame D. Ablavi assure 75% des charges de la famille car l’activité de son mari ne marche plus comme avant. 
Dix années d’expérience dans ce domaine, elle accueille beaucoup de clients compte tenu de son savoir faire.
Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acquérir une machine à laver et pour acheter 40 bijoux.
texts.en:
Born in 1958 in Agoueve, in the Prefecture of Golfe, Mrs. Ablavi D. is married and the mother of four (4) children. She has opened a dry cleaning store. In her store she also sells jewelery. She is often helped by her oldest child who has finished his schooling and has not yet found employment. Mrs. Ablavi D. assumes 75% of the family expenses as her husband's business is not as successful as it once was. With ten years of experience in this field, she has acquired many clients because of her "know how". She is requesting her first loan to purchase a washing machine and 40 pieces of jewelery.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a washing machine and jeweley

loans.name: Sheroz

texts.en: Sheroz has his own business of raising cattle and selling their meat. He isn’t married yet. He lives with his parents and this way he helps them to support the family. He buys cattle at the markets and after fattening them sells their meat. He has a small place at the market where he sells it. His dream is to build his own butcher shop. He wants to take a loan for building a store and equipping it.

loans.use: Purchasing forage for cattle.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: Rubén tiene 33 años, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos. Es agricultor, en especial se dedica al cultivo de café, ya que le gusta el proceso de secar los granos para luego llevarlos a los depósitos más cercanos  de su ciudad. Vender café es rentable, por temporadas duplican su precio, para ello se preparan por años, siendo lo más difícil  tener que sembrar las plantaciones de café, porque hay que distribuirlas  adecuadamente haciendo pozos para cada planta. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. Rubén tendrá que invertir en la compra de abonos y nuevas plantas de café  que sembrará.
texts.en:
33-year old Rubén lives with his wife and three children. He is a farmer specializing in growing coffee. He likes the process of drying the grains so that he can then take them to the warehouses nearest the city. Selling coffee is a profitable business as at certain times of the year, the price doubles, but it takes years to get to that point. The most difficult part of his work is the planting, making sure that the plants are distributed evenly, and making indentations for water around each plant. This is his first loan with MFP. Rubén is planning to buy fertilizer and new coffee plants with the money.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and coffee plants

loans.name: Abayaa

texts.en:
Abayaa Z. produces palm kernel oil and sells it at Asem near Abura. 

Abayaa has received no formal education. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a commercial driver. Abayaa has been producing palm kernel oil for sale since 1998. She is responsible for assisting her husband in meeting the financial needs of the family. 

She will use her loan to buy more palm fruit, so she can produce more oil to sell to her customers, who demand more than she produces. She hopes to use the new profits to reinvest in her business, increasing her capital base and enabling her to increase production.

loans.use: To buy more palm fruit

loans.name: Ebenezer Group

texts.en:
Eunice Z. is a single mother of three children, ages 22, 13, and 10. She is the group coordinator for Group Five of the Ebenezer Bank of Hope in Hato Mayor, Dominican Republic. This is the first loan that this group of five will receive, and they expect to make their businesses grow thanks to it.

Eunice´s business is a beauty salon. She will use her loan to purchase new products to do her everyday work. Her hopes are that this first loan will help her achieve her dreams of owning a bigger salon and a house of her own. From the profits she obtains, thanks to the improvements she makes in her business with this loan, she expects to help pay for her children´s school and college tuition.

Thank you for supporting this group. Let´s help build the dreams of these brave women!

loans.use: purchase new products for her beauty salon

loans.name: Sophin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophin L., 34, and her husband, Mr. Thea Soem, 33, who live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia, married in 1997 and have two children: one son and one daughter. One of their children attends school and the other one is still too young.

Sophin has been selling flowers for six years, a skill she learned from her parents. She buys them from villagers in her village for re-sale at the market in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been driving a motor remorque taxi (a motor with a trailer at the back) for fifteen years. But, his motor remorque is broken very often and it upsets his business.

So, Sophin is requesting a loan of US$ 800 to purchase a new motorbike to replace the old one; she will use part of her loan to purchase flowers on contract for re-sale.

loans.use: To purchase: a new motorbike to replace her husband’s old one; flowers on contract for re-sale

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.en:
Gulmira S. is 33 years old and is married with two children. She has been selling Oriental style jewelry at the local market for the past 11 years. The national earrings, rings and bracelets she sells are very beautiful and popular in Tajikistan. All Tajik women have at least one set of jewelry, often inherited from their grandmothers.

Gulmira’s jewelry business is successful and generates a stable income for her family. She started out with $300 USD and now has $3000 USD in working capital. She requests a loan of $1200 USD to purchase new jewelry and increase the range of items she sells. Gulmira has demonstrated herself as a reliable IMON borrower over the past two years. She thanks all for the support and promises to repay the loan.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history and diverse culture, which is a mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet influence, and Central Asian traditions. It served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It was the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina. And it is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need.

loans.use: Purchasing of new items of jewelry for increasing the range of goods

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es:
MARÍA ROSARIO A. G., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Rosas”, con domicilio ubicado en el Jr. Cesar Vallejo Mz. C Lt. 9 AA.HH. Cesar Vallejo del Distrito de Callaría, tiene 55 años de edad, tiene 1 hija, y es madre soltera.

Ella tiene 6 años en Manuela Ramos y su primer préstamo que obtuvo de S/.300 nuevo soles, al inicio los utilizo en la compra de golosinas y bebidas, que los ofrece en su casa, aunque tuvo algunos inconvenientes ha logrado seguir con su pequeño negocio.

Con el préstamo de S/. 2,500. Nuevos Soles, comprará arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, etc. Cuyas compra le permitirá  establecer una bodega que tenga todo lo necesario para atender a sus vecinos, y ellos encuentren todo lo necesario.

Se encuentra llena de optimismo y está muy agradecida con Manuela Ramos por los prestamos que le has confiado, por eso no va a fallar en sus pagos puntuales.
texts.en:
MARÍA ROSARIO A. G. is an associate of the Communal Bank "Las Rosas" and lives on Jr. Cesar Vallejo of the district of Callaría. She's a 55-year old single mother of 1 daughter.

She has been with Manuela Ramos for 6 years and when she received her first loan of 300 Soles (3 Soles = $1USD, approx.), she invested in candy and drinks, which she began selling in her home. Although she's had a few inconveniences, she has been able to continue with her little business.

With this loan of 2,500 Soles (3 Soles = $1USD, approx.), she plans on buying rice, sugar, milk, oil, etc. This will enable her to establish a store that has everything necessary to serve her neighbors and allow them to find everything they need.

Maria is full of optimism and is very thankful to Manuela Ramos for confiding in her and offering her loans; that's why Maria will come through with punctual repayment.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, milk, oil, etc.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin, vive en la  calle “Tiquina”  de la zona de Villa Ingenio,  de la ciudad de el  Alto
 
Vive junto a su esposa y sus pequeños hijos de 6 y 3 años, en una habitación en alquiler.
 
Posee un pequeño taller de peluquería ubicado en la plaza de la zona, en el cual trabaja por más de cinco años. Su esposa le colabora con los gastos familiares con los ingresos semanales que obtiene como ayudante de microempresas encargadas de adoquinar las calles.

El crédito lo destinará en la compra de herramientas para su taller (necesita un par de tijeras nuevas, toallas, tintes, etc.).
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Edwin lives in the Tiquina street of the Villa Ingenio zone in El Alto city. He lives with his wife and his two little children who are 6 and 3 years old. They all live in a single rented bedroom. Edwin has a small beauty shop located at the zone's plaza. He's been working there for more than five years. His wife helps with the family expenses with the weekly wages that she earns as an assistant at a micro-enterprise in charge of paving streets. Edwin will use the loan to purchase tools for his shop (he needs a new pair of scissors, towels, dyes,etc.) This is Edwin's first IMPRO loan. However, the evaluation performed by IMPRO qualifies him to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase scissors, towels and dyes for his beauty salon

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
El señor Pablo A. vive en una comunidad de Telica en León y por mucho tiempo ha atravesado la problemática de que no posee energía eléctrica y para ello ha adquirido un panel solar para así sacarle el máximo provecho para alumbrarse y tener iluminación para hacer los quehaceres del hogar. 

Es por este motivo que el señor Pablo espera muy confiadamente en que Ceprodel le brindará el apoyo por medio de los créditos para el pago del panel solar y de esta forma iniciar con la utilización del panel para beneficio propio y de su familia.
texts.en:
Pablo A. lives in the Telica community of León. For a long time they have dealt with the problem of not having electricity. Because of this problem, he got a solar panel. He wants to take maximum advantage of the panel to illuminate the house and be able to do work around the house. For that reason, Pablo confidently hopes that Ceprodel will offer support via a loan to pay for the solar panel. Then he can start using the panel to benefit himself and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for solar panel

loans.name: Kumri

texts.ru: Шамсиева Кумри- женщина 43 лет ,замужем, имеет четверых детей. Она занимается шитьём постельного белья и национальных платьев с национальной вышивкой. У неё  свои постоянные клиенты, которые с дома покупают у неё и с наценкой перепродают на рынке. Для увеличения своего бизнеса, Мавзуна решила получить кредит. Она хочет закупить ткань для пошива постельных комплектов.Мавзуна шьёт на дому, на снимке Мавзуна за работой шьёт платье.
texts.en:
Kumri S. is 43 years old, married and has four children. She is involved in sewing of bedding goods and traditional embroidered dresses. She has long-term loyal clients who buy her products and then resell them at a market. Kumri decided to obtain this loan in order to increase her business. She wants to purchase fabric for making bedding sets. Kumri sews at home. The picture shows her at work, making a dress.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fabric purchase

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
L. Nguyễn Thị is a 36 year-old woman living in the town of Mê Linh.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  L. owns & operates a business raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  L. has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5,000,000 Vietnamese dong a month (or about $280 US) from these activities.

In 2000, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve both her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  L. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 dong (or about $1120 USD) from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  L. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 dong which will be used to purchase breeding livestock.  The loan will be the 8th taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: Used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Apostol Santiago Group

texts.es:
Las socias del Banco Comunal Apóstol Santiago son de la comunidad de Pucacruz, Distrito de Rosario, Provincia de Acobamba, las actividades principales de la comunidad son la siembra de cereales y crianza de animales.
Como es el caso de Josefa que es casada, tiene 6 hijos, Josefa se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales, papa, además Josefa se dedica al procesamiento de los cereales y papa, como el chuño (elaborado de papa), maíz y trigo pelado, productos que vende en la feria de su región, el préstamo que obtendrá será invertido en la compra de cereales variados, los sueños de Josefa son que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Por otro lado Maria es viuda, tiene 8 hijos, Maria compra animales menores en las diferentes ferias de la región y lo vende en Acobamba, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos mayores, su préstamo será invertido en la compra de animales menores y tambien para implementar una tienda de abarrotes. Los sueños de Maria son que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The members of the Apóstol Santiago Community Bank are from the Pucacruz community, Rosario district, Acobamba province. The community’s main activities are planting grains and raising animals. For examples, Josefa is married and has six children. She buys and sells grains and potatoes. Josefa also processes the grains and potatoes into chuño (potato flour) and hulled corn and wheat. She sells these products at the fair in her region. The loan is to buy various grains. Josefa’s dream is that her children become professionals. On the other hand, Maria is a widow with eight children. She buys small animals in the different regional fairs. She sells them in Acobamba. She does this with the help of her older children. Her loan is to buy small animals and also to set up a small grocery store. Maria’s dreams are that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy grains, small animals, rice, sugar, potatoes

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.es: Sylvia tiene 40 años, es madre soltera y vive con sus 3 hijos que cursan estudios secundarios. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a vender bebidas (gaseosas y cervezas) en su casa y a la vez alquila una parte de su vivienda donde implementaron un negocio de cabinas públicas de Internet. Lo que le gusta de su labor es que la mantienen entretenida, además que le es muy rentable porque las bebidas heladas son productos que se consumen a diario debido al intenso calor de la región donde vive; por otro lado, el alquiler de su local es un dinero que le ingresa de forma segura. Sylvia es una mujer muy activa, ya que ahora también quiere incursionar en el negocio de la venta de madera. Este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque desde que se inició con los que son sus compañeros, siempre han demostraron responsabilidad y mucha organización. Con el dinero que solicita comprará 300 soles en bebidas y con lo que resta adquirirá una moto para movilizarse en cuanto empiece con el negocio de la venta de madera.
texts.en:
Sylvia is a 40 year old single mother. She lives with her 3 children, who are all high school students. She has been selling beverages (soft drinks and beer) from home for 3 years. Part of her house is sectioned off with public Internet booths for rent. She finds her work entertaining. Her business has been quite profitable because she sells frozen drinks that are consumed daily because of the intense heat present in the region. The Internet booth rentals have also provided a steady source of income.

Sylvia is a very active woman who now wants to start another business selling wood. She is currently on her 7th loan with MFP; she will use 300 soles to purchase drinks and, with the remainder, acquire a motorbike to be used for her wood sales business. She enjoys working with her communal bank, which was started by a group of her friends. They have demonstrated great responsibility and organization.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise and buy a motorbike

loans.name: José Ricardo

texts.es: José Ricardo H. A. reside en el municipio Rosario de La Paz departamento  La Paz. José tiene 30 años de edad, vive con su  esposa Luz y su hijo José de 7 años de edad estudiante de 2º grado. José posee su propio negocio donde se dedica a la producción de muebles como camas, comedor, sofás y otros; con 6 años de experiencia en esta actividad ahora le permite a José ser muy conocido en la zona y distribuir sus muebles en varias comerciales y  también tiene clientes que lo buscan directamente; los precios que José ofrece son muy competitivos es por eso el éxito que ha tenido a través de sus ventas, ahora José solicita un crédito para materiales utilizados en la elaboración de muebles ya que no alcanza a cubrir la producción demandada por sus clientes, con este crédito José podrá trabaja más, lo que le ayudara a mejorar sus ganancias que son necesarias para él y su familia.
texts.en:
José Ricardo H. A. lives in the city of Rosario de La Paz in the department of La Paz. Jose is 30 years old, lives with his wife Luz, and his 7 year old son José who is in second grade.

José has his own business where he makes furniture like beds, sofas, dining room tables, and others. He has six years of experience in this trade, which means José is very knowledgeable about the area and distributes his furniture in various stores in addition to having clients he deals with directly. José offers very competitive prices which is why he sees such success in his sales.

José is asking for a loan to buy materials he uses in the production of his furniture, because currently he cannot meet the production demand of his clients. With this loan José will be able to work more, which will help increase the earnings that are necessary for himself and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying materiels for furniture making

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is a 47-year-old married mother of three school-aged children. She has been running a grocery store for the past 12 years. Her experience has made her a very successful trader. She sells items such as rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, etc. She deems it a big opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by her customers. Cecilia wants to use her loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams etc., to grow her business and support her family.

loans.use: To buy groceries in bulk

loans.name: Mirna Angélica

texts.es: Mirna Angélica R. C. reside en Rosario de La Paz municipio del departamento de La Paz. Mirna posee tan solo 25 años vive con su único hija Carolina de 5 años de edad y su madre Doña Tomasa. Mirna hace todo lo posible por brindarla lo mejor a su pequeña hija que depende ella, actualmente Mirna posee una tienda, una venta de antojitos y bebidas. Ahora ella solicita de un crédito para destino de inversión en sus negocios, surtirá su tienda y también para comprar insumos para la elaboración de los antojitos que prepara diariamente.

loans.use: Surtir su negocio

loans.name: Idalia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Idalia del Carmen R. C. es una señora de 39 años de edad quien vive con su esposo y sus cinco hijos.

La comunidad donde vive doña Idalia se llama Canalete localizada en Upala en la provincia de Alajuela, es un lugar semimontañoso y sus actividades económicas se centran en la agricultura y mayormente en la ganadería. Es una comunidad con oportunidad de desarrollo y establecimiento de microempresas, tanto de agroindustria como  comercio.

Desde hace 5 años que doña Idalia inició un negocio de costura y confección de ropa. Ella remienda y elabora diferentes tipos de prendas de vestir que luego vende en negocios de la comunidad y sus alrededores e incluso la llegan a buscar a su casa. Su microempresa ha ayudado a que la condición de vida de su familia haya mejorado considerablemente. Dice que el poder brindar un buen servicio a las personas y cumplir con sus exigencias, son la base del éxito del negocio.

Actualmente doña Idalia requiere un préstamo de ¢680,000 (seiscientos mil colones) para comprar una máquina especial para coser y materiales como telas, hilos, etc. Con esta inversión espera poder incrementar su producción y mejorar la calidad de los  productos. Afirma que gracias a este préstamo podrá atraer a más clientes, ofrecer mejores alternativas y mejorar considerablemente la calidad de sus productos.

Doña Idalia es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer crédito y con el espera seguir creciendo personal y profesionalmente.

loans.use: Compra de una máquina de coser, telas, hilos, entre otros materiales

loans.name: Sovann

texts.en:
Mrs. Sovann S. is a villager in Kampong Chrey village in Takeo province. She is farmer who owns a plot of land which she uses to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she is a Khmer noodle seller.

Mrs. Sovann S. is a 50-year-old widow with five children, three of whom are employed in different positions while the others are enrolled in the local school. Although Mrs. Sovann S.’s family members try to work hard to earn income, they still earn less income than needed to support the family living. Thus, Mrs. Sovann S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice C. is a resident of Manyatta, a slum area in Kisumu, Kenya. She is also a practicing community health worker and runs a business of grocery selling. She started this business in 2002 because she wanted to supplement her husband’s income. Beatrice says it has made it easier for them to take care of their four children. Her future plans is to make sure her business expands, her children get the best of education and that her family rests on a stable life economically. Beatrice would like a loan of $275.

loans.use: To buy more grocery stock

loans.name: Jhanet

texts.es:
Jhanet tiene 29 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 3 hijos.Sus años de infancia están marcado por los telares y los tejidos; pero desde que formó su propia familia, apoyada por su esposo, se dedica al negocio de la venta de comestibles de primera necesidad, en su casa implementó un espacio muy acogedor para que será su bodega.
Todos los días, a las 5 de la mañana, acude a la panadería para comprar los panes calientes al gusto de sus clientes, pues a las 6 ya se le encuentra laboriosamente limpiando y atendiendo  su negocio. De ese modo tiene muy contentos a sus clientes, a los que aprecia mucho, pues comprendió tempranamente  que “son la razón de su negocio”,  por ello, se esmera en atenderles bien, ya que gracias a ellos, capta el dinero para su casa.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, donde le agrade mucho trabajar en la modalidad del banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de más mercadería para su bodega.
texts.en:
Jhanet is 29 years and lives with her partner, who is the father of their 3 children. She learned how to weave as a child. Now that she has her own family and is supported by her husband, Jhanet sells basic food necessities out of a cramped space inside of her house.

Every morning at 5am, she goes to the bakery to purchase warm bread that her customers enjoy. By 6am she is feverishly cleaning her store and preparing it to open for business. This delights her customers, who appreciate her efforts. Jhanet learned early on that her customers are the reason for her business. Therefore she tries to keep them happy because they allow her to earn household income.

This is Jhanet’s second loan with MFP. She enjoys working with her Communal Bank. They money she is requesting will be used to purchase more merchandise for her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Nathalie

texts.en: Nathalie is a 40-year-old married woman and mother of one child. In 2000, she decided to open a clothes shop as her own business to earn additional income for the household. Today, Nathalie is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy more clothes in order to augment her sales and make a good income for the family.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Din

texts.en:
Selling groceries makes up a significant part of 28-year-old Din P.’s daily routine. Mrs. Din P. has been operating a grocery in front of her home for a year and is earning approximately $4 a day. Din P. owns a machine her husband uses to mill rice for a profit. This couple is married with a young child who is enrolled in school. 

Din P. faces difficulties traveling to buy her inventory from the market because she doesn’t own a vehicle. Due to that problem, she requests a loan to buy a used motorbike, which she will use as transportation. Din P. was not available that day so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike to transport grocery inventory

loans.name: Guisela

texts.es: Guísela tiene 29 años y vive  con su pequeño hijo de 8 años en la casa  de un familiar.Desde hace 4 años decidió generar sus recursos propios y empezó a dedicarse a dos negocios en paralelo  que le eran muy  rentables, la venta de yogurt y  de verduras, es así que durante las mañanas  sale a  vender verduras de manera ambulante  en el mercado central de su ciudad ,y  a partir del medio día vende  en el mismo lugar su yogurt  hasta altas  horas de la noche; de esta manera logra obtener ingresos diarios que distribuye para las necesidades de ella y de su hijo. Guísela desea seguir progresando en la vida y uno de sus  anhelos es tener  un puesto de ventas estable donde pueda ofrecer sus productos sin problemas.Es la tercera oportunidad que  tiene un crédito con  MFP, por lo cual renueva su compromiso de ser responsable y puntual como siempre.Una parte del dinero lo invertirá en  la compra de  yogurt al por mayor y la otra en la compra de verduras.
texts.en:
Guísela is 29 years old and lives with her 8 year old son in the house of a relative. Four years ago, she decided to earn her own income by starting two profitable businesses at the same time selling vegetables and yogurt. In the mornings, she sells vegetables as a street vendor at the city central market. Starting at noon, she sells yogurt from the same spot until late at night. This is how she earns daily income to meet the needs for herself and her son. Guísela wants to progress in life and one of her goals is to have a stable vending location where she can offer her products without encountering any problems.

This is her third loan with MFP. Guísela renews her commitment to be responsible and punctual as before. Part of the proceeds will be used to buy yogurt wholesale and the remainder will go toward buying vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables & yogurt to sell

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
La persona que aparece es la esposa del señor Ignacio A. S..

El señor A. es una persona que piensa en el bienestar de sus hijos para cuando sean grandes; es por ello que el desea ampliar su casa para brindarles la mayor comodidad. El todas las mañanas sale a trabajar para conseguir el pan de cada día, el se dedica a impartir la noticia por radio, para conseguirla tiene que salir por las calles para estar actualizado de cada hecho que pasa en el día. El pide el apoyo para poder realizar su proyecto de construcción.
texts.en:
The person who appears in the phono is Ignacio A. S.'s wife. Mr. A. is a person who is always conscious of providing well-being for his children as they grow up. For this reason, he would like to enlarge his house to provide better comfort. Every day he goes out to work to earn his daily bread. He is a radio newsman. In order to get the news he must roam the streets in order to be up to date on daily occurences. He asks for help in order to complete his construction project.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora A. is a 52-year-old married woman who lives in Prk Cubay, Brgy Guinhalaran, Silay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three trisikads. For those of you that do not know what a trisikad is, allow me to shed some light for you. A trisikad is a typical means of transportation in the Philippines. It is a BMX bike with a small sidecar attached. Inside is a padded seat big enough to fit two (though as many as five people can fit on a trisikad at one time). This is different from a tricycle which is a motorbike with a sidecar attached. Leonora owns three trisikads, all of which are used to generate income for her family. Leonora’s husband, Raul, also helps run the business. They have two children ages 21 and 27 years old. The two children work and help the family financially. Leonora wants to buy another trisikad and expand her business. This is a great opportunity for you to help a Kiva borrower expand her business. Leonora joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in March of 2002 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income, earning an extra 4,800 Philippine pesos (PHP) from her business activities. Leonora is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of 14,000 PHP was used to fund the operations of her trisikad business and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is requesting her 17th loan, for 10,000 PHP, which she intends to use to buy a trisikad. Leonora is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy a trisikad

loans.name: Sandra Maria

texts.es:
Sandra María M., Labora como Conserje en el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua.

 Ella tiene tres hijos a su cargo, y dos se  encuentran en  edad escolar, es casada, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante siete años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido nueve crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL. El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra zinc y pintura para su casa de habitación  por lo que anteriormente el techo de su casa se encontraba en mal estado.

Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sandra María M. works as a custodian in the Mercado Mayoreo (wholesale market) in Managa. She has three children under her care; two of them are school-age. She is married. She has worked with loans with Ceprodel for six years. During that time she has invested nine loans in the improvement of her house. She did this thanks to the loans from Ceprodel. The loan she is requesting is to buy zinc and paint for her house. The roof of her house has been in bad shape. Her objective is to have greater security and a better condition of life for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve and expand her house

loans.name: Sami

texts.en: Sami, 41 years old and married with 3 children, has worked as a car painter since 1982.  During his lengthy time in this occupation, he has gained a large number of clients asking for his painting services. He's thankful for his work, as it has allowed him over the years to improve,his living situation. Today, Sami is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy a used car that he can repair and then resell at a good profit.

loans.use: To buy a used car at a good price to repair and resell

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
El Sr. Hugo M. tiene 41 años de edad oriundo de la ciudad de Acahay  está casado hace más de 12 años con la señora. Felicia de 38 años de edad, tienen 2 hijos juntos, uno en edad escolar y el otro esta cursando el cuarto año de la carrera de análisis de sistema en una de la universidades de la zona.          
El señor  Hugo es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos hace  15 años recorriendo por toda las ciudades en busca de clientes, gracias a su esfuerzo y a esta actividad pudo construir su casa propia en el centro mismo de la ciudad en un terreno que heredó de su padre, frente a un colegio. Viendo la necesidad de ampliar su negocio y contar con artículos de librería y  una fotocopiadora, se acercó a la Fundación Paraguaya a solicitar el préstamo para realizar la compra de los mismos.
texts.en:
Hugo M., 41, is from the city of Acahay; he's been married for the last 12 years to Felicia, 38. They have two children, one who is school-aged and one who is in fourth year of college, majoring in Systems Analysis. Hugo is a merchant; he sells home appliances. He has been in this line of work for 15 years traveling to several cities seeking customers. Thanks to his efforts and to this commercial activities, he managed to build his own home across from a school downtown on a lot that he inherited from his father. He called upon Fundación Paraguaya to request funds because he wants to add the sale of stationery supplies and a photocopy machine to his business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy notebooks, sheets of paper and assorted school supplies.

loans.name: Kabembe Women's Group, Mukono

texts.en:
B. Rehema, shown in the small photo at the top, also appears in the big photo as the group leader. Standing 4th from the left is Namukwaya Prossy who did not receive a loan from her lending group of Kabembe although she appeared in the group photo.

Rehema is 46 years old and married with seven children with only one child still in school. She also takes care of her other siblings. She has a salon and also a hall in which she shows movies to her customers. She has been in business for twelve years and her major strong point is the quality of what she does.

Although Rehema is able to make 350,000/= as weekly profits, she is still faced with a challenge of the lack of enough capital. She needs a loan to be able to restock her salon with more hair chemicals and hair pieces as well as having more CDs and DVDs for for better and more up-to-date viewing.

loans.use: To restock her salon and to buy more CDs and DVDs

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married woman with nine children, three boys and six girls, between the ages of 25 and 4 years old. The oldest child finished primary school but could not go further because of a lack of funds. Ruth's other children are attending school.

With the ksh. 20,000 loan, Ruth wants to purchase coconuts from farmers to sell to the cooperative society that makes palm oil. She has been in this business for ten years and also earns extra income as a farmer, growing cassava and maize to sustain her family.

The main challenge to her business is that the cooperative society is inconsistent and sometimes pays her late. She rents her home and does not have either water or electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food. Ruth joined Yehu because she likes its structure and the fact that she could join without having to save a minimum amount.

loans.use: To purchase coconuts

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf A. H. is a 32 year old married man from Ramallah. He lives with his wife and two children.

In 2010, Ashraf opened his own roastery store. With this loan, he hopes that he would be able to buy a grinding machine and candy for his store, which will increase his income and improve the status of his store.

loans.use: To buy a grinding machine and candy for his store

loans.name: Bazar

texts.ru: Базар проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 38 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Образование - высшее, "Педагог". По специальности проработал более 12 лет. Сейчас клиент занимается торговлей. У него магазин, где он продает продукты питания. Этим видом бизнеса занимается уже 5 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Bazar lives in the region of Yavan. He is 38 years old. He is married and has five children. He has high education in teaching. He has worked in his profession for more than twelve years. Right now he is in trade. He has a store where he sells groceries. He has been in this business for already five years. He is taking out the loan to increase sales.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Ngaet

texts.en: Mrs. Ngaet S. is 40 years-old and lives in Anlong Ta Sek Leu village in Kandal province. She is married to Mr. Vanna Son. She is a duck breeder who earns some money to support her family. However, she has a problem because her ducks are too small to sell.  In order to improve her breeding ducks, Mrs. Ngaet S. is asking for a loan to buy duck food. Her husband is a farmer who owns more than two-hectares of land to grow crops to sell to support his family. From these activities, they support four children.  Three of the children attend the local public school and the other is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy duck food.

loans.name: Kotognogontala Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA est constitué de 6 femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 3 enfants et vivant dans des familles polygames à HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’habits  pour enfants (avec HAOUA B.), de céréales, de condiments alimentaires,  du bois de chauffe etc.
HAOUA B. compte acheter avec son  prêt, 10 douzaines d’habits pour enfants.  Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso auprès des grossistes. Les habits sont vendus au  marché de Hamdallaye et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant et souvent à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 39.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  dans les dépenses de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et d’entreprendre des voyages à l’extérieur.
texts.en:
The group KOTOGNOGONTALA consists of six married women, on average 40 years old with three children, and living in polygamous families in the Hamdallaye borough of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali). This is the group’s fifth collaboration with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI to satisfy their customers’ needs, and the preceding loans have been repaid. This group of women is active in the retail commerce of children’s clothing (as with Haoua B.), grain cereals, food condiments, firewood, etc. With her loan, Haoua B. wants to buy 10 dozen sets of clothing for children. She gets her supplies from wholesalers at the main market in Sikasso. She resells the clothes at the Hamdallaye market and through home delivery to men and women customers, for cash and often for credit. She hopes to reach average monthly earnings of 39,500 FCFA of which part will be used for family expenses and the remainder invested in the commercial activities. Her ambition is to increase her turnover to improve customer satisfaction, and undertake foreign trips.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy children's clothing

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn S. is 46 years old and a very simple woman. She has tried to enjoy her life to the fullest despite being poor. When she became a mother to her two children, the urge to discover her potential to be productive and help her husband earn money for their living pre-occupied her thoughts. This has intensified with her eldest child going to college, the second in high school. 

With determination to graduate her children from college and improving their standard of living, she joined ASHI in 2003. The first loan she received was used to finance and grow a vegetable business. This kind of livelihood activity is the most common source of income of the many families in the village where Evelyn and her family live. Every day they go to different municipalities to market their products. Evelyn works hard with her husband to bring home money to support to the needs of their children. Given the opportunity to have larger amount of capital, Evelyn and her husband hope to make their business stable and profitable. Through this, they will be able to make life enjoyable for their children until they are capable of living their own lives away from poverty.

loans.use: To purchase large volume of vegetables for sale

loans.name: Amador

texts.es:
Amador es un padre de familia de 47 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos en el caserío Las Delicias del distrito de Oyotún, una zona agrícola ubicada a dos horas aproximadamente de  la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas desde hace mas de veinte años, actualmente cuenta con un terreno heredado de su padre con el cual se gana la vida sembrando diversos cereales como el arroz, debido a la abundancia de recurso hídrico en la zona, se suele sembrar arroz hasta dos veces por año. Esta actividad es la principal fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta por lo que siempre da lo mejor de su para mantenerse en el negocio y poder salir adelante.

Amador desea seguir trabajando durante esta temporada del año, el desea sembrar arroz en su campo de cultivo, para realizar su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

El es una persona trabajadora y bastante conocida en la zona por ser alguien amable y que siempre está dispuesto a ayudar cuando se le necesita. Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para mejorar gradualmente la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Amador, 47, is a father who lives with his wife and two children in Las Delicias settlement, Oyotún district; a farming area located about two hours from the city of Chiclayo. He has been a farmer for over 20 years. He currently has a field that was passed down to him by his father that he earns his living on planting various crops like rice. Because of the abundant water sources in the area, rice tends to be planted up to twice a year. This activity is his main source of income so he always puts in his best effort to insure that his business is successful so that he can progress. Amador wants to continue working during this season. He wants to plant rice on his fields. To reach this goal he has called upon Edpyme Alternativa for the first time requesting a 1000 new sol loan. He is a hard working man who is well known in the area as being a kind person who is always willing to help out when needed. His greatest wish is to continue working and gradually improve his family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For expenses related to rice planting.

loans.name: Maria Soledad

texts.es:
María Soledad vive en el departamento de Cusco junto con su esposo y sus dos hijos. María Soledad abrió una pequeña imprenta, donde hace poster, afiches, almanaques, etc. La pueden encontrar en su puesto, los 7 días de la semana, desde muy temprano hasta bastante tarde de la noche.  María Soledad desprende una imagen de experiencia y profesionalidad. Un flujo regular de clientes visita su Imprenta. Ella elabora sus productos de buena calidad y a un costo barato.     
     
Con su próximo préstamo, María Soledad espera recibir $700 USD. Por el momento, su imprenta esta modestamente equipado con las necesidades más básicas. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar más materiales como por ejemplo tintas, papeles, cartulinas, etc.  

María Soledad pertenece al banco comunal  “El Amanecer”. Ya son varios ciclos que participa en el banco comunal y le han reafirmado la confianza para los préstamos.
texts.en:
María Soledad lives in the Cusco district with her husband and two children. María Soledad opened a small printing press where she makes posters, prints, calendars, etc. You can find her at work seven days a week from early in the morning until late at night. María Soledad projects an image of experience and professionalism. A regular flow of customers visits her press. She makes high quality products at a low cost. With her next loan, María Soledad hopes to receive $700 USD. For the moment, her press is modestly equipped with the most basic necessities. She would like to use the loan to purchase more materials such as inks, papers, cards, etc. María Soledad belongs to the communal bank El Almanecer, or ‘Dawn.’ She has participated in the communal bank for several loan cycles, which have reaffirmed her confidence to take out loans.

Translated from Spanish by Rachael Mossey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials such as inks, papers, cards, etc.

loans.name: Baatar

texts.en: Baatar D. is a 40 year old retired man and he is engaged in running a small, successful business . He lives with his wife in Huvsgul province,  in western Mongolia.  He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.  He has been  making wooden items since the age of 17. But in 2005, Baatar began his carpentry business in cooperation with a local construction company making wooden furniture while his wife started sewing clothing in their home town. Baatar is a very hard working, productive and initiative person. Baatar wants to create his own workplace in his town and enlarge his carpentry operation as well as developing his wife's sewing business and provide her with necessary materials and supplies. He is requesting a loan of 500,000 MNT to purchase more wood and timber for his business and supplies for his wife's sewing business.

loans.use: To purchase more wood and timber

loans.name: Hazel Ivania

texts.es:
Hazel es una joven, trabajadora, madre de una niña, casada. Como objetivo es poder terminar de reparar su pequeña casa.
Trabaja como asistente logrando obtener ingresos y venta de ropa, para poder apoyar a su esposo y lograr mejores condiciones de vivienda. Ya que atraves de los préstamos ha venido mejorando su casa, con el crédito anterior logro poner cerámica y con este podrá cerrar el cuarto de baldosa ya que es bajo y no tiene privacidad lo que es de gran relevancia para lograr satisfacer esta necesidad.
Todo ha incrementado y es difícil la construcción en estos días, pero atreves del financiamiento se logra por sus plazos, lo que está contenta porque así ha mejorado su vivienda.
texts.en:
Hazel is a young, hard working mother. She is married and has a daughter. Her objective is to finish repairing her small house. She works as an Assistant earning a salary and sells clothes to help her husband and manage to improve the conditions of her house. Through loans she has been making improvements to the house. The previous loan allowed her to install tile and this one will be used to close off the bedroom with paving stones because it lacks privacy due to the wall being so low. This will meet this need. Everything has gotten more expensive and construction is difficult these days but through financing it can be done in stages. She is happy because she has been improving her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy tile and cement and will raise her bedroom walls because she lack personal privacy and she wants to improve this condition.

loans.name: Alex

texts.es: Alex H. N., tiene la edad de 25 años, está en unión libre, y vive con su compañera. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de artículos para su negocio. Desea tener un inventario más amplio y variado de los artículos de su bazar. Tiene varios años de haber empezado con este negocio, y cuenta con muy buenos clientes, por eso ve la necesidad de ofrecer mayor variedad de productos en el negocio, además de aportar mayores ingresos para la economía de su hogar. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy agradecido con las facilidades que se le brindaron. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como comerciante.
texts.en:
Alex H. N., 25, is in a common law relationship; he lives with his partner. He will use the loan to buy merchandise for his store. He wants to have a more varied inventory in stock. He started the business several years ago and that’s why he now sees the need to offer a greater variety of products as well as to bring increased income to the home. This is his first loan request with FUDECOSUR and he is very grateful for the loan terms offered to him. He hopes to provide his family with better quality of life and improved economic stability in the future and to continue growing both as a person and as a merchant.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie W. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 42 years old. Tessie is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a mini-restaurant, serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $175 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Tessie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant

loans.name: Regina Nyambura

texts.en:
Regina Nyambura M. is a 31-year old lady married to Joseph Nganga, who is also a businessperson. They have two children. They live in Gitaru in Kikuyu, and their shop is situated along the highway where there is a constant flow of customers. Regina has been running the business since the year 2006, with a profit margin of 25,000 Kenyan shillings (Ksh) per month. 

Regina was introduced to KADET LTD by Mr. Mwaura, who is the chairman of an existing group of KADET. Having no history with any MFI, Regina is applying for her first loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings which she intends to use to add more stock to her retail shop.

Regina hopes to diversify her business and raise funds to enable her to start poultry farming and be in a position to provide for her children.

loans.use: To add more variety to her stock, like margarine, cooking oil, flour, etc.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita L. is from the village of Libertad, Misamis Oriental. She is 55 years old. Lolita is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Lolita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk foods in the local community.
