Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lolita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Lolita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
This is 53-year-old Fatu. She is married and has three children. She has three additional dependents who live with her because they are her relatives. 

In 1980, Fatu established her clothing business. She began her business because she wanted to have a means of generating income to help her husband support the home. 

Working six days a week and nine hours a day, Fatu earns about 1,126,000 Sierra Leone leones (SLL) every month from this business. She needs a loan of 3,000,000 SLL to buy more clothing. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 337,800 SLL. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for resale

loans.name: Ganchimeg

texts.en: Ganchimeg C. is a 42 year-old widow who lives with her four children in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her children live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest son attends university while her youngest two children, 9 and 7 years old, both attend a local primary school. Ganchimeg operates a fruit and vegetable retail business in the Bars market, one of the largest wholesale fruit and vegetable trading markets in the city. She began her business in 1990 selling vegetables in the Harhorin market of the city. Her earnings have enabled her to start building a house in her yard. In the future, she plans to continue growing her business and establish her own grocery shop with help of her son. Ganchimeg is a hardworking and honest woman and is requesting a 750,000 MNT loan to purchase construction materials to build her house and to buy more sewing materials for herself.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to build her house

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca C. is from the village of Barangay 24, Gingoog City. She is 45 years old. Rebecca is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rebecca owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk foods in the local community. Rebecca has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rebecca joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rebecca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like beverages & junk foods. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Rebecca from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like beverages & junk foods

loans.name: Gultakin

texts.en: Gultakin M. is a farmer, who lives in Imishli. She is 30 year old woman, married, and a mother of two boys, who are school-age. Gultakin has a cattle-breeding business which she started in 2008. She considers animal feed to be the biggest obstacle to the success of her business. After repaying her previous loan, Gultakin decided to apply for her second loan in the amount of 1000 AZN. The loan was spent to buy two cows and as working capital for animal feed purchases. Now she has seven cows. Gultakin sells meat and dairy in the Imishli bazaar every day. The family income is now 300 AZN. She hopes to open a farm with the help of her husband.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and two cows

loans.name: Benhur

texts.en:
Benhur E. lives in the town of Trinidad. He is 26 years old, married and has two children who are ages eight and two. He earns a living by providing "habal-habal" (or motorcycle) transport services. He also started and runs a small repair and vulcanizing shop, and hopes to acquire more of the materials he needs to run this shop.

Benhur joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his life and ability to engage in business. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is applying for a new one, for 8,000 PHP, to buy tires and other items for his shop. He plans to use the additional revenue generated by his business to establish a fund he can use in emergencies.

loans.use: to buy tires and other items for a repair shop

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “EL MOLINITO II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Benedicta; ella tiene 60 años de edad y es viuda y tiene 7 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de verduras, la socia compra verduras del mercado de Huancaro y los vende en el mercado de el molino, la socia trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de verduras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras como zanahorias, papas, arvejas entre otras verduras.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Benedicta is a member of the communal bank, El Molinito II. The bank is located in the district of Cusco in Cusco province, department of Cusco.

Benedicta is over 60 years old and is a widow with seven children. She divides her time between her daily activities and her job selling vegetables. She buys her vegetables at the Huancaro market and sells them in the El Molino market and works every day from 5:00 am until 5:00 pm. Benedicta would like to expand her vegetable selling business. She has requested this loan in order to buy vegetables such as carrots, potatoes, peas, and other vegetables.

Benedicta is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: She has requested the loan in order to buy vegetables such as carrots, potatoes, peas, and other vegetables.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna J. is from the village of Samay, Gingoog City. She is 41 years old. Lorna is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Lorna owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making and selling homemade sausage or "chorizzo" in the local community. Lorna has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Lorna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale such as ground pork. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Lorna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients such as ground pork, needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Berenice

texts.es: La Sra. Berenice comenta que utilizara su crédito en la construcción de un cuarto debido a  que  su casa es de interés social comenta que los cuartos son muy pequeños y que desea construir una recamara mas amplia para  así tener  mas  espacio y a su vez contar con una cocina mas grande ya  que es  donde pasa  la  mayor parte  del  tiempo.
texts.en: Ms. Berenice explains that she will use her loan to build a room onto her house, as it was purchased through a government-subsidized program so the rooms are very small. She would like to build a larger bedroom in order to have more space. She also says she would like to build a bigger kitchen because that is where she spends the majority of her time.

loans.use: to build a room onto her house

loans.name: Nora Marita

texts.es:
La señora Nora, es socia del banco comunal Las Luchadoras, del Distrito de Campo Verde, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y tiene 6 hijos.
Recién lleva un año trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano, ropa que vende por los caseríos y amigos.  Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura. 
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/.1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 15 pantalones, 20 polos, 5 vestidos para niñas, 10 pantalones para niños, 5 chompitas para niños, 10 faldas para damas, 3 vestidos, 10 blusas, 10 camisas manga larga,  2 doc. de ropas interiores para damas, 2 doc. de calzoncillos para caballeros, 1 doc., de calzoncillos para niños.
Con este negocio puede ayudar en los gastos del hogar, porque si  sus clientes no tienen dinero le pagan con animales de corral (patos, gallinas, cuy)  y los recibe  para luego venderlos en el mercado. 
En este tiempo ha podido aportar con algo a su hogar, está contenta porque el negocio va muy bien.
texts.en:
Señora Nora is a member of the communal bank Las Luchadoras (The Fighting Women) in the district of Campo Verde of the department of Ucayali. She is 42 years old, married and the mother of six children.

It is just one year ago that she took out her first loan from Manuela Ramos. She sells second-hand clothes to villagers in the hamlets nearby and to her friends. Her husband is a farmer.

She will use her new loan of 1000 nuevos soles to buy 15 pairs of pants, 20 polo shirts, 5 dresses for girls, 10 pairs of pants for boys, 5 sweaters for children, 10 skirts for women, 3 suits, 10 blouses, 10 long-sleeved shirts, 24 items of underwear for women, 24 underpants for men and 12 underpants for boys.

This business enables her to help with household expenses, because when her customers have no money she barters her merchandise for small farm animals (ducks, chickens or guinea pigs) and sells them at the market. Recently she was able to improve her home. She is happy because her business is doing fine.

loans.use: to buy clothes, skirts, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: Juan Francisco G. Q. de 52 años de edad, vive en casa propia con grupo familiar conformado por su esposa y tres hijos en el Barrio Concepción, Departamento de San Vicente. Durante toda su vida ha trabajado y ha procurado dar  todo lo que puede a su familia. Gracias a su esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos y dos de ellos ya le ayudan económicamente, ya que han logrado obtener un pequeño empleo. Don Juan  es un hombre humilde que toda su vida ha dependido de la agricultura. Se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijoles y a la crianza de ganado bovino. Cada año tiene que invertir en insumos agrícolas como: abonos, venenos, semilla, etc. Para poder seguir cultivando los granos básicos que es  el sustento para el resto del año. Debido a esto se ha visto obligado de acudir a INTEGRAL para solicitar este crédito con la fe puesta en Dios que  va  a ser un año lleno de bendiciones para la siembra y por ende para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is 52 years old and lives in his own house among his family group, composed of his wife and 3 children, in Barrio Concepcion, San Vicente department. All his life, Juan has worked and given all he could to his family. Thanks to his efforts, he has been able to advance his children. Juan has been able to aid 2 of them economically and they have gained employment.

Juan is a humble man who has depended upon agriculture all his life.  He cultivates corn and beans and raises cattle. Each year he must invest in agricultural supples, such as fertilizers, pesticides, seeds, etc., to be able to continue cultivating basic grains, which provides his sustenance for the rest of the year. For this reason, Juan has been obliged to approach INTEGRAL to request this loan, with his faith placed in God that it will be a year filled with blessings for the harvest and ultimately, for him and his family.

loans.use: TO BUY SUPPLIES TO CULTIVATE CORN AND BEANS, AND TO RAISE CATTLE

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter T. is a 35 year-old single, hardworking gentleman. He has been operating a mobile phone service, locally known as M-PESA.  He also sells phone accessories to his customers, who are mostly the residents of Kahawa Wendani, where he lives.

He has been in this business for three years and earns a profit of KES.10,000 per month. He is applying for his third loan, which he plans to use to increase his M-PESA float so that he can serve his customers well. He repaid the previous loans well and in good time.

The anticipated profits he will plow back into the business

loans.use: to increase the M-PESA float(money transfer service)

loans.name: Khodor

texts.en:
Khodor is a 43-year-old married man living in Tyre with his wife and one child. Khodor owns a tractor which he uses to fix other people's land in order to plant new seeds or small trees. To support his family, Khodor runs several businesses; in addition to driving his tractor, he bakes Markouk bread and sells it to a few shops and individuals who request continuously from him. He also works at harvesting olives for olive tree owners during their harvest season. He is a good worker. He has 16 years of experience. His clients are friends, neighbors and cooperatives.

Khodor has good reputation for his commitment to work. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the eighth time in order to buy a plot of land. All his previous loans had a great impact on his social and financial situation, and at the same time he was a borrower in good standing. He is intent on improving his living conditions as much as he can.

loans.use: To buy a new plot of land to plow and plant.

loans.name: Adjeniya Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ADJENIYA est composé de trois personnes qui vivent toutes dans la même localité à Sèkandji dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Rafiatou est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Rafiatou est née le 11 Juin 1966 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin et est mariée à un démarcheur nommé Karim. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont trois à leur charge. Certains parmi les enfants sont scolarisés. Rafiatou et son mari assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Depuis près de six ans, Rafiatou vit à Sèkandji avec son mari et ses enfants. Afin de se prendre en charge et d'améliorer son niveau de vie, Rafiatou exerce depuis sept ans environs, comme activité la vente de produits de quincaillerie à Sèkandji. C’est au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin, que Rafiatou s’approvisionne. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son fonds de roulement et son revenu, Rafiatou sollicite, ensemble avec son groupe, un premier crédit.
texts.en: The Adjeniya group is composed of three individuals living in the same area in Sèkandji, in the community of Sèmè-Podji. This is the first time that the group is seeking financing from  ALIDé,  in order to expand their activities. The group’s representative, by the name of Rafiatou, is the one raising her hand in the photo. Rafiatou was born on June 11, 1966 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, and is married to Karim, a vendor. They have four children, three of whom are still in the couple’s care. Some children are in school. Rafiatou and her husband jointly provide for the family needs.  Rafiatou  has been living in Sèkandji with her husband and children for almost six years. In order to support herself and improve her quality of life, Rafiatou has been working for about seven years as a vendor of hardware supplies. She stocks up in Nigeria, a country neighboring Benin. With the goal of meeting her customers’ expectations and increasing her working capital and income, Rafiatou, together with her group, is seeking her first loan.

loans.use: to buy hardware supplies

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 36 years old and married. She has four school-aged children. Emelyn has a food stall where she sells cooked food in the community.

Emelyn has had this business for four years and she earns approximately PHP 5,000 monthly. She is asking for a loan of PHP 9,000 to purchase additional cooking ingredients to cook more dishes to sell.

In the future, Emelyn hopes that her business will improve to be able to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional cooking ingredients

loans.name: Cresanta

texts.en:
Cresanta is 40 years old, married with 3 children, and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. Cresanta started a mini-grocery store 9 years ago, and continues the business today. She sells assorted products in the area. Each month she earns 5,000 PHP from her business. 

Not contented, Cresanta plans to add an extension to her store, so she has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase additional stock to sell. 

Cresanta has been member of GDMPC more than 3 years. In the future, she dreams of having a big grocery store in the area.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her grocery store

loans.name: Aliakbar

texts.ru: Алиакбар проживает в районе А. Джоми. Ему 29 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он более 6 лет занимается животноводством и одновременно растениеводством. Он покупает несколько голов бычков, откармливает и продает по более выгодной цене. Еще он сеет пшеницу, дыню и арбуз. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 6 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота, чтобы увеличить количество скот и получить больше прибыли.
texts.en: Aliakbar lives in the A. Jomi region. He's twenty-nine years old, married and has two children. His wife takes care of their home. Aliakbar raises animals and crops for a living: He buys a couple bulls, fattens and then sells them with profit. He also grows wheat, melons and watermelons. Aliakbar has been in this business for six years and he's requesting a loan in order to acquire some more cattle, increase his herd and profits.

loans.use: to purchase large cattle

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 45 years old, married, and has five children. She has been tailoring for seven years to earn a living. She has employed one person to assist her in the business. Susan joined Faulu Kenya so that she could get loans easily. She used her previous loan to boost her business. She hopes to grow her business and increase her clientele. 

Susan has requested 70,000 Kenyan shillings to buy fabric, an overlock machine, and curtain tape.

loans.use: To buy fabric, an overlock machine, and curtain tape

loans.name: Houssam

texts.en:
Houssam is a 29-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives independently. He has owned an insurance office since 2009 and has more than five years of experience working in the same occupation. He deals with multiple insurance companies. He sells different types of insurance such as life, all risks, car, health insurance, etc. He has one part-time employee working as an outdoor sales agent under his supervision. 

Today, Houssam is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase insurance to sell. In the future, he is hoping to expand his business operation into other areas.

loans.use: to purchase insurance to sell.

loans.name: Yovanna

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA ALTERNATIVA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yovanna; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, ella vende pantalones, polos, chompas y casacas y también la socia tiene una jugueria donde prepara diferentes sabores de jugos, la socia por medio de estos pequeños negocios saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de ropas y ampliar el negocio de jugueria. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pantalones, chompas, polos y blusas y también para comprar frutas como manzanas, naranjas, uvas y plátanos.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Yovanna belongs to the “Nueva Alternativa” (New Alternative) Communal Bank, located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

Yovanna is 32 years old, living in a common-law marriage, and has 1 child. She spends her days at her business selling clothing, including pants, polo shirts, sweaters, and zip jackets. Also, she has a fruit juice making stall where she prepares different flavors of juices. By this means, she advances her child. Yovanna wants to expand her clothing store and her juice stall.

Yovanna is requesting a loan to buy pants, sweaters, polo shirts, and blouses, and also to buy fruit such as apples, oranges, grapes, and plantains.

Yovanna looks forward to the loan and promises to comply with the schedule of payments.

loans.use: buy pants, sweaters, polo shirts, and blouses to sell, and also to buy fruit (apples, oranges, grapes and plantains) for her fruit juice stand.

loans.name: Reynelda

texts.en:
Reynelda is 42 years old and is married with five children. She lives in Dapitan City. For the past seven years, she has been working in the fish industry selling fish to earn a living. Reynelda has been a member of PMPC for five years.

Reynelda is requesting a 9,000 PHP loan to purchase fresh fish to sell.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana, D. 71 años, es casada co su esposo por muchos años, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y un nieto a quien educo desD. muy pequeño.El trabajo D. Juana consiste en comprar al por mayor en el centro D. la ciudad, para luego vender al menudeo en su pequeña pero muy surtida tienda que tiene desD. hace dos años y que funciona en su casa para su mejor control y mator ganancia.Lo que le gusta D. su trabajo es que siempre hay clientes, lo que no le gusta es tener que decir no a las personas que a veces necesitan al crédito, opero los años D. experiencia le enseño que debe decir no en algún momento si no quiere salir perjudicada, espera mantener su negocio ya que no cree necesario poder agrandarlo ya que se abastece con lo que hace.Este es el préstamo numero 16 que realiza Juana con la institución MFP, le gusta el grupo que esta ya que todos son muy responsables, además agradece a la institución por la confianza brindada y espera poder seguir trabajando así por mucho tiempo mas ya que como dice ella, por mas que tenga edad avanzada tiene espíritu D. joven y ganas D. seguir trabajando.
Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, Juana comprará bebidas, y abarrotes para su tienda y así poder mantenerlo surtido.
texts.en:
Juana is 71, and has been married for many years. She has her own house, where she lives with her husband and grandson, who she has been raising since he was very small. Juana buys merchandise wholesale in the city center, and then later sells it at retail in her small, but very well-stocked store. 

She has had the store for two years, which she operates in her home, to better monitor it, and to have more profit.  What she likes about her work is that there are always customers; what she doesn't like is having to say no to people who sometimes need to buy on credit. But many years of experience has taught her that you have to say no at some point, if you don't want your business to be hurt. She hopes to keep her business going; she doesn't think it's necessary to expand it, since she is a able to proviD. for her needs with what she makes.

This is the 16th loan that Juana has maD. with the MFP institution. She likes the group she is in, as everyone is very responsible. As well she is grateful to the institution for the trust it has in her.  She hopes to be able to continue working in this way for a long time yet, since as she says, even though she is getting older, she has a young woman's spirit, and wants to keep working.  

With the amount she is applying for,1000 soles, Juana will buy drinks and groceries for her store, so as to keep it well-stocked.

loans.use: To buy drinks and groceries for her store, to keep it well-stocked.

loans.name: Juana Del Socorro

texts.es: Juana Del Socorro tiene 47 años, su actividad es la venta de refrescos y una pequeña pulpería. Hace más de5 años que tiene esta actividad económica, la mayoría de sus clientes llegan en busca de los diferentes refrescos que ofrece. Es por eso que solicita es para la compra de frutas, bolsas, pajillas, azúcar entre otros productos necesarios.
texts.en: Juana del Socorro is 47 years old. She sells beverages and has a small store. She has been doing this work for 5 years and notes that the majority of her customers come to buy the various kinds of soft drinks she offers. Consequently, she is requesting a loan to buy fruit, bags, straws, and sugar among other necessary products.

loans.use: to buy fruit, bags, straws, sugar and other necessary products.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 
Concepcion has a retail shop that sells silver & gold plated necklaces, bracelets and other jewelry.  She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy additional stock of silver & gold jewelry.
Concepcion is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Concepcion hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of silver & gold jewelry for her shop.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban, es un hombre alegre, entusiasta de 48 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su amada esposa Esedora, de 42 años y junto a ellos viven sus 05 queridos hijos, quienes son el motivo de seguir adelante.
Esteban, junto a su esposa se esmeran día a día por poder sobresalir, se dedican al cultivo de plantas como: café y cacao. Él tiene conocimiento de esta labor porque lleva trabajando 30 años durante su vida, lo cual le agrada porque gracias a ello puede resolver en los gastos de su familia y sobre todo en la educación de sus hijos. Lo más difícil, es tener que  cuidar sus cultivos de la plaga de insectos que pueden afectar su cosecha; pero aun así, él se esfuerza por dar todo de su parte y seguir haciendo trabajar sus terrenos para así obtener productos de calidad. Este será su 17avo crédito solicitado con MFP y por ello se siente muy contento de saber que contará una vez más con el apoyo de ustedes. En su banco comunal es muy activo y se lleva bien con sus compañeros. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles solicitados, podrá contratar peones que le ayuden a sacar la maleza que crece entre sus plantas para mantener un buen producto.
texts.en:
Esteban is a cheerful, enthusiastic, 48-year-old man living in his own house with his beloved wife, Esedora, 42, and their five beloved children who are his motivation to continue forward.

Esteban and his wife strive daily to be able to succeed.  They farm plants like coffee and cocoa beans.  He knows this occupation well because he’s been doing it during 30 years of his life which pleases him because thanks to it he’s able to cover family expenses and, above all, provide education for his children.

The most difficult thing is having to protect his crops from insect infestations that can affect the crop yield but, even so, he strives to give everything he can to continue to make his fields productive and grow quality products.

This will be his 17th MFP loan and he feels very happy to know that he will get support from you once again.  He is very active in his communal bank and he gets along well with his fellow members.  He will use the requested 1000 new soles to hire day workers to help him remove the weeds that grow between his plants to maintain a good product.

loans.use: to hire day workers.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 44-year-old married man. He has 4 children ranging in age from 4 to 20 years old. He describes himself as efficient. 

He operates a tailoring services business where he makes suits. He has been involved in this business for 11 years. His business is located in a busy shopping centre. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to add to his stock of materials. His business goal is to grow his business and open other branches within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he can buy a plot of land on which he will build a house for his family.

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary  lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married with three children and they all go to school. She takes care of one additional family member (a brother). 

She is a market vendor at Kalerwe market. She sells matooke, vegetables and fruits at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last six years. She works seven days a week.

She has requested a loan of 400,000 from Kiva partner MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, fresh beans, and vegetables. Her goals and aspirations are to own another stall in the same market and also to buy a plot of land. Her major business challenges are thieves and seasonality. 

She lives in a  rented house and the family has access to electricity but no access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent  and food.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is widowed with three children. Milagros is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Milagros is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Philippines pesos to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pig business.
 
Milagros has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: To purchase feeds and vitamins for her pig business.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es: La socia continua con su actividad principal de artesanía, la socia  desea invertir en la compra de hilos y cuero, la socia fabrica mochilas, porta celulares, bolsos, carteras, monederos, cartucheras, bolsitas; la socia también compra  accesorios como cierres, botones, cuerdas, mostacillas. La socia desea seguir creciendo y repartir los souvenirs a clientes en diferentes tiendas de ventas de artesanías, la socia desea crecer y llegar a mas clientes de este modo podra dar mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para la realizacion de sus diferentes trabajos.
texts.en: The borrower will continue her artesian crafts business, and will invest in thread and leather. She makes backpacks, cell phone cases, purses, wallets, coin purses, containers and small purses. The client also buys accessories such as clasps, buttons, string, and beads. She hopes to keep growing her business and distributing her souvenirs to clients in different artesian goods shops. She wants to grow and have more clients and thus extend a higher quality of life to her children. She is asking for the loan to invest in the purchase of materials for her various activities.

loans.use: invest in thread, leather, clasps, buttons and string.

loans.name: Kibisi Group

texts.en:
Elder is the facilitator of the Kibisi group. Elder and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Elder takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Elder had an excellent maize yield harvesting 17 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Elder was only able to harvest 5½ bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Elder and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Elder will educate his children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Kibisi group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Finangnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupement FINANGNON est composé de vingt et une personnes qui habitent la même région. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Addifondé est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une deuxième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Addifondé n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Addifondé est âgée de 42 ans et est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Rémi. Le couple a neuf enfants, dont quatre restent à leur charge. Addifondé et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. Pour contribuer aux besoins de sa famille, Addifondé vend depuis une trentaine d’année, de l’huile de palme, produit issu de la transformation de noix de palme. De façon secondaire, Addifondé vend également de la farine de manioc dans un village du Bénin. Addifondé s'approvisionne dans sa région. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Addifondé et les autres membres de son groupement sollicitent un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité.
texts.en: The FINANGNON association is made up of 21 people living in the same region. The representative of this group is Addifondé, the woman with her hand raised in the photo. In order to ramp up the level of their business and to better meet the demands of their clientele, this group is requesting, for a second time, the financial support of ALIDé. Addifondé never attended school. She is 42-years old and is married to a farmer named Rémi. The couple has 9 children, of which four remain under their care. Addifondé and her husband live together with their children. To contribute to the needs of the family, for roughly 30 years, Addifondé has been selling palm oil, which comes from the palm oil nut. Secondarily, Addifondé also sells manioc flour in a village in Benin. She stocks up in her region. In order to strengthen their business and better satisfy their clients, Addifondé and the other members of the group are requesting a second loan from ALIDé. Their goal is increase the level of their operation.

loans.use: to buy a truckload of palm oil fruit to convert into palm oil

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es: El socio es él Sr. Eleuterio; él socio continua trabajando con su familia y sus negocios de plastiqueria, el esta muy feliz porque a crecido mucho en el aspecto laboral y continua trabajando duro para poder a futuro cercano poner sus tiendas tipo sucursales a nivel de toda la región, el socio a integrado a sus hijos en el negocio familiar y el mismo esta estudiando cursos de administracion de empresas para mejorar especialmenmte en el area de marketing; el socio es una persona miuy alegre y optimista el tiene muchos sueños y los esta cumpliendo con mucho esfuerszo y trabajo. El socio solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra inicial de su mercaderia de plasticos que le llega de Juliaca y Lima.
texts.en:
This is Sr. Eleuterio.  He continues to work with his family and his plastics business. He is happy because his business has grown a lot and he continues to work hard to be able to open small stores around the region in the not too distant future. His children work in the family business and he is also studying administration courses to improve his business, especially in the area of marketing. He is a very happy person who has many dreams and with a lot of hard work and determination he is accomplishing those dreams. 

Eleuterio is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of plastics that will reach Juliaca and Lima.

loans.use: to purchase plastics for his business

loans.name: Shorena

texts.en:
Shorena is 38 years old. She lives in Kitskhi village with her family: her husband, Mamushka, her 19-year-old son, 18-year-old daughter and her parents-in-law (retired). Shorena’s husband is a mini-bus driver. Shorena has a small grocery store. She purchases grocery products in a nearby town and sells them in her store. Also the family owns 2 milk cows and sells dairy products on the local market. The total average monthly income of the family is 1000 Laris, including the pensions of Shorena’s parents in law. 

Shorena has requested credit to increase the stock available in her store. For the New Year season more customers will go to the store, requesting various products and Shorena wants to be ready to satisfy their demands. The sales and income of the store will go up. Shorena will use the increased income to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to increase stock in her grocery store.

loans.name: Tesai Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “TESAI” en homenaje a la pequeña fundación de salud de su Barrio. Las integrantes agradecen la oportunidad que le brinda la Fundación Paraguaya, pues por medio del programa que esta les brinda tienen la posibilidad de ayudar a sus familias y de aumentar sus ingresos. Actualmente se encuentran en el cuarto ciclo con 15 integrantes.
Una de los miembros es la señora Antonia, quien se encarga de la venta de productos de limpieza que ella misma elabora de forma artesanal. Comenta que le va muy bien, ya que a las personas les gusta mucho los productos que ella hace, por que son de buena calidad y económicos. Ella se define como una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora. Quienes la inspiran a seguir creciendo y superarse son sus familiares, pues ellos siempre la apoyan.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de los químicos que necesita para elaborar los productos de limpieza que vende, como ser, cloro, esencias, fragancias, lavandinas y demás. Agradece a la fundación y kiva por la oportunidad que progreso que les da a ella y a sus compañeras.
texts.en:
This communal bank is named Tesai in honor of the small health foundation in the neighborhood.  The members are grateful for the opportunity the Fundación Paraguaya is giving them.  It is through this program that they have the possibility of helping their families and of increasing their income.  They are currently in their fourth cycle with 15 members.

Antonia is one of the members.  She sells cleaning products that she makes herself.  She says that it is going very well for her.  People really like the products that she makes because they are of good quality and economical.  She is described as an enterprising and very hard-working woman.  Her family always supports her and inspires her to continue growing and improving.

She is requesting the loan to buy the chemicals that she needs to make the cleaning products that she sells.  She will buy things like chlorine, essences, fragrances, bleach, and others.  She is grateful to the Fundación and Kiva for the opportunity to progress that they are giving her and her colleagues.

loans.use: to buy chlorine, essences, fragrances, bleach, and others to make cleaning products.

loans.name: Fraternité Group

texts.fr: Le groupe FRATERNITÉ est composé de quatre personnes qui sont dans un même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Marie-Claire est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Marie-Claire âgée de 57 ans n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Marie-Claire est une veuve, mère de six enfants. Certains de ces enfants sont scolarisés et tous sont à sa charge. Marie-Claire vit avec ensemble avec ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par elle même. Pour cette raison, Marie-Claire vend des produits vivriers depuis dix sept ans. Marie-Claire s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Marie-Claire ensemble avec les membres du  groupe FRATERNITE, sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés

loans.use: Acheter des produits vivriers.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her child. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Jocelyn requested a PHP 2,200 loan through NWTF to buy a water filter. She is getting the water filter because she wants to have safe drinking water and a healthy family without any diseases caused by contaminated water. 

Jocelyn is aware that by using the water filter, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

loans.name: Claudia Maribel

texts.en:
Claudia is very enthusiastic and hard-working. She has 4 children, and right now all are in school. Her husband is a taxi driver but his income is not enough to cover all of the family\\\'s expenses. Therefore, a few years ago Claudia started her business. She sells Mary Kay beauty products and says that each day her business is becoming better known by clients and that sales are also better. Claudia wants to offer her children an education and a better quality of life. She knows that to achieve this, she must work a lot. She needs $275.00 USD to buy merchandise that will help her to stock enough for the demand of these products. She says that during the Christmas season her sales have risen so much that she has not been able to stock enough. She needs your help and support.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Claudia es una persona muy entusiasta y trabajadora, tiene 4 hijos en su familia, y por el momento todos se encuentran estudiando; su esposo trabaja como taxista sin embargo sus ingresos no son suficientes para cubrir con todos los gastos de la familia, por lo que Claudia inició su negocio hace algunos años. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza “Mary Key” y comenta que cada día se da a conocer entre sus clientes y sus ventas son mejores. Claudia desea ofrecer a sus hijos una educación y una mejor calidad de vida y sabe que para conseguirlo necesita trabajar mucho.

Ella requiere de $275 USD para comprar mercancía que le ayudara abastecer la demanda de estos productos, comenta que estas próximas fechas navideñas sus ventas se han incrementado de tal forma que no ha podido abastecer todos los pedidos. Ella necesita tu ayuda y apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Celina Wanjiku Mwangi intends to buy maize and wheat flour, sugar and cooking fat

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza, has twelve years experience working in a obstretician's office. After three years working in an office in her area, she has been entrusted with the mission of opening up her own office where she has been working for the past nine years. She began working by herself and thanks to her effort and perseverance, she has been able to maintain herself because of her constant dedication.

Esperanza is requesting a credit to increase her business which has grown because of the excellent attention she gives her patients. With this loan, Esperanza will buy medicines for prenatal care and instruments to carry out pap smears and other tests.

Esperanza is a 41 year old single mother of a 13 year old son who is in school. Esperanza hopes that this credit will help her better her business and the attention she gives her patients since she is located in a marginal area with limited resources and services. She needs the credit to buy medicines at a lower cost and in this manner better serve her patients in the most economical and efficient manner.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Maite Barragán

Esperanza con su experiencia de 12 años y 3 años trabajando en un consultorio del sector, le han dado la confianza para poner su propio consultorio el cual lo viene desempeñando desde hace 9 años. Se inicio individualmente gracias al esfuerzo y continuidad, de esa manera ha logrado mantenerse gracias a la constante dedicación que Esperanza posee.

Esperanza pide un crédito para incrementar su negocio. Debido a que su demanda aumentado gracias a su buena atención. Con este préstamo Esperanza comprara medicamentos para el control Prenatal y espátulas para realizar exámenes de papanicolao y otros.

Esperanza tiene 41 años es madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 13 años que esta estudiando. Esperanza tiene la confianza que con el crédito aspira mejorar su negocio y su atención a sus clientes, por estar en un sitio marginal de escasos recursos y servicios. Esperanza necesita el crédito para comprar medicinas a menor costo y de esta manera poder servir a sus clientes de la manera más económica y eficiente.

loans.use: Purchasing medicine

loans.name: Zulma

texts.en:
Mrs. Zulma Q. V. is 36 years old, is married with Don Gabriel Galeano, 38, and he works as a construction worker. This way, he is able to help out in the family income. They have one six year old son. The son is currently studying in the first grade of the Francisco Solano López School. They tell that with a lot of effort they are able to put their son in a good school even if it might not be the most convenient geographically.

Her business came about after her marriage, she decided to open her own convenience store. Considering the fact that the nearest store has more than 10 blocks away, she decided to open one from her residence so as to help out the neighbors and to contribute to the family income from the convenience of the house.

The required loan is for the purchase of more merchandise such as rice, noodles, flour, sugar, yerba, and drinks. This way they are tried to uphold their promise of customer satisfaction by restocking their supplies and having more variety.

loans.use: To purchase of more merchandize such as rice, noodles, flour, sugar, yerba, and drinks.

loans.name: Ritza

texts.es:
My name is Ritza and I have a business where I sell home appliances, clothes, shoes, and second hand furniture. I buy the products for a person that sells in bulk and then I sell it individually and I get more profit. I have three school-age children and with the income from my business I can help them with their studies. My husband helps with the family expenses. I am a dental surgeon by profession and I have my own clinic at home, this is why I also have time to take care of my businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva volunteer

Me llamo Ritza y tengo un negocio que vendo electrodomesticos, ropa, zapatos, muebles de segunda, le compro este producto a una persona que viaja y trae al por mayor, para luego venderlo por unidad y sacar ganacias de cada uno de ellos. Tengo tres niños en edad escolar y con los ingresos que mi negocio genera les puedo ayudar en sus estudios y a mi esposo en los gastos de la familia. Mi profesion es odontologia y tengo mi clinica en mi casa por lo que tengo la oportunidad de atender mis dos negocios.

loans.use: Compra de mercaderia de segunda, ropa y electrodomesticos.

loans.name: Temitope

texts.en: Temitope B. is 27 years old. A single lady, she lives in a rural area in Lagos State, Nigeria where she has a hairdressing store and also sells cosmetics to people in her environment. She is a dedicated client of LAPO.  She needs the  $400 loan to enable her to buy more cosmetics for sale.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics

loans.name: Lanza 6 Group

texts.es:
Romelia is 33, married with 2 children, and her husband works in the fields. For the past 8 years, she has run a small mill from her home where she grinds cooked corn to make dough for tortillas, which she then sells in her local community. The other members of the group have a variety of activities. Sabina has been selling chicken parts for the past 3 years. Margarita, on the other hand, sells artisan breads from her home. Both Irma and Francisca have put small grocery stores in their homes where they sell rice, sugar, milk and milk products, sweets and non-perishable goods to people who live nearby. The income from their businesses help all of them to put food on their tables.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

ROMELIA TIENE 33 AÑOS , CASADA , 2 HIJOS, SU ESPOSO SE DEDICA AL CAMPO .ELL. DESD. HACE 8 AÑOS TIENE EN SU CASA UN MOLINO DOND. REALIZA L. MOLIENDA D. MAIZ COCIDO Y L. MASA POSTERIORMENTE L. HACE TORTILL. L. QUE VEND. A LOS MIEMBROS D. SU COMUNIDAD LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO TIENEN DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES SABINA SE DEDICA A L. VENTA D. POLLO TROZADO DESD. HACE TRES AÑOS , EN CAMBIO MARGARITA TIENE EN SU CASA UNA PEQUEÑA AMASANDURIA DOND. VEND. PAN ARTESANAL , IRMA Y FRANCISCA POR SU PARTE TIENEN UNA TIENDA D. ABARROTES EN SUS DOMICILIOS DOND. VENDEN: ARROZ, AZUCAR , LECHE Y SUS DERIVADOS, DULCES, ALIMENTOS NO PERECIBLES A LAS PERSONAS QUE HABITAN CERCA D. SU CASA. CON LOS INGRESOS D. SUS NEGOCIOS TODAS ELLAS AYUDAN A LLEVAR EL ALIMENTO A SUS HOGARES.

loans.use: Supplies and products for their businesses.

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lê Thị Lơ, 38 years of age, joined the TYM Fund in 2003. She has 3 children, two of them are still in school. As most people in her village, beside farming, her main activity is weaving straw mattresses. She borrows money from the Fund to buy straw. Part of money from selling mattresses is for household expenses, the rest is for weekly loan repayments. After 5 years with the Fund and with her industrious nature, she has enough saving for a nice house for her family. Quality straw mattress starts quality raw material. Mrs. Lơ discusses with her husband about taking out a loan of 325USD to buy straw and fertilizer for her in house straw planting.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Lê Thị Lơ, 38 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình thương từ năm 2003. Chị có 3 con trong đó 2 cháu còn đang đi học. Như phần lớn người dân trong thôn, ngoài làm ruộng, công việc chủ yếu của chị Lơ là dệt chiếu. Để có nguyên liệu chị đã tham gia Quỹ Tình thương vay vốn về mua lác. Số tiền bán chiếu hàng tuần được để dành ra một phần chi tiêu cho gia đình, một phần dùng trả tiền tuần. Tính cần cù, chịu khó tích lũy giúp chị Lơ có được một ngôi nhà khang trang sau 5 năm tham gia Quỹ. Sau một thời gian dài làm chiếu chị Lơ nhận thấy để chiếu dệt có chất lượng phải có nguồn nguyên liệu tốt. Vậy nên chị bàn với chồng và xin vay 325USD để mua lác và phân bón để tự tạo lấy nguồn nguyên liệu sản xuất.

loans.use: Buy sedge and fertilizer

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en: Bernadette E., 48, lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria, and is married with 3 children.  She has been in the business of selling clothes since 1993.  . She needs the loan amount of $875 to buy more clothes, shoes and bags for sale

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Gulnar

texts.en: Gulnar is a widow with three children. She lives in the town of Khachmaz. She has one year of experience in this business. She was born in 1969. Now, she needs a loan of $725 to buy clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
From the time he was very young, Juan has worked to survive. Coming from a very poor family, he learned everything he could about sewing and tailoring. Many years of work have enabled him to save for his own sewing tools. His wife has also contributed to the business. They are very pleased that the school season is arriving because just like in previous years, there will be requests to make more clothing.

Juan desde que era muy joven ha trabajado para poder sobrevivir, ya que proviene de una familia de condición muy humilde y esto le ha servido mucho para aprender todo sobre la confección de prendas a nivel industrial, muchos años de trabajo le han servido para ahorrar y comprar sus propias herramientas de trabajo, su fiel esposa contribuye con su buen desempeño y están muy contentos con la llegad de la época escolar ya que albergarán como en años anteriores las solicitudes de los padres de familia para confeccionar buzos y camisetas deportivas.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE GREATER QUANTITIES OF SEWING SUPPLIES AND MATERIAL FOR HIS TAILORING BUSINESS.

loans.name: Rosa Yaquelin

texts.en:
R. Yaquelin sells shirts, pants, and undergarments in Monte Plata. This activity is the main source of income of the entrepreneur’s family. R. explains that she needs capital to invest in the business. She wants to buy a collection of fashionable goods, which are in high demand in her community.

The entrepreneur hopes that she’ll get this loan in a short time so that she can reach her goals and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To get a collection of clothes to add to her stock in order to increase her sales volume.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Mrs. Neang R. is a middleman who usually buys rice to keep in stock. Aside from this business activity, Mrs. Neang R. is a fish seller. She lives in Kan Yuon Village in Kampong Chhnang Province.  Mrs. Neang R. has six childR., three of whom are employed in a garment factory while one other is studying in a local school. The remaining two are staying at home because they are too young to work or attend school. Last year, Mrs. Neang R. obtained a loan from AMK to start her middleman business. Her business now is improved; Mrs. Neang R. now wants to buy more rice to resell for a reasonable price. Unfortunately, Mrs. Neang R. has insufficient money to purchase more rice. Thus, Mrs. Neang R. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Bil Er, is a fisherman. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more rice to resell for a reasonable price.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
C. Rashid is 30 years old, married, and has four children. He has been selling spare bicycle parts in the local market for the past 7 years. He began his business with a loan from IMON, and was gradually able to build up a permanent customer base and increase the variety of goods he sold. Since 2007, his profits have increased by three times, and he believes that the loans have had a significantly positive impact upon his business.

Rashid has used his earnings to improve his family’s living conditions, and is doing his best to meet all of his children’s needs. He would like to request a loan of $900 in order to purchase spare parts for bicycles and increase the range of his goods, and use the profits to continue to support and contribute to his family.

loans.use: Purchasing of the spare parts for bicycles in order to increase the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Time's Tusivunjane Moyo Group

texts.en:
Time is 28 years old and married with four children, ages 12, 10, 7, and 2 years old. She has been a firewood seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

In the past, Time took another successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes to buy more firewood for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Maua, Nasra, Asia, and Mwajine

loans.use: To buy more firewood to increase her inventory

loans.name: Luis Adrian

texts.es:
Luis Adrian inició el negocio porque se caso muy joven y no tenía un trabajo fijo, entonces llegó su primer hijo y había gastos de leche y de pañales aparte de las necesidades de su esposa y mías. Comenzó en marzo de 2006 por una amiga de su esposa que la convenció de que vendieran ropa usada en el mercado rodante de nuestra colonia. Posteriormente entro a trabajar como mesero en un restaurante, pero los fines de semana van a los mercados rodantes a vender, sobre todo en el más grande de la ciudad al que acude muchísima gente y les ha ido muy bien desde entonces.

El necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 4 meses para surtirse de ropa de temporada y tener una mejor variedad y mayor surtido que ofrecer a los compradores
texts.en:
Luis Adrian started his business because he married very young and didn't have a steady job. Then his first child arrived and there were expenses of milk and diapers along with his needs and those of his wife. He began in March 2006 when a friend of his wife convinced him to help her sell used clothing in the market near the neighborhood. Previously he had worked as a waiter in a restaurant, but went on weekends to the nearby markets to sell, mostly in the largest of the city which attracts many people and it has gone very well for them ever since.

He needs a loan of $300 US which will be repaid in four months in order to stock seasonal clothing and to increase variety and offer a better selection to the customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Abel

texts.en: Abel sells drinks in wholesale and retail to customers. He has been in this business since 1990. He is seeking a loan of 850 USD to buy more drinks to sell, which will help him retain his customers and draw new ones. Abel is 38 years old and married to Nkiru who sells foodstuffs in the local market; they have two children. He says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: Mwajuma's Group

texts.en:
Mwajuma Z. sells charcoal in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar. She works from 7:00am to 9:00pm every day and is able to earn a profit of approximately $40 each month. She has previously received one loan from BRAC Tanzania which she repaid successfully and on time. She is requesting her second loan so that she can buy more charcoal to sell for a profit.

Mwajuma is 26 years old, married, and has one 3-year-old child. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Sada, who sells clothing in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ynes

texts.es: Ynes tiene 27 años, es soltera y vive con su familia. Se dedica a la atención de su inmobiliaria, la cual ha sacado adelante tras mucho esfuerzo, ya que ha venido dedicándole 3 años de su vida, para que esta logre los resultados deseados. Le gusta su trabajo, ya que sabe que mediante él podrá progresar. A pesar de su juventud y poca experiencia Ynes es muy madura y administra muy bien su negocio. Lo más difícil es tener que dedicarle casi todo el día al trabajo, ya que no puede darse el lujo de descuidar su trabajo, pero ella sabe que esas son pequeñas cosas a comparación de todo lo que le brinda su trabajo. Ynes se encuentra en el primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado quiere implementar mejor su oficina, para brindarles una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ynes, 27, single and lives with her parents. She has a real estate business, which she started three years ago, and has grown with Ynes' hard work and dedication. Ynes likes her job; she knows it is a path to a better life. Despite her youth and little experience, Ynes is a very mature woman and manages her business very well. The only difficult aspect of her job is that she must spend most of the day at the office as she cannot afford the luxury of a short work day. But Ynes knows that these are small sacrifices when compared to all the god things that her job brings. This is Ynes' first loan with Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma. The loan will be used to refurbish her office to offer a better service to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve her office to provide a better service

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en:
O. Mavjuda is 35 years old. She is married and the mother of 3 children. Mavjuda's lack of a stable job and the slow productivity of her husband's business as an independent constructor didn't leave enough money to pay the expenses of the family. 

This was the reason that Mavjuda decided to start her own business 18 years ago. She sells the fabric used to make their national dresses. Little by little, she has made her business grow and, by allowing her clients to pay in installments, her orders are getting bigger. Now her business is running normally. However, she would like to continue improving herself (and her business) so her situation will be stable in the future. 

She is asking for a loan of 3800 Somoni ($1125 USD) that she will pay back in 9 months. With this money, Mavjuda will be able to buy seasonal fabrics for the national dresses. The power to help her business grow is in your hands. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seasonal fabrics

loans.name: Sandra Lorena

texts.es: Doña Sandra es una señora trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de joyas de oro y plata, comenzó a vender hace veintidós años lo cual inicio con dinero que su esposo le daba, procreo cuatro hijos tres están independientes y uno estudia la carrera de derecho, su esposo se desempeña como químico, estos préstamo que hace en afodenic han sido de gran beneficios ya que han aumentado su inventario de prendas y podido captar clientes con la variedad de sus productos nuevos, esta es su sexta solicitud y va invertir en infraestructura en la construcción de compra de materiales como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro , zinc, perlines y otros materiales para hacer un porche en su casa y estar mas cómoda con su familia, sus objetivos es aumentar su inventario en las ventas y apoyar a su hija en los estudios.
texts.en:
Sandra is a hardworking woman who dedicates herself to selling gold and silver jewellery. She started to sell twenty two years ago with some money that her husband gave her. She had four kids, three of them currently live independently of her and one is studying law at college; her husband is a chemist. The loans Afodenic have given her have been very beneficial as they have increased her range products and she has been able to win more clients due to her variety of new products. This is her sixth request and she will invest it in infrastructure in buying materials like stone, sand, cement, iron, zinc and other materials to build a porch for her house so her family will be more comfortable. Her objectives are to increase the inventory of her sales and to support her daughter in her studies.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a porch/Comprar materiales de construccion para hacer un porche

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 34 year old Mwajuma N. from Mbarali. She is married with 3 children, between the ages of 7 and 14. Mwajuma has been running a clothes and cosmetics business since 2005. 

She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Mwajuma currently earns about 180USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase more cosmetics in bulk. In the future, she plans to diversify by increasing the number and variety of items in her business. Mwajuma thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: Purchasing cosmetics in bulk

loans.name: Medelii A Group

texts.en:
Janeth C. has been a cement seller in the Ipagala neighborhood of Dodoma for one year. Janeth is married with five children, aged between 5 and 18. Janeth works eight hours every day at her business and earns an average monthly profit of $350 dollars.

Janeth is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more cement for her business. Janeth is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and improve her home. Janeth will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Jane and Sarah: each of whom has her own small business in Dodoma.

loans.use: To buy more cement to sell and expand her business.

loans.name: Jose Saul

texts.es:
El Sr. Jose M. tiene 53 años de edad, el vive en union libre con la Sra. Brenda Carolina con la cual han procread 3 hijos, dos de ellos estudian en el colegio de San Lorenzo.
don Saul se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de agua purificada en botellones, el tiene 6 años de dedicarse a este negocio, el se desplaza en su carro por los barrios y colonias de San Lorenzo y Nacaome, su compañera de trabajo tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion y con estos dos negocios ellos salen adelante con sus hijos y su hogar.
el necesita el prestamo para ampliar su negocio y desea comprar varia mercaderia al contado y no al credito,
su meta es cambiar su carro por uno mas grande y asi poder montarle mas producto y poder visitar mas lugares.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose Saul M. is 53 years old. He lives with his common-law wife and they have three children. Two of them are students at the San Lorenzo School.

Mr M. has had a business buying and selling bottled water for six years. He delivers the water through out the neighborhoods and surrounding areas of San Lorenzo and Nacaome. His wife has a grocery store at the house and these two businesses provide for the family.

Jose Saul needs the loan to enlarge his business and to be able to pay cash for the supplies instead of paying with credit.

His goal is to buy a larger vehicle to be able to carry more water bottles and to sell them throughout more areas.

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bottled water

loans.name: Juana María

texts.es:
La señora Juana María C. es madre soltera y tiene dos hijo bajo su responsabilidad uno de edad escolara y el mas pequeño de meses, desea lo mejor para sus hijos.
Tiene poco que le entregaron su casa por medio de un crédito gubernamental pero le esta haciendo faltas las protecciones en las puertas y ventanas para poder habitarla y así su hijos tendrán su patrimonio seguro.
texts.en:
Juana Maria C. is a single mother with two children under her responsibility, one of them is of school age and the youngest one only a few months old. She wishes the best for her children. It hasn’t been long since she got her house through a government loan. The house lacks of protection in doors and windows, these need to be fixed to make the house habitable and make sure that her children’s patrimony is protected.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Add protection to doors and windows of new house.

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr: Madame Maïmouna L. est une femme mariée enseignante à l’école Jules SAGNA 2000 et elle fait en même temps le commerce depuis 2004. Elle a démarré sur ses propres fonds  et est à son premier prêt pour renforcer son commerce. Bien expérimentée dans le commerce, elle gagne un bon bénéfice qui va l’aider à bien rembourser son crédit et augmenter ses revenus. Son activité consiste d'aller dans les pays limitrophes Gambie ou Mali) acheter les habits et venir les vendre au Sénégal.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maïmouna L. is married. She's a teacher at the Jules SAGNA 2000 school and, at the same time, she's been running a clothing business since 2004. She started on her own funds, and she's seeking her first loan to bolster her business. Well experienced, she turns a good profit, which will help her repay her loan and increase her income. Her business consists in traveling to neighboring countries, Gambia or Mali, to buy clothes and to resell them in Senegal.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell clothes, and to pay the customs duties

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 31 years old and resides with her family in Minallo, Naguillan, Isabela. She is married to Allan B., a carpenter, who is also 31 years old. They already have a child named Alain Bless, who is three years old.

Maribel is engaged in a livestock business to earn income for their daily needs since her husband has no permanent work as a carpenter. And to further earn income daily, Maribel also sometimes sells vegetables in their village since hog raising does not generate income daily. She even goes to the city market of Cauayan City just to buy vegetables at a cheaper price to retail in their villages.

She is hoping to obtain a loan of PHP 8,000 as additional working capital for both of her businesses. She hopes to save some of her extra income so she can pay for the future schooling of her child and future children. Furthermore, Maribel shared that she believes in the saying that states “time is gold”, which is similar to “time is of the essence”, thus giving the importance of what she can do now while she is still strong and able.

loans.use: To use as working capital

loans.name: Trần Thị

texts.en:
Trần Thị is a 48 year-old woman who lives in the town of Mê Linh. She is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Trần Thị raises livestock. Her main source of income is from raising cattle for sale. T. has been in this business for over six years and earns approximately 4000000 VND a month.

In 1996, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. T. is requesting a new loan of 20000000 VND to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be her 12th taken out from TYM Fund.

Trần Thị plans to use the additional revenue to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase breeding livestock.

loans.name: Gioconda

texts.es:
En la ciudad de León, la señora Gioconda M. se dedica a su actividad de servicio de salón de belleza el cual ha logrado levantar en su propia casa de habitación y a pesar que no presta cien por ciento con las condiciones para trabajar, ella ha logrado mejorar su condición de vida por medio del negocio.

Actualmente ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito y es por esta razón que espera muy confiadamente en que su crédito sea otorgado para proceder a la compra de los materiales de trabajo en el salón tales como peines, cremas, espejos, gelatina, entre otros, y de esta manera mejorar la condición del negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Giaconda M. lives in the city of Leon, where she has a beauty salon business at her house. Although she does not have 100% of what she needs in order to work, she has managed to improve her living conditions through the business. She is asking for a loan to Ceprodel, and is very confident that she will get it, so she can start to buy working materials for her beauty salon such us combs, creams, mirrors, gels, among others, to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia is 40 years old. She is a married woman with three children. Currently all of her children are in school. She lives with her family at Sefwi Wiawso, in the western region of Ghana. She has been a baker, using flour for her production, for ten years now.  In spite of the challenges she faces, she bakes bread, cake, meat pie, chips, etc. and retails them to her customers. She sells the products herself, in the market center, to her customers. Some customers also take bulk delivery bread from her. Her only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw ingredients, as prices are going up. She requests loan support so that she can remain in business. With the loan she believes she can provide for her family and, most especially, her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy baking ingredients like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood, etc.

loans.name: Yanaturo Alto (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Yanaturo Alto esta ubicado al oeste de la ciudad de Cuenca, aproximadamente 15 minutos fuera de la urbe, vía a Lazareto sector del Carmen, en este lugar sus habitantes se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, crianza de animales, existen fábricas de velas, sombreros y mecánicas industriales que brindan trabajo a personas que desean trabajar en el sector, por ser un sector elevado a comparación de la ciudad, el desnivel del terreno y por ser un sector semiurbano todo el día sopla un fuerte viento que es lo que hace que los niños permanezcan en su gran mayoría dentro de sus casas, este banco esta conformado por 12 mujeres trabajadoras, organizadas y bien llevadas, se dedican a diferentes labores sean en la casa o fuera de ellas, es así por ejemplo citamos unas de ellas:
Sra. C. I. Blanca Celestina
Blanca tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos de 9,7 y 1 año, los dos primeros estudian en la escuela del sector que lleva el nombre de Yanaturo, el esposo se dedica al arte de la joyería en la ciudad, la casa donde vive y realiza las reuniones cada 15 días ya que ellas es presidenta del Banquito Comunal es arrendada, cuenta que tiene casa propia por el sector pero aún no termina, posiblemente a unos dos meses se pasa a su propia casa, Blanca se dedica exclusivamente a quehaceres domésticos, los fines de semana y cuando la soliciten realiza comidas a domicilio o en su propia casa, le gusta cocinar hace mucho tiempo, aprendió más o menos hace unos 10 años cuando trabajaba en el restaurant Balcón Cuencano, todo lo que le piden ellas los realiza y cuenta que tiene mucha acogida ya que su comida es muy sabrosa.
El crédito que Blanca solicitó a la Fundación ESPOIR fue de 440 dólares, los cuales  invirtió adquiriendo una cocina industrial, ollas, trastos y otros materiales que se necesitan para sus labores, su meta en el futuro es poder terminar su casa y en la misma ponerse un local de comidas (restaurant).
Sra. C. Guamán Cecilia Del Rocío
Cecilia es oriunda del Puyo al Oriente del Ecuador, vive en Cuenca 23 años, su esposo es también del Puyo, es de 33 años de edad, casada y tiene cuatro hijos de 15,10,8 y 3 años, los tres primeros estudian el uno en colegio y los otros dos en la escuela, Cecilia se dedica a la costura, no es todavía profesional esta aprendiendo todavía, ya lleva esta trabajo más o meno unos 4 meses, trabaja con la señora Pilar S. que es también socia del banquito, ella la invitó a que se integre al banco, es su primer crédito y cuenta que es muy beneficioso ya que con lo que ha pedido el crédito de 330 dólares ha podido comprarse una máquina de coser y telas con las cuales trabaja. Como todavía no sabe bien trabaja con una socia  doña Pilar ella la enseña, realiza pantalones, blusas, vestidos, y en especial ropa deportiva por lo que necesita comprar telas licra circuito que esta a 5.80 dólares la yarda, su horario de trabajo es de 8 a 12 y de 2 a 5 de la tarde y cuando tienen obras se quedan también los fines de semana hasta la madrugada, aprovecha los fines de semana para adelantar más el trabajo ya que su esposo como es chofer de una compañía descansa los fines de semana y le ayuda en casa con las ocupaciones. Su meta es poder aprender bien la profesión y ponerse un taller independiente en su propia casa.
Sra. I. Zumba María Ángeles
