María tiene 55 años de edad, es casada y tiene 12 hijos, entre 30 y 10 años, ya ni se acuerda cuantos años tienen cada uno de ellos, los cuatro hijos están en el colegio, tres en la escuela, y los mayores trabajan y son casados, vive en una casa arrendando porque la suya no pudo terminar solo esta comenzada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y cuando no tiene trabajo la ayuda en casa, María se dedica a la casa, crianza de animales, a lavar ropa ajena y también a la agricultura, los fines de semana a partir del día jueves sale a lavar ropa de las vecinas que le pagan 1 dólar por cada docena de prendas que lava, cada cobija cobra 0,50 centavos de dólar y 0,25 centavos las casacas. Es oriunda de Santa Ana una parroquia de Cuenca, vive en Yanaturo ya unos 18 años, pidió 330 dólares de préstamo para comprar ganado (yunta) debido a que se van acercando las siembras utilizan la yunta para arar, su meta es seguir luchando en la vida y poder terminar su casita para poder descansar en paz sin tener que estar pensando cada mes en el arriendo.
texts.en:
The Yanaturo Alto Communal Bank is located west of the city of Cuenca, about 15 minutes away, and lies in the area of Lazareto del Carmen. The residents of the area are engaged primarily in agriculture and animal husbandry. There are factories that produce candles, hats and industrial machinery, and provide work to anyone who wants a manufacturing job similar to those found in larger cities. Children spend most of their time inside because of the unevenness of the land and the strong winds that blow all day long. This group consists of 12 women, all of whom are organized and well-mannered. They are devoted to different business activities, carried out both within and outside of the home. Here are some examples:

Sra. C. I. Blanca Celestina: Blanca is 27 years old, married, and has three children (ages 9, 7, and 1). The two oldest children attend school in the Yanaturo area. Her husband works in the city as a jeweler. The communal bank gathers at her house every 15 days for their meetings because she is the group president. She currently leases her home, but will own it outright in about two months when she completes the payments. During the week, Blanca spends most of her time on household chores. On the weekends or whenever people ask her, she prepares food at her customer’s house or in her own home. She learned to cook about 10 years ago when she worked at a restaurant called Balcón Cuencano. Everything she makes is well received because the food is quite tasty.

Blanca is requesting a loan of $440 USD from Fundación ESPOIR to buy pots, industrial kitchenware, and other materials needed for her work. Her future goal is to finish her house payments and, at the same time, open a restaurant.

Sra. C. Guamán Cecilia Del Rocío: Cecilia is a native of East Puyo, Ecuador and has lived in Cuenca 23 years. Her husband is 33 years old and also from Puyo. They have four children (ages 15, 10, 8 and 3). The first three children are students, one in high school and the other two in elementary school. Cecilia spends her time sewing, which she has been doing for about 4 months. She is not a professional yet, but is still learning. Sra. Cecilia works with Sra. Pilar S., who is also a communal bank member, and asked to be part of the group. Her first loan was very beneficial because she used her $330 to buy a sewing machine and fabric. Although not yet known for her work, she is learning from Doña Pilar how to make trousers, blouses, dresses, and sportswear. She needs to purchase lycra fabric, which costs $5.80 per yard. Her work schedule runs between 8am-12pm and 2pm-5pm. She also works on the weekends during the morning. She is able to get much accomplished on the weekends because her husband helps with the household chores. He works as a company driver and is off on the weekends. Cecilia’s goal is to continue learning her craft and open a workshop in her home.

Sra. I. Zumba María Ángeles: María is 55 years old, married and has 12 children between the ages of 10 and 20. She doesn’t remember the exact ages of each of them. Four of them are in high school, three are in elementary school, and the older ones are working and married. She lives in a rented house because her family cannot complete the construction on their own. Her husband is a farmer, and when he is not working, he helps around the house. She spends her time performing household chores (including washing clothes), raising animals, and cultivating crops. Starting on Thursdays and through the weekend, she washes clothes for neighbors. She charges $1 per dozen garments, $0.50 for blankets, and $0.25 for jackets. María is a native of Santa Ana, which is a parish in Cuenca. She has lived in Yanaturo for 18 years. She will use her loan of $330 to buy livestock that she will yoke together to plow her fields. She plans to fight through life’s struggles and hopes to own a house so that she can rest peacefully and not have to worry about the rent each month.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock and other materials

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort A. is single and has received an education level up to primary school. Comfort sells cloth and materials in Abura, which she has done since 2006. Comfort uses her income to pay for housekeeping expenses. Comfort will use the requested loan to purchase additional cloth for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to reinvest these funds in her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional cloth for resale

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia is 48 years old she is widowed and mother with six children. All her children are in school. She operates a drinking spots where she sells all kinds of drinks such as soft drinks, canned malts, canned and bottle drinks etc. She is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to provide for her business and the children with quality education. But she claim without adequate fund it can’t be possible to realize that dream. She is been running the drinking spots for ten years now. And she needs the loan to buy assorted drinks like Coke, Pepsi and canned drinks to upgrade her inventory.

loans.use: To buy assorted drinks like Coke, Pepsi and canned drinks to upgrade her inventory.

loans.name: Edgar David

texts.es: El Joven David es originario de la comunidad de Juchanep a ocho kilometros de la ciudad procer de Totonicapn, el hace cuatro años inicio su propio negocio en la confeccion de playeras, gorras y sus principales  puntos de ventas son ciudad de Guatemala y San Francisco el Alto el cuenta con su propio taller con tres operarios hoy necesita de un credito para la compra de telas, conos, pinturas, para surtir su mercaderia para aprovechar la epoca de fin de año.
texts.en:
David is a young man who lives in the town of Juchanep, located eight kilometers (about five miles) from the city of Totonicapn. Four years ago he started his own business making hats and t-shirts, which he primarily sells in Guatemala City and San Francisco el Alto. He has three employees who work in his shop. He needs a loan to buy fabrics, cones and paints in order to add variety to his products and take advantage of the yearend holiday season.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Supplies

loans.name: Rum

texts.en:
Mr. Rum N. is 32 years old and he lives in Mean Neak village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns 4-hectare (10-acre) field of land he uses to cultivate rice. In this plantation, he needs some money to buy rice seed and to hire an electric cow (a machine that pulls a plough and runs on fuel) to plow the field.

Mr. Rum N. is a father of two children, one of whom is attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. His wife, Mrs. Khan Sophea, who is presented on the left in the photo, is a duck breeder who sells duck eggs.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and to hire an electric cow to plow his field

loans.name: Douglas Shilechilli

texts.en:
Douglas is married and blessed with two children. His business is located at the roadblock in Soy. He was introduced to KADET, a Kiva partner, by a group member. 

Douglas is taking a loan from KADET so that he can buy spare parts for his motorcycle, which is a taxi. His plan is to grow the business and to be able to educate his children.

About KADET: 

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn A. is from the village of Calabayan, Ozamiz City. She is 45 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Evelyn owns and operates a business planting and harvesting "saging" (bananas) for sale. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Evelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and to use for daily needs. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Ganzaya

texts.en:
Ganzaya is 33 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in the Khovd province of western Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, and Ganzaya operates a taxi service in his town. He began his business in 2003 and has supported his family since then with his income. He would also like to open a meat trading business in the future so that he can improve his family’s quality of life, but for now he is focused on making his taxi service more profitable and efficient. Ganzaya is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug (~2100 USD) loan in order to purchase repair parts and spare parts for his taxi.

About XacBank:
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.  To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his taxi.

loans.name: Penh

texts.en:
Mrs. Penh S. is 37 years old and her husband, Mr. Vanna Hul, is 39 years old. They live along National Road Number One about thirty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh. The couple were married in 1989 and have five children: two sons and three daughters, all of them in school.

Penh has been growing rice for twenty years, while her husband has been a security guard for one year. Penh doesn’t have enough capital to use for farming so she is requesting her first loan of $300 to purchase fertilizer, fuel oil and pesticides to use on her rice farm.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, oil and pesticides for her farm

loans.name: Sary

texts.en: Mrs. Sary M. lives in Speu village in Takeo province. She is a fish seller. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more fishes to resell to earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Khoem Horn, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Sary M. is 51 years old and the mother of seven children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: By purchasing more fishes to resell to earn more income.

loans.name: Marco Danilo

texts.es:
Marcos O. de 32 años, vive en una casa de caña con luz como servicio básico no tiene agua ni alcantarillado su vivienda esta ubicada en Fortín de Guayaquil, su esposa le ayuda comprando los productos de su tienda tiene 3 hijos de 12 años, 7 años, 1 año dos estudian en una escuela particular.

Marcos comenzó hace ya 5 años atrás atendiendo la tienda del papa una vez que pudo reunir dinero le pudo comprar la tienda. Ahora el trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 21h00 todos los días vendiendo arroz, aceites, pollos etc. Una de las mayores complicaciones es el polvo de su sector por lo que no esta pavimentada la calle.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, aceites, dejas para ampliar un poco más el negocio. En el futuro quiere  agrandar la tienda  y poder hacer su casa de cemento.
texts.en:
Marcos O., 32, lives in a house made from sugar cane stalks. As far as basic services go, he has electricity, but he does not have water or a sewer system. His house is located in Fortín in Guayaquil. His wife helps him buy purchasing the products for their store. He has three children; 12, 7, and 1. Two of the children go to private school. Five years ago Marco started taking care of his father’s store. Once he was able to get together the money, he was able to buy the store. He now works from 7:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. everyday. He sells rice, oil, and chicken, etc. One of the biggest problems is the dust in his area because the street is not paved. He will use the loan to buy rice, oil, and other things to increase the business a little. In the future he wants to expand the store and be able to make his house from cement.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, oil, and chicken

loans.name: Tagoykul

texts.ru: Маматалиев Тагойкул проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 46 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Маматалиев Тагойкул имеет собственный земельный участок. Растениеводством занимается более 20 лет. Целью кредита является посев овощей.
texts.en:
Tagoykul M. lives close to Yavan, Tajikistan. He is forty-six and married with five children. Tagoykul M. has a piece of land. He has been growing plants for over twenty years. He is asking for loan to grow vegetables.

Translated from Russian by Susan Savkov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow Vegetables

loans.name: Edita Eliza

texts.es:
La señora EDITA ELIZA G. R., tiene 36 años, vive en el distrito de LA ESPERANZA, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal JESÚS EN TI CONFIO. La socia  presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria, tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar quienes depende de ella. EDITA  se dedica a la venta ambulatoria de zapatos especialmente de zapatos escolares para niñas y niños. También fabrica zapatos para escolares y empresas en sociedad con su padre y su hermano. Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró materiales para la fabricación del calzado como: cuero, hebillas, pegamentos, suelas, hilos, etc. 

Con este crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles comprará 6 docenas de zapatos escolares para abastecerse en esta campaña escolar.
Ella  sueña con aumentar la fabricación y venta de zapatos, así empezar a vender en otras ciudades cercanas como: Chimbote, Chiclayo, Piura, etc. Para así poder obtener más ingresos para la crianza y educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
EDITA ELIZA G. R., 36, lives in the LA ESPERANZA district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She is a member of the JESÚS EN TI CONFIO communal bank. She finished 11th grade and has two, school-age children, who are dependent on her. EDITA is a shoe peddler, especially school shoes for children. She also manufactures school and business shoes in partnership with her father and brother. Her first, 300 new sol, loan was used to buy shoemaking supplies like: leather, buckles, adhesives, soles, thread, etc. She will use this new, 300 new sol, loan to buy 6 dozen school shoes to stock up for the new school year. She hopes to increase her shoe manufacturing and sales; to begin selling in other nearby cities like: Chimbote, Chiclayo, Piura, etc. in order to obtrain higher income for the raising and education of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school shoes for children.

loans.name: Nicole

texts.fr: K. Nicole est née le 4 décembre 1965 à Tori-Bossito, mais vit depuis cinq ans au quartier Kpondéhou à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.   Mariée à TOGONOU Nourou, un fonctionnaire, Nicole est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés.  Nicole vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Nicole a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au cours secondaire.  Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Nicole vend des tissus et des sous-vêtements par le système de distribution.  Nicole vend de façon secondaire, des bijoux. Nicole exerce cette activité depuis 12 ans et s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin.  Nicole a déjà obtenu deux crédits à ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés.  Nicole sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé pour renforcer ses activités et mieux satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en:
Nicole K. was born on 4th December 1965 in Tori-Bossito, but has lived for the past five years in the Kpondéhou district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Married to Nourou TOGONOU, a civil servant, Nicole has two children who are both at school. She lives with her husband and children. The couple cover the household expenses between them. Nicole went to school up until secondary level. In order to provide for her needs, she sells fabric and underwear through the distribution system. She also has a secondary activity selling jewelry. Nicole has been exercising this activity for twelve years and gets her supplies in Dantokpa, Bénin's international market. She has already had two loans from ALIDé which she has paid without any problem. She is applying for a third loan from ALIDé in order to strengthen her business and satisfy client demand more readily.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric and underwear

loans.name: Janett Del Socorro

texts.es: Janett del Socorro tiene la edad de 44 años, este no es el primer financiamiento de ella pues siempre está necesitando ese apoyo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general. Ella inicia este negocio por cuenta propia pues siempre le ha gustado trabajar y ganarse el pan de cada día de la manera más humilde. Siempre está luchando con todos sus clientes para que le paguen, a pesar de los problemas que enfrenta como es los problemas de salud pero siempre sacrificándose para mejorar. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que será utilizado para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en:
Janett del Socorro is 44 years old and this is not the first loan she has received. She has come to rely on this help. The economic activity to which she is dedicated is selling general merchandise. She began her business on her own account. She has always liked working and earning her daily bread in the most humble manner. Janett always has to struggle with each of her customers to get them to pay, despite the problems she confronts, including her health. But she always makes sacrifices in order to improve. The loan is to increase her working capital by buying basic goods.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING BASIC GOODS FOR HER GENERAL STORE

loans.name: Lilia's Group

texts.en:
Lilia M. is from the village of Maluno Norte. She is 48 years old. Lilia is the leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Lilia is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Lilia owns & operates a business that prepares and sells snacks such as soup, noodles and native cakes. Lilia has been in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Lilia joined ASKI to access financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell.  This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lilia from ASKI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 
-----------------------------------
About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell.

loans.name: Magali Francisca

texts.es: La señora M. S., tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación, la cual atiende personalmente con la ayuda de su hijo mayor,  con los prestamos que se le han atendido ha venido ampliando su negocio y mejorando su vivienda con las ganancia que le genera la pulpería, con el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja como mecánico, mantienen los gastos de la casa y la educación de sus hijos. Ahora necesita de este nuevo financiamiento para mejorar el inventario de la mercadería de y dar mayor atención a sus clientes para obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs. M. S. has a grocery store in her home which she tends to herself with help from her oldest son. The loans she has had have made it possible for her to expand her business and profits from the store have made home improvements possible. With her husband’s help, who works as a mechanic, they are able to support their household and provide education for their children. She needs new funding to buy stock items for her store so that she can provide better customer service and thus earn higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store like: sugar, rice, beans, cooking oil, corn, coffee,soap, paper, clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Reeta

texts.en:
Reeta is a 44-year-old woman living with her husband, three kids, and Reeta's mother in the town of Hikkaduwa. She has two sons and one daughter in her family. She is a hardworking woman and wants to be financially independent. Reeta sews dresses, continuing a business that she started six years ago. Her husband and children help her with the business. She is asking for a 30,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC to buy cloth to sew. 

Reeta hopes to provide a more nutritious diet for her family through developing her business. Also she wants to renovate the house and to pay the children's tuition fees. She is appreciative of BRAC for providing her a loan to help her expand her business. This is Reeta's third loan; she successfully repaid her first and second loans. 

Thank you for considering supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy cloth

loans.name: Milagrosa

texts.en:
From the town of Sto. Niño, 41-year-old Milagrosa E., a married mother of three school-aged children, earns her living by raising pigs for fattening and sale. She also owns a hectare of land upon which she cultivates rice. Milagrosa has been engaged in her business for over 20 years now.

In 2008, Milagrosa joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan from CEVI, she is now requesting a new loan, her sixth, of 15000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizers. Milagrosa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: Mrs. Sokha T. is married to Mr. Samorn Srey. This couple has four children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the others are attending a local public school. This family lives in Srae Ampil village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sokha T. and her husband are farmers who own one-hectare of land to grow crops to sell to support their family. Their problem is that their field has infertile soil and there are a lot of insects. So to improve production, Mrs. Sokha T. is seeking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides. Her husband is shown in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Aïssa Mbodj

texts.fr: Madame Aïssa Mbodj B.,âgée de 40 ans, s'active dans le commerce de tissus et portables depuis 18 ans.  C'était losqu'elle s'est mariée et elle a senti le besoin d'aider son mari qu'elle a entrepris le business. Elle compte des clients et clientes très fidéles qui viennet chercher chez ellez les marchandises. Cependant, elle sollicicte pour la première auprès de U-IMCEC un prêt de 150 000 FCFA pour s'approvisionner.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aïssa Mbodj B., 40 years of age, has been in the business of selling woven fabric and supplies for 18 years. She started in this business when she got married and felt there was a need to assist her husband. Aïssa has faithful clients who come to her for their purchases. She is therefore requesting this first loan from U-IMEC for 150 000 Francs CFA to buy supplies.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies of cloth and fabric

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma M. is from the village of Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 35 years old and is single. She owns & operates a motorela, or habal-habal, transportation business. A habal-habal is a motorcycle with an extended seat that can carry several passengers. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Gemma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to maintain service. This will be the first loan taken out by Gemma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to maintain her transport service

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es: La Señora Jovita vive  en alquiler con sus seis hijitos que se encuentran en edad escolar y su esposo ella se dedica a la repostería ya bastantes años. Ella comenzó desde que era pequeña su mama le enseño a hacer pan de arroz y otros es así como la señora mantiene a su familia, ahora ya tiene clientes y pedidos es por eso que saco el crédito y es el primer crédito que ella saca por eso le dimos con crédito  kiva ahora puede comprar sus insumos como harina, levadura, azúcar y otras cositas que necesita para la elaboración de sus productos, esta agradecida  a la institución por la oportunidad que se le brindo.
texts.en:
Ms. Jovita lives in a rented home with her six school-aged children and her husband. She has worked for quite a few years making pastries. She started when she was small and her mother taught her how to make rice bread and other foods. This is how she provides for her family. Now she has customers and orders, and that is why she is taking out this loan, which is her first. Emprender told her that with a loan through Kiva, she will be able to buy her ingredients like flour, yeast, sugar, and other things that she needs to make her products. She is grateful to the organization for the opportunity offered to her.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, and other ingredients

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy, tiene 31 años, es una mujer luchadora y con muchos sueños por cumplir, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Teofilo de 34 años y sus 3 hijos, que son la razón de su vida. Junto a su esposo, lleva 14 años sembrando papa, flor de gladiolo, arveja y maíz, en sus terrenos propios y arrendados. En épocas de cosecha contrata operarios para agilizar sus labores, pero siempre está pendiente del buen cuidado de sus tierras, ya que le gusta sembrar arveja y flor de gladiolo, productos de mayor demanda en los mercados de su ciudad. Por otro lado le incomoda retirar la mala hierba que invade sus chacras, pero como es necesario que sus terrenos estén limpios emplea un poco más de tiempo. Estos últimos meses su esposo ha aprendido a fabricar puertas ventanas y demás muebles de metal, pues es muy rentable este negocio. Por eso ambos desean instalar un taller de metalurgia en un espacio de su casa, también quiere abrir un negocio de venta de comestibles, pero sin dejar de lado la agricultura. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y le confiesa que le gusta mucho trabajar en su grupo comunal, porque labora con personas responsables, honestas y trabajadoras como ella. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico, que utilizará para esparcirlo en sus sembríos de arveja y papa.
texts.en:
Nancy is 31 years old. She is a fighter with a lot of dreams. She lives in her own house together with her 34-year-old husband, Teofilo, and their three children, who are her reason for living. Together with her husband, she has spent the last 14 years growing potatoes, gladiolas, peas, and corn on their own property as well as rented land. During harvest time, the couple contracts operators to speed up the work, but Nancy is always responsible for taking care of the land since she likes to plant peas and gladiolas, two products in high demand at her local markets. It inconveniences her to pull out the bad grass that invades her farm land but she takes the extra time to do so since it is necessary to keep the land clean. These past few months, Nancy's husband has learned to make doors, windows, and metal furniture, which is a very profitable business. For this reason, the couple wants to install a metallurgy shop in their home. Nancy also wants to open a business selling non-perishable foods while still tending to her agricultural projects. This is Nancy's fourth loan with MFP. She says she enjoys working with a community brink because she works with responsible, honest, hard-working people like herself. With this loan, she will invest in the purchase of various sacks of organic fertilizer to spread amongst her pea and potato plantings.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Sam-Ang

texts.en:
Mr. Sam-ang K., 28, (pictured with his wife) and his wife, Mrs. Channy Em, 32, live in a village along National Road Number Two about 12 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2000 and have two sons. One of them attends school and other one is still  too young.  

Sam-ang is a driver. His wife is a garment factory worker. Besides driving, he also operates a business producing pots and vases for sale. He is requesting his first loan of US$ 1,000 to expand his business. He will use a part of the loan to repair his kitchen.

loans.use: To repair kitchen and expand his business

loans.name: Nery

texts.es: Nery, de 38 años de edad, convive con su pareja y tiene dos hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en la localidad de Santa Rosa, ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, donde tiene su propia casa. Nery, recalca que la venta de cacao es bastante rentable, por ello trata de darle el mejor cuidado respectivo a sus plantaciones de cacao, y bajo esa premisa es que muchos de sus compradores se han  sentido satisfechos  por la calidad de su producto agrícola, sin embargo ella trata de esmerarse lo mas posible que pueda. Es por ello que le dedica mucho tiempo a su producto de cacao, conjuntamente con la ayuda de su pareja, sin embargo en tiempo de cosecha necesita de sus peones, para que de esa manera lo puedan facilitar en la extracción de su producto final y fruto del esfuerzo está obteniendo buenos ganancias económicas. Normalmente su producto de cacao los vende en los centros de acopio de su misma localidad y a un precio razonable; su rutina laboral lo realiza de lunes a sábado, a partir de las 6:00 de la mañana hasta las 6.00 de la tarde. Ella anhela en un futuro próximo, tener su propio grifo con la necesidad de diferenciarse ante sus demás competencias, a la vez obtener nuevos ingresos. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, por el cual asegura cumplir fielmente con sus respectivos pagos, además augura en que tendrá mucho éxito en su banco comunal, ya que existe armonía en cada unos de los socios. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de insumos y abono para que lo dé un mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de cacao, por ende mejorar en la calidad y cantidad de su producción agrícola.
texts.en:
Nery is 38 years old and lives with her husband and two school age children. They reside in their own home in the town of Santa Rosa, which is located in the beautiful Ayacucho jungle. Nery says she sells cacao because it is quite profitable, so she tries to provide her crops the best care. She has many buyers who are satisfied with the quality of her product, so she strives to achieve this result as often as possible. Nery devotes much of her time to growing cacao and has the help of her husband. During the harvest season, she needs to hire laborers to facilitate the extraction of the cacao beans from the pods so that she can sell the final product. Her efforts result in a good financial income. Normally her products are sold at the local collection centers for a reasonable price. Her work routine is from Monday to Saturday, beginning at 6am and lasting until 6pm. Nery’s wish for the near future is to have her own source of water in order to differentiate herself from the competition and create a new source of income.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. Nery plans to complete her payments faithfully. She predicts that she will have much success with her Communal Bank since the members get along with one another. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy supplies and compost in order to provide adequate maintenance for her cacao crops. This will improve the quality and quantity of her production.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & supplies for her cacao crop

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es soltera, tiene 51 años y 4 hijos de los cuales solo una vive con ella y estudia en el colegio, Isabel vende agregados en un local alquilado, vende productos como arena, ladrillos, productos que trae del río con un carro alquilado, sus ventas son al por mayor y menos cuenta con un carro pequeño para el reparto. Además Isabel hace ladrillos artesanalmente en la comunidad de Compañía también compra de productores para comercializarlos en Ayacucho.
Isabel es socia del Banco Comunal Proyección y  solicita un préstamo de 3000 soles para la compra de arena fina y ladrillos.
Isabel sueña con comprar un volquete, tener una ferretería y que su hija sea profesional.
texts.en:
Isabel is single. She is 51 and has 4 children. Now only one, who is in school, lives with her. Isabel sells building materials in a rented location. She sells products such as sand, bricks, and construction products which she brings from the river in a rented car. She makes wholesale sales and has a small car for the deliveries. In addition, Isabel makes traditional brick in the town of Compañía. She also buys products to sell in Ayacucho. Isabel is a member of the community bank Proyección (Projection) and is applying for a loan of 3000 PEN for the purchase of fine sand and bricks. Isabel dreams of buying a dump truck, having a hardware store, and for her daughter to have a career.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fine sand and bricks.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is not yet in school. For three years, Fatima has run a business selling food and vegetables.         

To help expand her business, Fatima has requested a loan of 200000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food and vegetables to sell. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Fatima hopes to generate greater profits. In the future, Fatima hopes to own another business. 

Fatima is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has improved her prospects for the future by teaching her how to handle a business.

loans.use: To buy more food and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es: Sandra Patricia tiene 39 años. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la una pulpería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad económica, lo más difícil para ella es la competencia, por lo que siempre brinda buen servicio y fue con el tiempo obteniendo clientes. Sandra tiene mucho carisma y eso es lo que más les gusta a sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, jugos, detergentes y granos básicos. El deseo de Sandra es aumentar sus ingresos del negocio y mejorar las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en: Sandra Patricia is 39 and has two children. She makes a living with a small general store. She has been doing this for the past 5 years and the toughest part in the competition. That is why she provides excellent service and little by little has gained customers. Sandra is very charismatic and is what her customers like about her. The loan she is requesting is working capital to buy candy, soft drinks, juices, detergents and basic grains. Sandra's wish is to increase sales and improve her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bubaare Bakyara Tukwatanise Group-Ibanda

texts.en: 60-year-old N. Kiviri belongs to Bubaare Bakyara Tukwatanise group-Ibanda. She is married with five kids. She has been running her  lucrative goat sales business for 15 years in Jubilee-Ibanda. With earnings from this business, she has in many respects sustained her family over the years as regards improved welfare. 150,000 shillings is what her business generates weekly. With this loan she says she is going to purchase more goats to fatten for resale.

loans.use: The purchase of more goats to fatten for resale

loans.name: Valya

texts.en: Valya O. lives with her 2 daugheters, one of whom is a student and the other one helps her mother run the clothing business. Valya has been trading clothes and coats since 1995.  She is a successful businesswoman, always meeting her clients’ demands and maintaining very good relationships with them. Valya needs to acquire winter coats for the coming season. With a good credit history behind her, Valya has applied for the loan to cover the purchasing expenses.

loans.use: To purchase coats for resale

loans.name: Milton

texts.en: R. Milton is 30 years old and married with three children. He has a retail shop in Mubiiwa trading centre where he sells salt, soap, sugar, sodas, biscuits, and mineral water. Most of Milton’s customers shop daily and he is able to make 30,000/=  a profit weekly. Milton also owns a boda boda that he sometimes hires out if he is busy with the shop. He needs a loan to be able to stock the retail shop with more goods. Milton says that his business is the result of his own initiative and he is determined to work very hard and transform it into a wholesale business. His dream is to have a stable business and family.

loans.use: Restocking the shop with food supplies

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine P. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 38 years old, married, and has 2 children. To make a living, Geraldine owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Geraldine has been engaged in farming for over 15 years already.

Geraldine joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Geraldine has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Geraldine is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
Cesar Augusto tiene 29 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a casi dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la elaboración y venta de bebidas y refrescos en un puesto ambulante situado en una de las calles céntricas de su distrito. El prepara sus bebidas en su domicilio y las vende a diario entre los transeúntes de la zona. La zona es de clima semitropical, por lo que existe calor durante la mayor parte del año, siendo los meses de mayor calor los correspondientes al verano (tres a cuatro primeros meses de cada año), debido a este factor climático su negocio siempre cuenta con clientela estable.

Los ingresos que el percibe de estas actividades los utiliza para ayudar a su familia con el sostenimiento de su economía diaria. Cesar desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de fruta fresca y materiales, de modo que pueda aumentar su producción y ventas, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1800 nuevos soles con los cuales planea lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Cesar Augusto is 29 years old, single, and lives with his family in the Olmos district, an agricultural zone with steady commercial activity. It is located in the province of Lambayeque, almost two hours from the city of Chiclayo.

He works making and selling refreshments and soft drinks at a stand located on one of the central streets of his district. He prepares his refreshments at home and sells them daily to the people passing by the area. The area climate is semi-tropical so it is hot for the majority of the year, the hottest months being during the summer (the first three or four months of each year). Due to this climate, his business always has a stable clientele.

He uses the income he earns from this business to help his family with their daily needs. Cesar wants to expand his business with the purchase of fresh fruit and materials so that he can increase his production and sales. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 1,800 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) from Edpyme Alternativa with which he plans to achieve his goal.

loans.use: To expand his business with the purchase of fresh fruit and materials.

loans.name: Tabitha Wamaitha

texts.en:
Tabitha Wamaitha N. is a woman of twenty seven years.  She is married to Charles Njuguna, who runs taxi business in Lodwar Town.  They are blessed with two beautiful children.  They currently reside in Lodwar. 

Tabitha has a mali kwa mali (exchange of goods for goods) retail business.  She has been in this business for four years now.

This will be Tabitha's first loan from  KADET LTD.   She plans to use the loan to buy more stock for her business.  With the income generated, she wants to support her husband in buying another car for his taxi business.  

In the future, she wants to be financially stable and be able to provide for every basic need for her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock for trading business (e.g basins, plastic buckets, jugs, etc.)

loans.name: Elio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “EL MOLINITO II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Elio; el tiene 33 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, el socio tiene un carro que hace servicio de taxi desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m en las diferentes calles de la ciudad del cusco, el socio quiere mejorar el servicio de taxi. El  socio solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank El Molinito II.The bank is located in the Cusco district, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is named Sr. Elio; he is 33 years old and single; he alternates his daily activities with the transportation business. He uses his car for a taxi service from 7:00 am until 10:00 pm in the different streets of the city of Cusco. The member wants to improve his taxi services. He is asking for this loan so that he can maintain his car. 

He is excited about this loan and promises to follow through with the loan payments.

loans.use: The member is asking for a loan for the maintenance of his car.

loans.name: Keki Group

texts.en:
Zainabu C., who is in her mid-thirties, is married with four children.  She has had a charcoal business for two years now. She works from 7:00am to 6:00pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Zainabu's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her stock of charcoal and started selling charcoal at wholesale price.  She has paid back the priovious loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to pay school fees. Her dream is to take her children to higher education.

Zainabu will share this loan with her loan group Keki, which has a total of 17 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Zainabu is in the back row with a head scarf.

loans.use: To pay for school fees.

loans.name: Ludivia Amparo

texts.es: Ludivia se desempeñaba como empleada y después de varios años su jefe le presta un dinero para que ella inicie su propio negocio. Desde hace un año la tienda donde trabaja diariamente es suya, sin embargo su sueño es que la tienda pueda tener gran variedad de productos y así poder satisfacer a sus clientes.
texts.en: Ludivia was once employed and after many years her boss loaned her some money to start her own business. Last year she set up her store where she works daily.  Her dream is to introduce a wide variety of products to her store in order to satisfy her clients.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Salis Candelaria

texts.es: Salís C. M. es una mujer casada que tiene dos hijos en las edades de 15 y 17 años, ella es la propietaria de una sala de belleza donde realiza corte de cabellos, desrizados, manicure pedicure y vende también productos de belleza  especialmente de limpieza facial. Salis  inició este negocio hace 12 años, durante los cuales ha ido capacitándose para lograr cambios significativos en la imagen y belleza de sus clientes.  Ella inició y aun  estaba estudiando licenciatura en sociales y económicas en la Universidad, pero  se le dio por estudiar peluquería por dos años y   aprendió muy bien las técnicas de este oficio logrando un gran entusiasmo  para crear su negocio, fue así como compró sus primeras herramientas básicas y con ello y su perseverancia ha ido ampliando su espectro, lo que la llevó a  estudiar cosmetología, estética facial y corporal, logrando poner en practica todo lo aprendido. Este es el  financiamiento # 11 de Salis, con su credikiva adecuará su local y ampliará el espacio para perfeccionar la pequeña venta de helados y convertirla en una heladería. Su sueño es tener una clínica de estética y belleza y asesorar a sus clientes ofreciendole productos que realmente necesitan, para resaltar su imagen personal y profesional.
texts.en:
Salís C. M. is a married woman who has two children aged 15 and 17.  She owns a beauty salon where she offers haircuts, hair straightenings, manicures and pedicures.  She also sells beauty products, especially facial cleansers.

Salis started out in her business 12 years ago.  Over the years she has learned how to make significant changes in the image and beauty of her customers.  She started out when she was still studying for a degree in social and economic sciences at university but she gave this up and studied hairdressing for two years.  She did a good job of learning the techniques of the trade and was really enthusiastic about setting up her own business.  She bought her first basic tools and, with a lot of perseverance, she managed to expand her range of offerings.  She studied cosmetology, and facial and body aesthetics, and put into practice everything that she learned. 

This is Salis' 11th loan.  She will use her Kiva loan to adapt her premises and expand her space so that she can adapt the small space from which she sells iced treats and turn it into an ice-cream parlor.  Her dream is to own an aesthetics and beauty clinic, and to advise her customers, offering them products that they really need, to highlight their personal and professional image.

loans.use: to make some structural changes to her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, chopped pork, beans, tomatoes and other ingredients needed to make pupusas

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is married and has three children and one other dependent.  They live in their own house in Hioma, Uganda. Her family goal is to educate her children to attain a degree as minimum qualification. She operates a hardware shop and has been running it for nine years. She started by selling used clothes and then saved to start the shop after a long struggle.  Harriet faces a challenge of her customers defaulting on payments; her dream is to own at least four hardware shops in town. Harriet is requesting a loan to buy metals and iron sheets to sell.

loans.use: To purchase metals and iron sheets

loans.name: Tsuma

texts.en:
Tsuma, a married man with two school-going children, lives with his family in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past six years, Tsuma has operated a matatu (motor vehicle) public transport business from the market, serving both market dwellers and travelers. He also operates a vegetable stall which contributes to his other source of income.

With the Kshs 40,000 he is requesting, Tsuma wants to renovate his stall and purchase sacks of cabbages, onions and potatoes. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to renovate his stall and purchase sacks of cabbages, onions and potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 34-year-old married man and the father of four children. He has made his living as an experienced taxi driver. He has been involved in this business since 1999. He serves all customers and he also does private transportation such as picnics, touristic tours, etc. He is the sole income provider for the family. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a new car in order to expand his business. He says that the new car will help him increase his profits which will allow him to better support his family.

loans.use: to purchase a new car.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina nació en la ciudad de Calca y tiene 29 años edad.  (Calca se encuentra a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco). Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad donde nació y es madre y padre par sus dos hijos. (La ciudad de Calca caracteriza por tener hermosos paisajes por ser una zona turística, ganadera y agrícola). Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Clorinda Matto de Turner” de la Asociación Arariwa. 
   
En la reunión del banco comunal conocimos a la Señora Karina que nos cuenta que tiene una pequeña tienda de librería y piñatería. Ella cada mes paga un alquiler del local y local está ubicado cerca a la plaza de armas de la ciudad e Calca. Ya son 5 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que realiza en su trabajo. Ella en esta oportunidad accede al crédito para comprar mercadería así poder surtir y abastecer su tienda. Con este préstamo de USD. 700 dólares aumentara el capital del negocio, comprará cuadernos, gorros infantiles y otras cosas más. 

Karina es una mujer luchadora y su sueño es hacer crecer su negocio. Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Asociación Arariwa por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de poder hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Karina was born in the city of Calca and is 29 years old. Calca is 45 minutes from the city of Cuzco. At present, she lives in the city where she was born and she is both mother and father to her two children. The city of Calca is characterized by its beautifullandscapes and for being a tourist attraction, with cattle and farming. She belongs to the “Clorinda Matto de Turner” community bank of the Asociación Arariwa. 
   
We met Karina at the meeting of the community bank. She tells us she has a small book and pinata store. She pays rent every month for a locale and the locale is close to the Plaza de Armas of the city of Calca. She has had this business for 5 years and it is going very well for her thanks to her hard work. At this time she is taking out the loan to buy merchandise and thus supply her store. With this loan of USD. 700, she will increase her working capital. She will buy notebooks, children's hats and more.  

Karina is a fighting woman and her dream is to grow her business. She is very grateful to the Movimiento Asociación Arariwa for helping women such as her to have opportunties to make their dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, children's hats, and more.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is married and has four children.  She works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from farming rice. Gemma is requesting a loan for 26,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant. Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Sopha

texts.en: Sopha, 55, resides in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Sopha produces traditional cakes to sell, earning an income of $2.80 per day to help cover the family expenses. Her husband repairs old shoes, earning an income of $6 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $100 on food and $32 on other necessary expenses. Sopha is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more ingredients to produce cakes. This will be her sixth loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to produce cakes to sell

loans.name: Benkadi  6 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi 6  est constitué de femmes mariées du village de DIGAN dans la sous préfecture de OUELESSEBOUGOU, région de KOULIKORO (deuxième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles, ont en moyenne 50  ans, 6 enfants et  cultivent de l’arachide, du riz, du  gombo etc.   
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont à leur  cinquième  prêt  de campagne.
TENIM, qui est la première debout à gauche,  compte utiliser son  prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semences d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles,  au grand marché de OUELESSEBOUGOU. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de OUELESSEBOUGOU, BAMAKO et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
TENIM compte réaliser, après l’écoulement de sa production agricole, un bénéfice de  20.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Benkadi 6 group is made up of married women from the village of Digan in the sub-prefecture of Ouelessebougou, which lies in Koulikoro (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region). They live in traditional families, average 50 years of age and grow groundnut, rice, gombo etc.

With a view to making their farming activities profitable, the group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program and are on their fifth farming loan.

Tenim, who is standing on the far left, is planning to use her loan to buy a sufficient quantity of groundnut seeds, small equipment and farm inputs at the large market in Ouelessebougou. After the rainy season the harvested crops are stocked for a certain amount of time in order to gain value before they are sold at the large markets in Ouelessbougou, Bamako and other surrounding markets, on a retail basis (but often wholesale) for cash to a customer base coming mainly from large towns.

Tenim is expecting to make a profit of 20,000FCFA once she has sold her produce, and this will be used to repay the interest on her loan and to cover her family's day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, seeds and small equipment

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Valientes, se conformó con la iniciativa de la señora Emilia. Este comité ha demostrado el buen trabajo en equipo y la solidaridad entre ellas. Están en el segundo ciclo mantienen las mismas integrantes las cuales expresan sus deseos de seguir con el compromiso y propósito de crecimiento económico y social del comité.
Ellas se definen como mujeres trabajadoras y sacrificada. Todas manifiestan estar muy a gusto dentro del programa.
La Sra. Alicia se dedica a la cría de animales. Desde pequeña se encargaba de los cuidados de los animales, ahora ese es su medio de subsistencia. Gracias e ese trabajo, ella puede generar un poco de ingresos que le es de mucha ayuda para solventar los gastos de la casa. Su sueño es tener una granja grande donde tener más animales que pueda criar.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de más animales, y además alimentos para los demás. Está muy esperanzada en el crédito, ya que sabe que le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The group Mujeres Valientes was started by Emilia.  This group has demonstrated good teamwork and solidarity.  They are in their second cycle with the same members, who express their desire of continuing the commitment and the purpose of economic and social growth of the group. They define themselves as hardworking women who make sacrifices.  They all say they are very happy in the program.  

Alicia works raising animals.  Since she was young, she was in charge of caring for animals, and now it is her livelihood.  Thanks to this work, she is able to earn a little income, which helps her pay the household expenses.  Her dream is to have a large farm where she can have more animals to care for.

She is asking for this loan to purchase more animals and feed for them.  She is very hopeful about the loan, since she knows it will be a big help.

loans.use: to purchase animals and feed.

loans.name: Lisset  De Los Santos

texts.es:
Liset, de 34 años, es madre de tres niños, de 14,12 y 2 años respectivamente, es originaria de  Telica una comunidad aledaña a la ciudad de León, pero vive en le centro de León, su nivel de estudio es básico solo finalizo el tercer grado de primaria. Ella es comerciante, tiene una pulpería en su casa.  Inicio a los 31 años de edad, este ha sido su segundo negocio anteriormente vendía fritangas (comidas fritas) en su casa. Puso la pulpería después de un sueño que ella tuvo, pues en su sueño vio los estantes llenos de mercadería y se lo dijo a su esposo el creyó en ella y le regalo un pequeño capital para comenzar con la pulpería, la suegra le ayudo a conseguir los estantes y de esta manera fue que poco a poco fue estableciendo su pulpería. Su esposo la sigue apoyando con lo que el gana en un taller mecánico que es donde el trabaja.
Requiere el préstamo para comprar granos básicos, arroz, azúcar, aceite y productos varios de consumo diario. Invirtiendo en el negocio y ofreciendo nuevos y mejores productos podrá satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, mejorar sus ventas. En lo próximo quiere comprar estantes de aluminio,2 vitrinas y un freezer para almacenar productos lácteos.
texts.en:
Liset, age 34, has three children; ages 14, 12, and 2.  She is from Telica, a community on the outskirts of the city of León.  However, she lives in the center of León.  Her level of education is basic; she only finished the third grade.

She is a businesswoman, and she has a store in her house.  She started when she was 31 years old.  This has been her second business.  She previously sold fried food at her house.  

She set up the store after a dream that she had.  In the dream she saw the shelves filled with merchandise.  She told this to her husband, and he believed in her.  He gave her a small amount of capital to start the store.  Her mother-in-law helped her get the shelves.  That is the way that she, little by little, was establishing her store.  Her husband continues to support her with what he earns in a mechanic’s shop, which is where he works.

She needs the loan to buy basic grains, rice, sugar, oil, and various products for daily consumption.  Investing in the business and offering new and improved products will be able to meet the demands of her customers and improve her sales.  With the next one she wants to buy aluminum shelves, two display cases, and a freezer to store dairy products.

loans.use: to buy basic grains rice, sugar, oil, and products for daily consumption.

loans.name: Jeogilyn

texts.en:
Jeogilyn is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Jeogilyn has a retail shop that sells canned goods, beverages & snacks. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Jeogilyn is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Jeogilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

loans.name: Jose Pablo

texts.es: José Pablo, tiene la edad 19 de años, está soltero y vive con sus padres y hermanos actualmente. El pretende con el crédito comprar insumos para la asistencia de su cafetal. El lo que va comprar específicamente es el abono y productos para aplicar al cultivo. El cuenta con el terreno establecido ya desde varios años atrás y con una plantación en condiciones buenas para la explotación de la misma. El pretende con el crédito realizar las ganancias económicas necesarias para seguir adelante con su proyecto  cafetalero  y generar ingresos económicos para el bienestar propio, la de sus hermanos y padres. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
José Pablo is 19, single and currently lives with his parents and siblings. With this loan, he intends to buy supplies to help with his coffee plantation. He will specifically buy fertilizer and other products to apply to his fields.

He is relying on land that was already planted in coffee several years ago and that is in good condition now for exploitation. He intends to use the loan to make the profits necessary to go ahead with his coffee plantation project and generate income for his own well being and that of his siblings and parents. 

This is José Pablo’s first loan with FUDECOSUR. He has not had other loans before from state banks, but FUDECOSUR more easily provided him with a loan and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to care for his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married with 3 school-aged children. She is 29 years old and lives in Capucao, Ozamiz City. Philippines.

Sarah grows several edible plants such as root crops, cassava and other vegetables. She sells them in the marketplace, her own place and in neighboring communities. She has been cultivating the soil for over 10 years and gets a total of PHP 7,000 a month. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase seeds and seedlings to plant. 

Sarah became a member of GDMPC earlier this year. In the future, Sarah hopes to expand and improve her business to gain more income for the household. She plans to buy a house and a lot near her residence.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and seedlings.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 31 years old. She has been a fish vendor in her community for almost a month. This occupation provides financial benefits to her family. So she is patiently walking while carrying her styrofoam and weighing scale to sell daily. 

She was blessed with five children and three of them are studying. She needs to sell every day to give them allowances for school. 

She is earning PHP 200 daily, which is insufficient. Due to this low income, she is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy additional fishes to sell. She hopes to increase her income to improve their unprivileged lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy additional fishes to sell.

loans.name: Eulogio Ramiro

texts.es:
Eulogio de 56 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Guadalupe que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.  La zona se caracterizapor la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

La labor que Eulogio desarrolla es de maestro de obras de construcción, esta actividad que realiza es eventual, es sólo cuando lo contratan en obras de contrucción, es conocido en la zona donde vive por el buen trabajo que brinda a las personas que lo contratan.  Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 800 nuevos soles para que realice algunos arreglos en su casa y mejore la calidad de vida de su familia.

Eulogio es un padre de familia responsable y trabajador que se preocupa por el bienestar de los suyos y todas las mejoras que realiza es para sacar a su familia adelante.
texts.en:
Eulogio is 56, and lives with his family in their own house, which has water and electricity. It is located in the Guadalupe district, which is part of the La Libertad department. People in this area make their living from farming and livestock-raising. 

Eulogia is a construction foreman. This work is casual in nature, and he only works when he is hired for a construction project.  He is well known in the area where he lives for the good work he does for the people who hire him. 

He has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 800 nuevos soles, in order to do some repairs on his house, and improve his family's quality of life. Eulogio is a responsible and hard-working parent who is concerned for the well-being of his loved ones.  All the improvements that he is carrying out are meant to help his family get ahead in life.

loans.use: To carry out some repairs to the interior of his house, to provide more household amenities for his family.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia owns and operates a business selling soft drinks in her local community. She is unmarried and lives in the Paynesville area with her 11-year-old child, who is enrolled in school and lives at home.

Emilia has been engaged in her business for the past 10 years. She makes a good profit, which helps her to pay her child's school fees.

She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more soft drinks to offer for sale. Her plan is to build a house and to continue to be able to send her child to school.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks to offer for sale

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La Sra Julia tiene 74 años, vive en la ciudad D. Mariano Roque Alonso,  tiene una Despensa en su casa. El trabajo que realiza lo ha hecho por  más D. 5 años, desD. que vino D. Ciudad del Este, vendió todo lo que tenia allá y vino, se instaló y compro una casa.
Uno D. sus sueños es que sus hijos terminen la carrera universitaria para poder ser profesionales y que D. esa forma por medio D. sus estudios ellos tengan un mejor porvenir y que no pasen por privaciones como las que ella tuvo que atravesar.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra D. Bebidas, como ser cervezas, vinos y gaseosa con lo cual podrá abastecer su despensa y agradece a la Fundación por darle la oportunidad D. acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Julia, 74, lives in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso; she has a home-based grocery store.  She has been doing this work for over five years since she moved here from Ciudad del Este.  She sold everything she owned there and moved here, settled in and bought a house.

One of her dreams is that her children complete university careers so that they can be professionals and through their studies attain better futures and not have to suffer the privations she had to undergo.

She is asking for the loan to buy beverages like beer, wine and soft-drinks to stock her store and she thanks the Fundación for giving her the opportunity to access a loan.

loans.use: to buy beer, wine and soft-drinks to stock her store.

loans.name: Shurukan's Group

texts.en:
Shurukan is the leader of this group. She is 57 and married to a retiree. Together with her husband she has raised a daughter and a son, both of whom work in Russia. 

Six years ago with an initial investment of 15,000 KGS, Shurukan started a livestock breeding business. Reselling livestock after fattening, she earns about 5,000 KGS per month. This profit allows her to meet their daily needs. 

With money from the loan, Shurukan wants to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening and further reselling. In the near future, she plans to enlarge a shed to be able to keep more animals.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya. He is married with 4 children, and the first two are already in school. His farm produces maize and milk, which he sells locally. He also operates a motorcycle transport business.

Joseph has requested a loan of 90,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to enable him to construct a greenhouse. He says the greenhouse will improve his farming income, which will enable him to provide basic requirements for his family. He adds that his motorcycle transport business also stands to improve due to improved farming income.

He laments the high costs of farming.

loans.use: to construct a greenhouse.

loans.name: Nodira

texts.ru: Нодира замужем имеет четверых детей . Семья большая. Она занимается выпечкой хлеба. На рынке Панчшанбе – это центральный рынок. Имеет помещение в аренду. Бизнес востребованы. От продажи хлеба имеет хорошую выручку, что помогает в содержании семьи. Она хотела бы получить займ в размере 1500 долларов США для оптовой закупки муки. Она весьма благодарна тем, кто ее поддержит, потому что под праздники можно получить хороший доход. Спасибо тем, кто протянет руку помощи.
texts.en: Nodira is married and has four children.  Her family is large.  She is involved in baking bread at the Panchshanbe market, which is the central market.  Nodira leases her business space.  Her business is in demand.  Nodira makes a good profit from the sales of bread, which helps with supporting her family.  She wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $1500 for the wholesale purchase of flour.  She is quite grateful to all, who will support her because she can make a good profit before the holidays.  Thank you to all, who will extend a helping hand.

loans.use: to purchase flour at a wholesale price

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is 20 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past year, she has been working hard to manage her retail shop where she sells food and home supplies to local customers. 

To help expand her business, Oliver is requesting a 700,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to buy more food items to sell. She will used the increased profit from her loan to pay fees for her children. Oliver hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house on her grandmother's land. 

Oliver is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has improved Oliver's future prospects by helping her to learn about finance.

loans.use: to buy food items to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 28 years old, married, and has a four year old son. He has provided transportation services using his motorcycle for the past two years. His business faces the challenge of rising fuel prices. He will use this loan of KES 15,000 to buy spare parts for his motorbike and pawpaw seeds to start a new business of selling pawpaws. Peter hopes in the future to own more motorbikes so as to expand his motorbike transportation business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his motorbike and to buy pawpaw seeds to venture into a new business of selling pawpaws.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is 35 years old, married and has five children, all of whom are in school. She has run a food stall in Yei, South Sudan, for five years. Christine is requesting this loan through Kiva partner BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and onions for resale. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and onions for resale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 21 years old and single. He has been running a retail shop for the last 3 years, earning a monthly income of KES 6,000.

He is requesting his first loan in the amount of KES 5,000. He will use the funds to buy stocks of sugar, bread, tea leaves, and flour. With the anticipated profits he will save for his future family. 

His hope and dream is to own a wholesale store.

loans.use: To buy stocks of sugar, bread, tea leaves, and flour.

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en:
Hiba is a 32 year old married woman who has 3 family members from AL Hashmi |Amman Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to pay for children and woman clothes to sell. In the future she would like to expand her project through opening a shop and she wants to increase her family income.
Hiba prefers not to display her photo on the internet, thus the above photo is of her sister

loans.use: to pay for clothes to sell

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en: Sabina operates an beverage pub. She runs her business both in the day and the night time. She serves about 30 clients during the day and about 40 in the evenings. She is able to make about $10-15 daily as her sales turnover. She has been a trainee of the TEACH lending program and now she keeps simple records of her business transactions daily. She has indicated her plans to prepare the 2007 Business and Marketing Plan for her Enterprise. Sabina would need a KIVA loan in the amount of $800 to enable her to expand her small enterprise.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Mrs Thu is 39 years old. She has divorced and now lives with 3 children. Her family is very poor. She has 1,000 square meters of rice land but the yield is low.

Her oldest child is 17 years old and has stopped school. She helps her mother to sell jackfruits in the market in order to help the two others to continue their school. The second child is 14 years old and the youngest child is 13 years old. It is difficult for her family to earn a living, so she wants to borrow US $75 to expand her small business to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase and sell jackfruits.

loans.name: Ven

texts.en: Mr. Ven V., who is 41 years old and is a father of 1 child, lives in another part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He is a head of the family and is the one who controls all the family expense, while his wife stays at home cooking meals and looking after her child. V. drives a car to transport the garment workers from and to their jobs. With this business activity, he can typically makes around $9/ day in revenue. To do this, V. is asking for $600 to afford to purchase a car in order to operate this business. With this car, V. would like to use it not only to transport garment workers, but also to carry other's market products in order to make additional income. In the future, V. is still thinking about how to make additional money for his family and for a high level of his children's education.

loans.use: To purchase a car to transport the garment workers from and to work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in new foods to prepare

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela is very hard working. She is married and has one small son. From the time she got married, she's been saving to open up her own business.
