With her savings and desire to give the best to her family, after just one year she managed to open a service business. Recently she began including the rent of computers for the use of Internet, which is returning good results and their sales have increased considerably.

In order to provide more service options, Adela is requesting a loan of $375, which she will use to purchase merchadise. She is planning to repay the loan in 3 months.

Decide on contributing to the growth of this business - Adela and her family are grateful for your trust and any help you can offer.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Adela es una mujer muy trabajadora, está casada y tiene un pequeño hijo. Desde que se casó Adela ha estado ahorrando para poder emprender su propio negocio, con sus ahorros y el deseo de darle lo mejor a su familia después de un año logró abrir su propia mercería y fue acondicionándola mejor, ahora ha incluido la renta de computadoras para el uso de Internet, obteniendo muy buenos resultados, con lo que sus ventas se han incrementado considerablemente.

Para poder tener bien surtido su negocio Adela está solicitando un préstamo de $ 375 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía y se compromete a regresar en 3 meses. Decídete a contribuir en el crecimiento de este negocio, Adela y su familia agradecen mucho la confianza y el apoyo que le brindas.

loans.use: Loan will be used to purchase merchandise to offer more services to clients.

loans.name: Lucio Sabino

texts.es:
We found Lucio, master builder, working hard in building a shelter, where he works each day, surrounded by cement, sand and bricks, to provide a better future for his family, with much effort and sacrifice. After working at construction daily, he goes and works in a small farm and tends to the plantain crop with the help of his beloved wife. Lucio learned agricultural work from an early age, when he used to spend time in the jungle and as a young man rented a small house on the land. Lucio would like to put greater investment in the plantain production, in order to earn more income and start a clothing retail business, with his wife, so that hopefully they can begin to save money. His ultimate dream is to purchase a plot of land in which he can begin construction of their own home, where he and his family can share moments of happiness. With hopes and dreams of establishing his own sweet home, he asks for your help and contribution.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Encontramos a Lucio, maestro de obras, trabajando animosamente en la construcción de una vivienda, donde sumergido entre cemento, arena y ladrillos, forja día a día un futuro mejor para su familia, a través de su esfuerzo y sacrificio. Cuando acaba su labor como constructor, presuroso se interna en su pequeña chacra para cuidar sus platanales con ayuda de su querida esposa.Él aprendió las labores agrícolas desde que empezó a radicar en la selva, mostrando gran habilidad y destreza, por lo cual se quedó a radicar allí alquilando una casa. Lucio desea tener una mayor inversión de dinero en la producción de plátanos para iniciar un negocio de comercialización de ropa, junto a su esposa, con lo cual podrán empezar a ahorrar dinero. Para comprar un terreno, en el cual Lucio pueda iniciar la construcción de su casa, de manera que junto a su familia pueda compartir momentos de alegría.Con el anhelo de establecerse en un dulce hogar recurre a vuestra generosa ayuda y contribución.

loans.use: Additional capital in order to continue growing exquisite plantain crop and expand production. (Inyección de capital para seguir produciendo exquisitos plátanos en su pequeña chacra.)

loans.name: Adidiatu Ismaila

texts.en: A. is 47 years old. He is a butcher and owns a butcher shop in the Yopougon-Sideci market, in the north of Abidjan. He has owned this business since 1984 when he emigrated from Nigeria to Cote d'Ivoire. A. is married and has 3 children. He lives with his family in Yopougon. His wife sells cosmetic products in Adjame, another suburb of the city of Abidjan. A.'s children all go to school, and he cares for his family with the revenues from his business. A. heard about our microcredit program two years ago when he met a loan officer. He has benefited from different loans since then, and he repaid the loans successfully.

loans.use: To purchase a couple of cows

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en: Mariatu is 42 years old and married with 3 children. Like many women in Sierra Leone, Mariatu runs a business of selling plastic sandals in Makeni town to supplement her husband’s income. She started her business with loan capital from SMT and would like to further expand the business. She is therefore requesting a loan of $525 for the purpose.

loans.use: She would like to expand her business to include other items in addition to plastic sandals

loans.name: Tatiana

texts.en: Tatiana T. is 24 years old. She is alone and lives with her two kids in her parents house in the village of Manastirishte near Vratza. Tatiana is unemployed. For a year, she has bred two cows in the yard of her house and needs to buy fodder to feed them.

loans.use: To buy fodder

loans.name: Proloung

texts.en: Mr. Proloung Y. is 33 years old. He is a fisherman and makes around $5 per day. He is married with three children, two of whom are students, while the other child is too young to attend school. His wife, Vanny Sorn, sells vegetables. She makes around $2.50 per day. Her husband would like to request a loan in order to buy fishing equipment.

loans.use: To buy fishing equipment

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa runs a shoe shop. Before this, she worked selling shoes in a market, in a relative’s shop. This is where she learned about the trade. After a while, she left her job to work for herself and tried to set up a business selling clothes. After a year she decided to branch out into selling other items for women. On moving to San Martin from Porres she decided to join forces with another relative and return to try her luck with a shoe business. Luckily, it all worked out and now she has almost been in business for a year. Luisa states that she feels ready for anything, always looking for ways to develop, not only for herself but for the sake of her three young children

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

El actual negocio de la señora Luisa es su zapatería. Anteriormente ella ha trabajado como zapatera dentro de un mercado en el negocio de un familiar. Es ahí donde aprende el oficio del calzado. Después de haber trabajado un tiempo se independizó e intento hacer negocio en la confección de ropa. Durante un año ella se dedicó a aplicarle acabados a distintas prendas para mujeres. Al momento de mudarse a San Martin de Porres ella decide juntarse con otro familiar y volver a probar suerte en un negocio de calzado. Felizmente le fue bien y ahora esta a punto de cumplir un año en su local. Luisa afirma que se siente capaz de todo buscando siempre el progreso, no solo por ella sino también por sus tres menores hijos.

loans.use: To improve her service, selling women clothes and products

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos lives in his own home with his children and his wife. His home is located in 18th Street in the Bajo Llojeta neighborhood of the city of La Paz. Both he and his wife dedicate themselves to selling charcoal and their business is going well. He is requesting a loan to increase his working capital in order to reach more clients especially in supermarkets. His prior history is good and he qualifies for a new loan. Juan Carlos obtained a prior loan through Kiva which is paid in full.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Juan Carlos vive en casa propia con sus hijos y su esposa, su domicilio esta en la calle 18 de la zona de bajo Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que realiza es la venta de carbón vegetal, tanto él como la esposa se dedican a este negocio el cual está funcionando muy bien. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital de trabajo y así poder llegar a muchos más clientes, en especial a los supermercados. Su antecedente histórico es bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito. Juan Carlos obtuvo un préstamo anterior vía Kiva, al cual está pagado en su totalidad.

loans.use: Capital to purchase charcoal.

loans.name: Filifilia's Group

texts.en:
The women in this group are engaged in planting and selling taro and bananas. Their husbands actually do the farming, while the women sell and look for markets. This operates much like a family business in which everyone participates through different tasks. This is a new group and the members are very hard working and honest women. They participate and attend weekly meetings and they have started their businesses well. These are their first loans and will be their first experiences in running their own money.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Purchase of chemicals, knives, weed killing spray, and tools for their businesses.

loans.name: Yegana

texts.en: Yegana (her husband is pictured) was born in 1970. She is a mother of 2 children. The Khasmammadov family lives in Khachmaz town. This family needs a loan of  $1200 to improve their greenhouse. They have been in this business for 7 years.

loans.use: To improve her greenhouse

loans.name: Medehouekon Nazaire

texts.fr:
Born circa 1970 in Dangbo (Ouémé Department, Southern Benin), Mr. Medehouekon Nazaire L. is married and the father of three children, who are all living with their mother in the village. A trained mason, he started a while ago a business of retailing cement. He also makes bricks that he delivers to the reseller. Due to the price increase of cement, Mr. Medehouekon Nazaire L. experiences huge difficulties in getting supplies. At the same time, demand remains very high due to his geographic situation. In order to get out of this problematic situation, he's seeking a second loan to meet customer demand and also to strengthen his business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Né vers les années 1970 à Dangbo dans le département de l'Ouémé au Sud du Bénin, Monsieur L. Medehouekon Nazaire est marié et père de trois enfants vivant tous avec leur mère au village. Maçon de profession, il s'est lancé depuis un moment dans la vente de ciment en détail et aussi dans la fabrication des bornes qu'il livre au revendeur. Suite à l'inflation du prix de ciment, monsieur L. Medehouekon Nazaire s'est retrouvé face à d'énormes difficultés pour s'approvisionner en ciment. Dans le même temps la demande est restée très forte en raison de sa situation géographique. Pour éviter de s'éterniser dans cette situation combien fâcheuse pour les clients, il vient solliciter son deuxième crédit afin de répondre à la demande de sa clientèle et aussi pour le renforcement de son activité.

loans.use: To buy 4.5 tons of cement

loans.name: Kimlim

texts.en:
Mrs. Kimlim K., 48, and her husband, Mr. Phem Im, 50, who live in a Phnom Penh suburb, married in 1983 and have two daughters. One of them studies in university in Phnom Penh and other one is a garment factory worker.

Mrs. Kimlim has been selling rice pork for four years. Her husband has been a policeman since 1983. Now, Kimlim is requesting a loan of US$ 700 to pay school fees for her daughter.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her daughter

loans.name: Diap Thialène Group

texts.fr: Situé dans la région de Thiès, Louly Ngogom (http://www.sem-fund.org/loulyngogomfr.php) est un village sérère dont l'activité principale est l'agriculture et l'élevage. La récolte 2007 étant productive, l’accessibilité à l’eau et la disponibilité de la paille d’arachide (fourrage) font de Louly, un cadre adéquat pour l’embouche bovine. C’est pourquoi nous venons auprès de kiva solliciter un prêt pour acheter des jeunes bœufs pour nous orienter vers l'embouche dans le but d'améliorer le revenu monétaire de leur exploitation et la fertilité de nos sols par l'utilisation du fumier.
texts.en:
Located in the Thiès region, Louly Ngogom (http://www.sem-fund.org/loulyngogomfr.php) is a quiet little town whose main activities are agriculture and livestock. The harvest in 2007 was bountiful, and access to water and the availability of peanut straw for fodder make Louly a good place for fattening cattle. That is why we have come to Kiva requesting a loan to purchase young steers for fattening. Our goal is to use them to increase our monetary income and to use the manure to improve the fertility of our soil.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fattening of cattle

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
The Nuevo Amanecer’ (meaning, New Dawn) communal bank is located in Huancavelica in the district and community named Yauli. Yauli has a warm climate. The most popular occupation is commerce because there is an abundance of potatoes, onions, wheat, and livestock, including cows, goats, and sheep, although in smaller numbers. The community also produces milk and cheese, and its beautiful sights attract tourists. Along the streets of Yauli you can see the Chopccas, the native people of the region who dress in colorful garments. In Yauli there is place near the train station where the members of Finca Peru sell their delicious potato and cheese dishes to the passengers.

Paulina C. is married and has two children, 23 and 30 years old, who are both married. Paulina started selling lollipops, earning nine soles for every box she sold. She heard about Finca Peru in the train station, and she decided to take part in their meetings. Her loans have allowed her to rent a store downtown in Yauli and purchase pots and pans, dishes, and clothing to stock the store. Paulina told us that business is going very well. With Finca Peru she learned to overcome problems in managing a store and thanks to the training given to members, she considers Finca Peru as a parent giving her a loan to start a new business. She learned how to save money and to set up a working capital fund. Paulina's dream is to have a larger store and to purchase more merchandise to better serve her clients.

MarceL. T. is married and has 4 children. She sells meats. MarceL. has a daughter who is mentally disabled and wanders the streets. This worries MarceL. very much but her friends at Finca Peru remind her that with the help of God she will get better. With her loans MarceL. rented a store in downtown Yauli and purchased more merchandise. She sells ice cream, soft drinks, and beer. Her dream is to purchase a house in downtown Yauli. It is very expensive but she is saving to make her dream a reality.

Doris B. is married and has 2 children, 2 and 4 years old. She tells us that her husband has abandoned her and during that period she suffered a great deal. She is the only one supporting her daughters. She has a convenience store where she previously sold only groceries, but little by little she was able to improve the selection. Now she sells meats, vegetables, fruits, clothing etc. In Yuali there are many weddings and baptisms and she wants to purchase merchandise for these special occasions. She has learned to appreciate herself as a woman and never allow herself to be mistreated. She is grateful to Finca Peru because she learned how to save money, to be strong, and have strong values. Doris’ dream is to proviD. her daughters with an education, until they grow up to be professionals. She also dreams of opening a snack bar, because there isn't one in Yauli.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

El bancomunal Nuevo Amanecer esta ubicado en el departamento D. Huancavelica, distrito D. Yauli, comunidad D. Yauli, con clima calido, actividades principales D. L. comunidad donD. crece abundante papa, cebolL., trigo en ganadería encontramos abundantes vacas , cabras y ovejas menor proporción, en esta comunidad existe bastante comercio. También produce leche y quesos, encontramos que es una zona turística con atractivos muy lindos, por las calles D. Yauli se ve los Chopccas, son nativos D. L. zona que se pasean con sus vestimentas D. fuertes colores con chuyos, Waras, medias D. colores, En Yauli hay una estación donD. las socias D. FINCA Perú aprovechan en vender a los pasajeros L. rica papa con queso

Paulina C., es casada tiene dos hijos ya mayores D. 23 y 30 años casados, Paulina comenzó a vender chupetes y ganaba por caja dos nuevos soles, escucho en L. estación del tren hablar D. Finca Perú y se animó a asistir a las charlas, sus prestamos le han permitido alquilar una tienda en el centro D. Yauli, compro ollas, losas, ropas, surtió su tienda y elL. nos cuenta que le va bien. Con Finca aprendió a no tener problemas en el manejo D. su negocio, gracias a las capacitaciones que se les dan, elL. considera a Finca como su padre que el dio el préstamo para comenzar su nuevo negocio aprendiendo a ahorrar y separa el dinero para el capital El sueño D. doña Paulina es tener una tienda más granD. y comprar mercadería para atender mejor a sus clientes

MarceL. T., es casada con 4 hijos, elL. venD. carne Doña MarceL. tiene una hija que esta mal D. L. cabeza, camina sin sentido por las calles eso le aflige mucho pero sus amigas D. Finca L. alientan que con L. ayuda D. Dios se sanara. Con sus préstamos a alquilado una tienda en el centro D. Yauli, y compro mas mercadería, realiza venta D. helados, gaseosas, cervezas, su sueño es comprar una casa en el centro D. Yauli, cuesta mucho pero ahorrara para cumplir su sueño

Doris B., casada, tiene dos hijos D. 2 años y D. 4 años nos cuenta que su esposo L. abandono, fue una etapa en L. cual sufrió mucho, elL. es el único sustento para sus hijas. Tiene una tienda donD. solo vendía abarrotes, poco a poco elL. ha podido surtir su tienda y ahora venD. carne, verduras, frutas, ropas, etc. En Yauli se realizan muchos matrimonios, bautizos y elL. quiere aprovechar L. oportunidad en comprar mercadería para esas ocasiones. también ha aprendido a valorarse como mujer y a no permitir en ser maltratada, agrádese a Finca por que aprendió ahorrar, a ser muy solidaria, fuerte y sobre valores. El sueño D. dona Doris es darles estudios a sus hijas hasta que sean unas profesionales y abrir una pillería en Yauli, por que no hay.

loans.use: For members to invest in their businesses.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: Sandra tiene 22 años, es conviviente, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Hace 5 años que se dedica a venta de productos de belleza, después de cumplir sus actividades de ama de casa, le gusta estar en contacto con la gente, por ello que ha visto por conveniente ser promotora de productos de belleza, ya que le es muy rentable y le deja márgenes de ganancia muy considerables, sobre todo  la línea de perfumes. En horas de la tarde de dedica a ir de casa en casa para que pueda ofrecer sus productos y así de a poco piensa incrementar sus productos, lo difícil para ella es que no cuenta con dinero suficiente para comprar en grandes cantidades sus productos de belleza y pueda ganar mucho más. Es su 5to préstamo con MicroFinanzas Prisma. El dinero será invertido en la compra de productos de belleza de varias líneas de cosméticos.
texts.en:
Sandra is 22 years old and lives with her partner and their two children. For five years she has sold beauty products. After fulfilling her daily responsibilities as a homemaker she enjoys getting out among people, and so selling beauty products is well-suited to her. The business is very lucrative and provides considerable profit margins, especially the line of perfumes. She spends her afternoons going from house to house to sell her products and her success has made her want to offer more items for sale. Unfortunately, she does not have enough money to purchase the quantities of products that would enable her to earn more. This is her fifth loan from Microfinanzas Prisma. The money will be invested in buying beauty products from various cosmetic lines.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the variety of beauty products for sale

loans.name: Samir

texts.en:
Samir, 29, lives in Bourj el Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with his wife and their child. Samir has been working as a barber for fifteen years. He has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase accessories and perfumes for his shop. This is the first time that he has asked for a loan.

When Samir first started his business, he had his father's support which helped him a lot. Samir is special in his work because of his good reputation and his good behavior with customers. His customers are his neighbors. In the future, he plans to have more than one shop.

loans.use: to purchase accessories and perfumes for his shop

loans.name: Min

texts.en: Min K. is 28 years old and lives in Siem Reap province with her husband and her child. She is a housewife, cooking food for the family members. Her husband operates a power-washing service from home, making around US$ 5 a day. Mrs. Min K. wants to earn more income. She aims to improve their standard of living, so she is requesting a loan from Kiva via Credit to breed pigs. She believes that this activity will provide her family more to live on.

loans.use: To breed pigs.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: Mrs. Thy K. is a villager in Thnorl village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a rice middleman. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it. She decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice to earn more profits. He husband, Mr. Ouk Sary, makes wells to sell. Mrs. Thy K. is 49 years old and the mother of five children. One of her children works while the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more rice

loans.name: Dilbarjon

texts.en:
For the past seven years, Dilbarjon has sold women’s dressing gowns and underclothes at “Somon” market in Khujand. Dilbarjon is married and has three children. She is determined to provide a better living for her entire family. Dilbarjon is hard working and kind, giving her the ideal blend of entrepreneurial determination and service. Skilled in trade and abounding in character, Dilbarjon has both a strong business base and a perfect credit history with IMON International. Currently, she is seeking a loan of $800 USD to purchase a new vending facility and to expand her business. With the increased income, Dilbarjon plans to continue growing her business and improving the financial situation of her family.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, Tajikistan is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Raphael Primary School Group

texts.en:
These are teachers at the St. Raphael Primary School. It was established in 1923 by the Catholic Mission to spread education and religious doctrine. The school has a total number of 570 pupils and a staff of thirteen teachers. The school produces good results at the National Primary School Exams (NPSE). They also organize sports and thanks giving every academic year for the pupils.

Some of the major challenges facing this school are the late receipt of school fee subsidies from the government, the belated arrival of the teaching materials and the inadequate seating accommodations for the pupils.

Teachers and other professional workers come to SMT to seek loans for different reasons. Since salaries are usually very small, they are prompted to engage in businesses to supplement their meager salaries. Some cannot run a business for themselves directly; rather, they will invest whatever little they have into their wives’ businesses. Others seek a loan in order to pursue further studies or to pay school fees for their children. There will also be some who will want a loan to buy pieces of furniture like chairs or a bed, and some will want to either start building a house or continue with a house building project they have already begun. It is for some of these reasons that teachers at St. Raphael have come to SMT to seek a loan. 

Sylvanus A. K. (left) is the head of this group. He has been in the teaching profession for thirty years. He was born in Waterloo, twenty miles (32 km) from Freetown. He is fifty years old and married to a businesswoman. They have seven children between the ages of seven and twenty-one. With this loan, Mr. K. will buy house-building materials such as doors and windows. He has already started building the house and only the doors and windows are lacking for the completion of the house. This loan will certainly enable Mr. K. to achieve his dream of completing his house.

loans.use: To supplement their salaries

loans.name: Evelin Petronila

texts.es:
En el municipio de Nagarote de la ciudad de León, la señora Eveling M. se dedica a su actividad de ganadería en la crianza de cerdos siendo esta su actividad con el cual atiende su familia la cual requiere de su apoyo para sobrevivir.

Ella se ha caracterizado por ser una dama muy trabajadora habiendo salido adelante y mejorado su situación económica. Hoy en día, la razón por la cual ella espera en Ceprodel es porque ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de ganado como son cerdos para proceder a su crianza y así desarrollarse en su actividad.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Nagarote, in the city of Leon, Señora Eveling M. pursues her livelihood of raising hogs. That's how she takes care of her family, who rely on her support in order to survive. She describes herself as a very hardworking lady who is making her way forward and improving her economic situation. Nowadays, her hope lies with CEPRODEL because she has requested a loan for the purchase of livestock, let's say pigs, so she can get going with raising them and develop her business.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy some pigs

loans.name: Saliful

texts.en: Saliful D. is married with 4 children and received an education through senior high school. Since 2007, Saliful has worked as a taxi driver and also as a trader, selling wood, at Abrobeano in Elmina. Saliful’s wife also works as a trader in the area. He uses his income to pay for school fees and bills. Saliful will use the loan to purchase more wood for selling and he plans to save the new profits from his expanded business towards buying a car.

loans.use: To purchase more wood for selling.

loans.name: Salomat

texts.en: S. Salomat is 45 years old. She is married and has four children. Salomat runns a cafe where she provides the meals of the national cuisine. She’s renting the catering room which is located in the central local market which allows Salomat to have many clients, the majority of which are those making purchases in the market. Every day she purchases the latest foodstuffs and cooks delicious dishes. Her daughter helps her with the business. Now Salomat is asking for a loan $1300 for the term of 12 months that will be used to buy a refrigerator and more foodstuffs. Salomat thanks all those supporting her and promises to repay the loan promptly. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator and more foodstuffs

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thị, age 35, lives in the town of Phúc Yên. She is married and has two school-aged children. To earn a living, T. owns and operates a business raising ducks for sale. T. has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month from this activity.

In 1999, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

T. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. The loan will be the ninth loan taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. T. plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Emmie

texts.en: Emmie B. is from the village of Danao. She is 35 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Emmie owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Emmie has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Emmie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. Emmie is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
When Oscar first arrived in Miami he found work as a housekeeper, working for wealthy residents of an apartment building in a good part of town. Oscar’s friendly personality won over the residents of the building, and he began to get referrals.

One year ago, with experience in the business and a good outlook for his future, Oscar decided to stop working for the company and to start his own cleaning service. He now does maintenance and upkeep for seven commercial buildings and apartments, spending two hours a day at each location.  

At some locations, Oscar has the opportunity to increase his profits by offering car-washing as a service. He is requesting a loan from ACCION USA to purchase the equipment he needs to get started. He needs a water tank, a pump and hose, some bulk cleaning supplies, as well as a used van to transport the material.

Oscar is enthusiastic and optimistic about the expansion of his cleaning business. Because of the success of his current business, he is confident that his car-washing service will be successful as well.

loans.use: To buy car-wash supplies and a used van

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda A. hails from the beautiful town of Binangonan in the Rizal province of the Philippines. She is 49 years old and married to Arnel, 48 year old. She is a mother to seven children; five are already adults, while two are still young and dependent on her.

Poverty is not a hindrance to success. There's always a way to get out from under it. In 1999, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines with hope to access capital for her business. During her previous loans, she carefully invested in resale of fruits and dressed chicken. The business went good and brings her enough income for her family.

Now on her 10th loan, she proposes a loan as addtional capital for her business fruit stand and resale of dressed chicken. She is optimistic that she can bring her family out of poverty as she feels slowly the progress of her business.

loans.use: As addtional capital for her business fruit stand and resale of dressed chicken.

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en:
Toyin designs clothes of various styles in line with customers' demand. She also sells tailoring materials and has been in this business for the past four years, after training for two years. In her locality she is the only one selling tailoring materials hence the increased demand. She is requesting the loan of N140,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell.

Toyin is 35 years old and married with four children. She says thank you

loans.use: To purchase tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Bertha Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Bertha Patricia vive con su esposo el señor Ricardo Macias, forman una familia unida y trabajadora. Ella trabaja para una empresa de ventas de artículos de oficina, su esposo trabaja en un restaurante como músico desde hace 5 años.
Ellos están tramitando este crédito para la colocación del alambrado eléctrico de su casa, porque se quemo y requieren instalarlo ya que la luz es un servicio básico dentro de cada hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bertha Patricia lives with her husband, Mr. Ricardo Macias, and together they make up a close-knit, hard-working family. Bertha works for a company that sells office supplies, and her husband has been working for five years as a musician at a restaurant.

They applied for this loan for the purpose of installing electric wiring in their house. The old wiring burned out and needs to be reinstalled, since electricity is an essential service in any home.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installation of household electrical wiring.

loans.name: Segondina

texts.en:
Segondina S. is from the village of Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 58 years old. Segondina is married and has 2 school-aged children.

To make a living, Segondina owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector selling fish. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from selling fish in local communites. Segondina has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Segondina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Segondina from GDMPC. Segondina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC.

Segondina is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and for daily needs.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Kawuku Namaweje Christine Group

texts.en:
N. Christine is twenty-four years old and married with five children of whom three are schooling.

Christine’s business, which she has been operating for ten years now, has always been dealing in cash crops: that is, selling coffee. She is requesting the loan to purchase more coffee: at least fifteen to twenty bags of coffee for more profit return.

Christine has a coffee plantation and on top of that she purchases coffee from other farmers to stock for sale. She is sure that, with adding capital to her business, and with more effort, it will expand. She dreams of purchasing a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase more coffee to sell

loans.name: Edlie

texts.en:
Edlie L. sells  “halo-halo,” a snack that contains different fruits, such as banana, jack fruit, cassava, and coconut and other flavorings, such as ice and milk. This has been her business for twenty-four years and it has helped her family to survive. She generates an income of Php 6,000 from her business every month. 

She dreams about expanding her business by acquiring additional capital of Php 5,000. She plans to buy more supplies for her business, such as glasses, spoons, containers and other materials that will be very helpful to her business. She anticipates for a higher income with help from ASKI.

Edlie is a forty-five-year-old woman. Her family lives in the village of Magsaysay in Naguilian, Isabela. Harley, her loving husband, is a well-known carpenter in their village. They still send their four children in school, which is the reason why the couple works hard. They hope to support all their children's educational needs so they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her halo-halo business

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Pheap N. is 42 years old and lives in Russey Srouk village in the Takeo province. She is employed. Her husband, Mr. Phan Ly, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a construction worker. Although they try to work hard, they still don't earn enough income to better support their family. 

Mrs. Pheap N. is applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. This couple has five children who are attending the local school. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Amale

texts.en: Amale is a 50-year-old single woman living with her mother and sister. She has owned a baby clothing shop called "White Angel" since 2006 to earn income to help satisfy their living conditions. Today, Amale is asking for a loan of $800 to buy more clothes to meet the great demand for her products.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: A small wooden house located along the river belongs to Mrs. Sim S., age 36, who earns a living as a fish catcher. Sim S. and her husband have been taking time to fish in and around Tunle Sap River for nine years. The family has five school-aged children. Recently, this couple hasn't caught as many fish as before because a part of their fishing implements are in bad condition. Sim S. requests a loan to repair the broken implements and to buy more implements for fishing activities.

loans.use: To repair the broken implements and to buy more tools for fishing activities

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en: Mrs. Saroeun T. is a villager in Tuol Svay village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. On this farm, she now faces a small problem because her field is infertile which affects her crop. To deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizer and pesticides to support the field. Her husband, Mr. Saer An, is a fisherman who can make a small income to support the family. Mrs. Saroeun T. is a mother of six children. Three of the children attend the local school, two are farmers and the youngest one is four years old and too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: Orlando tiene 44 años y esta casado con Marlene de 36 años; con quien tiene tres hijos, Yerson de 21, Yudy de 18 y Marita de 14 años; esta familia vive en  su pequeña casa que es  propia.Desde hace 24 años se dedica a la agricultura siembra  alverja, maíz, papa (tubérculo peruano) y diferentes colores de flores de gladiolos, en los terrenos que le heredaron sus padres y que su esposa junto a sus hijos le ayudan a cultivar; lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar las papas y flores que vende rápidamente en el mercado mayorista de la  ciudad ; esta actividad le permite vivir cómodamente y brindar una adecuada educación a sus hijos, también con las ganancias que obtiene puede adquirir animales como ganado, caballos y asnos que facilitan sus labores agrícolas, sus deseos de progresar han hecho que para  el futuro piense en comprar terrenos y siembre  en mayor cantidad, pero sobre todo arveja ya que invierte poco y obtiene buenos ingresos económicos  en menor tiempo.Es el noveno crédito que tiene con MFP y sabe que será puntual y responsable como siempre.Con el dinero del préstamo ha pensado comprar bolsas de semilla de arveja, abono orgánico y fertilizantes para cuidar sus tierras; esta inversión asciende a dos mil quinientos soles aproximadamente.
texts.en:
Orlando is 44, and he is married to 36 year old Marlene. They have three children; Yeson is 21, Yudy is 18, and Marita is 14. This family lives in a small house, which is their own. For 24 years he has been cultivating peas, corn, potatoes (Peruvian tuber), and different colors of gladiola flowers. He inherited the land from his parents. His wife and children help him cultivate the land. What he likes best about his work is harvesting the potatoes and flowers, which sell rapidly in the wholesale market in the city. This activity allows him to live comfortably and to provide an adequate education for his children. With the earnings he also is able to get animals like livestock, horses, and donkeys. These make his farming work easier. His desires to progress have made him think of buying more land and planting in greater quantity in the future. Most of all, he will do this with peas because he invests a small amount and gets good earnings in less time. This is his ninth loan with MFP, and he knows that he will be punctual and responsible as always. He will use the money from the loan to buy bags of pea seeds, organic fertilizer, and chemical fertilizer to take care of his land. This investment comes to approximately 2,500 PEN.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds and organic and chemical fertilizers for his land

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma P. is from the village of  Mambajao, Camiguin province. She is 45 years old, is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Emma owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies like cassava cake in the local community. Emma has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Emma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Emma is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan Emma has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: René Benito

texts.es:
El señor Rene C. se ha destacado por ser un caballero muy trabajador y con grandes deseos de superación personal ya que también ha velado por su humilde hogar que tiene en buen dirigir.
Está comprometido con el bienestar de sus tres hijos y para ello solicita un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como el cemento para construir en su vivienda y de esta manera brindarle a sus amados hijos las condiciones necesarias de vida y un techo digno donde habitar.
texts.en:
Mr. René C. is known for being a gentleman and a hardworking individual who has great aspirations to succeed personally; he has taken good care of his humble home. René is committed to the welfare of his three sons, which is why he requests a loan to buy construction materials to build his house and therefore provide a solid roof and good living conditions for his beloved children.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying construction materials

loans.name: Numonjon's Group

texts.en:
Married and a father of two children, Numonjon was born on May 12, 1967 in Dushanbe. Coming from an area where cattle-raising is popular, Numonjon has been selling cattle since 2001. He buys them in his village from the farmers who raise them and then sells them at the markets. As his business capital is limited, Numonjon buys just a few and then after he sells those, he returns to buy more. 

Today he would like to expand his business by increasing his capital so that he can maximize his profits. For this reason, Numonjon is requesting a loan of $3000 to purchase young cattle. This will be his second loan with IMON International, and his evaluation shows he is qualified to receive the loan.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase young cattle to expand his business.

loans.name: Union  Familia Group

texts.es: El grupo “Unión Familia” esta representado por la señora Elsa Miriam Y conformada por 12 miembros muy activos y dinámicos como lo demuestra la señora Elsa Miriam quien trabaja en la venta de choripanes y sándwich en la ex estación de la ciudad de El Alto, ella es casada y madre de dos niños su esposo es albañil y el le ayuda con algunos gasto de la casa pero dado que este no alcanza ella debe trabajar para la educación y alimentación de sus hijos los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar, es de aquí que salio el nombre del grupo ya que la unidad familiar hace grande cualquier pequeño negocio, la mayor expectativa de la señora Elsa Miriam es poder sacar profesionales a sus hijos y verlos con una formación adecuada para que su futuro sea mejor para ellos. El resto de las socias se dedican a la venta de CDS al por mayor, cerveza, ropa, ropa, plásticos, servicio de plomería y trasporte. El mercado en el cual se desempeñan existe bastante competencia, sin embargo, ellas se valen de la rapidez que tienen para cambiar y surtir sus mercaderías para salir adelante y obtener el ingreso necesario para el sustento de sus familias. El presente crédito será utilizado para capital de operaciones y para la adquisición de mercadería, insumos y materiales para incrementar su ventas y mejor la calidad de vida de sus familias. El grupo se encuentra actualmente en su cuarto ciclo demostrando siempre capacidad, responsabilidad y compromiso con su grupo, muchos de los pequeños negocios han crecido, por ejemplo la señora Elsa Miran ya tiene su carrito de venta de choripanes y puede darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes ahora quiere incursionar con otro tipo de comida y es por esta razón que requiere del préstamo.
texts.en:
Elsa Miriam represents the Unión Familia group. The group is comprised of 12 very active and dynamic members. Elsa Miriam is a member who demonstrates this. She works selling “choripanes” (barbecued sausage stuffed in bread) and sandwiches in the old station in the city of El Alto. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a bricklayer, and he helps her with some of the household expenses. Because this is not enough, she needs to work for her children’s food and education. Her children are school-age. That is how they got the name of the group. The family makes any small business big. Elsa Miriam’s greatest hope is that her children become professionals and to see them develop enough so that they have a better future. The rest of the members sell wholesale CDs, beer, clothes, and plastics. Some provide plumbing and transportation services. There is plenty of competition in the market, but they get ahead by quickly changing and stocking their merchandise. That way they get the necessary income to support their families. The current loan will be used as operating capital to get merchandise, supplies, and materials to increase their sales and improve their families’ quality of life. The group is currently in their fourth cycle. They always demonstrate competence, responsibility, and commitment to their group. Many of the small business have grown. For example, Elsa Miriam now has her cart for selling choripanes. She can give her customers better service. Now she wants to start selling another type of food. That is the reason she needs the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San B., age 46, is married and resides with her children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She has five children.

B. is engaged in a business purchasing rice from the local farmers and reselling it in the market, earning a gross income of USD 2.50 per day to help cover the family expenses. Her husband is employed at a local government religion department, earning an income of USD 3 per day.

Their standard of living has been improved since B. and her husband have had these businesses. B. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a truck to transport rice to sell. This is her first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: To buy a truck to transport rice for sale

loans.name: Jose Maria

texts.es:
El Sr. T. Meléndez vive en el municipio del viejo, departamento de Chinandega.

El va a utilizar el crédito en la Reparación y mantenimiento de la maquinaria que utiliza para la siembra.

El Sr. T. Meléndez ha tenido 11 créditos con la Institución los cuales todos los ha cancelado muy bien.

El dice estar muy agradecido por todas las atenciones que le han brindado en CEPRODEL, así como todo el apoyo que le han brindado en los créditos obtenidos.
texts.en:
Mr. T. Meléndez lives in the town of Viejo in the department of Chinandega. He will use the loan in the repair and maintenance of the machinery that he uses for planting. Mr. T. Meléndez has taken out 11 loans with the field partner and has repaid them all on time. He says that he is very grateful for the help he has received at CEPRODEL [the Kiva field partner], as well as the support they have provided for his previous loans.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and maintenance of farm machinery

loans.name: Caminando Hacia El Futuro Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “Caminando hacia el Futuro”, está conformada por 9 miembros emprendedores quienes viven en la zona de Catalina Huanca, distrito de Ate, departamento de Lima, trabajan con EDAPROSPO-prosperidad desde hace 3 años y 4 meses.
Milagros quien es socia del grupo, tiene 34 años, es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 3 años de edad., asume el cargo de presidenta recientemente. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de desayunos a los camioneros desde las 6 am., además realiza ventas de tamales a domicilio los fines de semana. Con el esfuerzo de su trabajo ha logrado comprar un frigider. El gran sueño de Milagros es poner una juguería.
El  préstamo otorgado será utilizado para la compra de una extractora, una licuadora y un escurridor de naranja para su negocio. Agradecen el apoyo brindado e iniciativa para su constitución como Alcancía Comunal y se prometen cumplir con los pagos establecidos en las fechas pactadas.
texts.en:
The "Walking Toward the Future" village bank is composed of 9 enterprising members who live in the Catalina Huanca zone, Ate district, of Lima, Peru. They have worked with EDAPROSPO for the past 3 years and 4 months. Milagros, a member of the group, is 34 years old and lives with her partner with whom she has 2 children, 3 and 13 years old. She recently became president of the group. For the past 4 years, she has worked selling breakfast to the truck drivers every morning at 6 am; she also sells tamales door to door on weekends. With her hard work, she has been able to purchase a fridge. She dreams of one day having a juice shop. The loan will be used to buy an extractor, a blender and an orange colander for her work. The members of the group are grateful for the support they are receiving and for the help they've received in forming the Village Bank; they commit to fulfill all their scheduled payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an extractor, a blender and an orange colander for the business

loans.name: Sonunkan's Group

texts.en:
Sonunkan T. is the leader of this group. She is 57 years old and a widow. Sonunkan has raised five children – they are married and live separately with their families, except the youngest son. Sonunkan has been engaged in cattle breeding for 16 years, and her youngest son is the only one who helps her. She has been increasing slowly the number of cattle she owns. Her cattle-breeding success made it possible for her to buy a brick factory. Sonunkan is requesting a loan to purchase two small cattle in order to increase her number of livestock. In this way, she hopes to save money for her son's wedding.
Zamira N. is the treasurer of the group. She is 47 and divorced. Zamira raised two daughters and two sons. The older son is 25 and he helps his mother in her business. The other children are students. After her divorce 13 years ago, Zamira's brother helped her with money, and with 5,000 KGS of initial investment she began to sell DVDs, tapes and clothes. At the moment, her monthly profit is 25,000 KGS. Thanks to this activity she was able to buy a house. Zamira is requesting a loan to purchase different seeds in order to resell them to make some money. In the future, she wishes to buy a pavilion, increase her turnover, and save money for the marriage of her older son.
Akbara A. is 35 and a widow. She has a son and daughter, both of whom study at school. Seven years ago, Akbara sold a cow for 10,000 KGS and with this money she started to sell fruits and vegetables at the market. Now she makes 20,000 KGS per month, which enabled her to build a house and buy a vehicle. Akbara is requesting a loan to purchase fruits and vegetables in order to resell them.
Kenzhekan K. is 36 and divorced. She has two daughters, both of whom are students. Seven years ago, with an initial investment of 4,000 KGS, Kenzhekan began to sell lottery tickets. Now she earns 10,000 KGS per month, making it possible for her to buy a flat and furniture. Kenzhekan is requesting a loan to buy 150 lottery tickets.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Chimgee

texts.en:
Chimgee G. is 40 years old and lives with her two children in Baynhongor province, Mongolia. Her younger son, Bathuleg, attends a local primary school, and her older son, age 19, has a mental disorder for which she receives monthly assistance from the government.  Her husband passed away in 2008 after suffering a serious illness. 

Chimgee operates a second-hand products business in her town. Previously, she worked as a technologist and later as a sales manager for a bakery between 2002 and 2009. However, her first business was as a meat trader from 1999 to 2002. 

Chimgee is a very hard-working person who must rely on her business to support her family. She strives to provide a better life for her two sons. In the future, she would like to have her own workplace and expand her business. Her dream is to one day open her own bakery as she has a significant experience in this field. Chimgee is requesting a 280,000 MNT loan to purchase second-hand products.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand apparel

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr:
Madame Astou Ngom est mariée mère de 5 enfants. Elle s'active dans le commerce depuis longtemps. Tout est arrivé lorsque son voisin commerçant lui a proposé des tissus pour essayer de les écouler dans son quartier.  Et c'est à partir de cemoment qu'elle décida de se convertir dans le commerce pour combattre l'oisiveté. Les choses se sont développées petit à petit et elle est même arrivée à diversifer la vente de tissus par la vente de l'encens qu'on appelle thiouraye en wolof. 
Membre de U-IMCEC depuis Novembre 2009, elle sollicite pour la première fois un crédit de 50 000 FCFA pour acheter quelques tissus e de l'encens afin de voir comment ça se passe avec les mutuelles
texts.en:
Ms. Astou Ngom is a married mother of five children.  She has been active in commerce for a long time.   Everything fell into place when her merchant neighbor suggested she try to sell fabrics in her district.  And from then on, she decided to switch to this business to combat idleness.  Things developed little by little, and she has even managed to diversify her sale of fabrics with the sale of incense, which are called thiouraye in Wolof.  A member of U-IMCEC since November 2009, Astou is requesting for the first time a loan of 50,000 francs CFA to buy some fabrics and incense in order to see how this will go with the group members.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cloth and incense

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa M. is from the village of Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 46 years old. Elsa is married and has six school-age children. To make a living, Elsa owns and operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling a variety of ocean-caught fish in the local community. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elsa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elsa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José Luis es un padre de familia de 31 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijas en el distrito de Chepén, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial situada en la provincia del mismo nombre, dentro de la región La Libertad a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace tres años a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina con la que se brinda servicio de transporte), el brinda su servicio dentro de la ciudad de Chepén y con las ciudades cercanas durante la mayor parte del día. En la zona estos vehículos son bastante frecuentados ya que ofrecen la posbilidad de contar con un medio de transporte barato, por lo que la demanda siempre es estable.

El contínuo uso brindado a su vehículo ha hecho que este empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a realizar esta acción.

José Luis siempre trabaja de la mejor manera posible para poder ayudar a su familia a salir adelante, su mayor anhelo es brindarles la posibilidad de superarse y mejorar su calidad de vida de manera gradual. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institucion demostrando puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
José Luis, 31, is a father living with his wife and his two daughters in Chepén, an agricultural area with lots of commercial activity located in Chepén province within La Libertad region an hour from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital. For the last three years he has provided passenger and cargo transportation services in a mototaxi (a motorcycle with an attached cabin used to provide transportation services). He provides service within the city of Chepén and with nearby cities most of the day. In the area these vehicles are quite popular because they provide an inexpensive mode of transportation so demand is always steady. The continuous use of his vehicle has caused it to start to have some mechanical difficulties that require urgent attention to guarantee correct functioning. Therefore, he is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan that will make this operation possible. José Luis always works in the best way possible to provide for his family and help them succeed. His greatest wish is to give them the possibility of self improvement and to improve their quality of life gradually. He has collaborated with our Institution in the past and has shown punctuality and responsibility with respect to repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For mototaxi repairs and service.

loans.name: Jasmine

texts.en:
Jasmine B. is from the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old and is married with three school-aged children. Jasmine owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish such as "malansi", "bolinao", "sigarilyo" and more in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Jasmine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Jasmine is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
In Andoung Samretth village in Takeo province lives Mrs. Leng K. who was born in 1963. She and her husband, Mr. Sambath K., are farmers who own a three-hectare (7.5-acre) plot of land that they use to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. Moreover, Mrs. Leng K. is also a Khmer cake seller while her husband is also a duck breeder who is able to earn some money from selling eggs.

Mrs. Leng K.’s problem is that her field has infertile soil and it has a lot of insects. So, to improve her production of rice, she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide, and to rent plowing machine to plow her field. With the rest of the loan, she plans to buy more ducks and duck feed.

Mrs. Leng K. is the mother of a child who is studying in school. Her husband is shown with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide, to rent a plowing machine to plow her field, and to buy more ducks and duck feed

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys junto a su esposo se dedican a L. venta D. bebidas al por mayor y menor, su negocio esta ubicado en local alquilado, sus ventas los realiza en L. tienda y también reparte a negocios con un carro que adquirió hace 3 meses, antes repartía con carros alquilados.
Gladys es socia del Banco Comunal Confianza hace 1 año y lo que mas le agrada son las reuniones y L. confianza entre las socias. Gladys es conviviente tiene 3 hijos D. 10, 7, 3 años. Su sueño es tener una distribuidora granD. y tener un local propio.
Gladys solicita un crédito D. 2500 soles para L. compra D. gaseosas y cerveza.
texts.en:
Gladys and her husband are beverage wholesalers and retailers. Their business is located in a rented space. They sell from the store and also deliver to other stores using a car she bought three months ago; she used to make her deliveries using leased cars. Gladys has been a member of the Confianza (Trust) communal bank for a year. What she likes best about it are the meetings and the trust that exists among the members. Gladys is partnered and they have three children who are 10, 7 and 3 years of age. Her dream is to have a large distributorship and to own her own locale. She is asking for a 2500 sol loan to buy soft drinks and beer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and beer.

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
Mr. Yan T. is a rattan cupboard seller who is a 40-year-old, married father with two dependent children. One of his children is already married and lives independently, and the other two are single. Since 2006, 

Yan T. and his wife have owned a small rattan cupboard sales point. The couple also orders rattan items in bulk from braiders and then takes it to sell door-to-door across the province. 

Yan T. resides in an old house that needs repairs frequently. Because of that, Yan T. decided to seek for a loan to mend his house. 

(Mr. Yan T.'s wife is in the photo.)

loans.use: To repair his home.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala West region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children, all of whom are currently in school.  Prossy has a business of selling charcoal, which she has had for two years.  She also sells dry fish and runs a small hotel.  

To help expand her business, Prossy has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more charcoal, caps, and plates.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Prossy hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Prossy hopes to expand all of her businesses.  Prossy is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by enabling her to save money.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is 46 years old and married with three children. He runs a butcher shop for a living. Most of his customers are local people. He has learned how to retain his customers by offering good service, thanks to Faulu Kenya's training in good customer care. Julius hopes to open more branches of his business in the future. He has requested a loan of 40,000 Kes to buy more meat.

loans.use: To buy more meat

loans.name: Israel

texts.es:
El señor Israel es  casado  ya hace dos años, tiene un bebe, vive en casa de sus padres, en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz.
Israel trabaja como carpintero desde joven,. Es así como obtiene sus ingresos para su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para adquirir una tienda en la cual se dedicará a la venta de ropa para niños y jóvenes en la ciudad de La Paz y así poder aumentar sus ingresos.
Es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en: Israel has been married for two years, has a baby, and lives in his parents' home in the Villa Nuevo Potosi area of the city of La Paz. Israel has worked as a carpenter since he was young. In this manner he obtains income for his household. The loan requested is to acquire a shop which will be dedicated to selling children's clothing in the city of La Paz and augment his income. This is his first loan and the socioeconomic analysis performed favorably qualified him to access credit.

loans.use: Purchase a space to begin a business selling clothing for children and young adults.

loans.name: Anda Yolanda

texts.es: Anda Yolanda tiene 33 años, su actividad es una pulpería hace mas de 12 años que tiene este negocio. Ella es una mujer muy luchadora y le gusta relacionarse con sus clientes, por lo que siempre le solicitan una gran variedad de productos es una persona muy responsable y busca la forma de mejorar sus ingresos. Inicio como un medio de vida necesario para su negocio, por lo que siempre está pendiente de lo que sus clientes le solicitan. El financiamiento es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, jugos, detergentes entre otras cosas importantes, por lo que tiene que surtir por que se acerca la temporada navideña.
texts.en: Anda Yolanda is 33 years old. Her business is a general store. She has run this business for more than 12 years. She is a very determined woman, and she enjoys interacting with her customers, who are always asking her for a wide range of products. She is a very responsible person who is seeking a way to increase her income. She started her business to support herself, and she is always attentive to her customers' requests. The loan is to buy snacks, soft drinks, bread, juices, and detergents, among other important items, since she has to stock her store in anticipation of the Christmas season.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Siem Thavery's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Siem T. is nineteen years old, married and has a child who is just a year old. Her husband, Mr. Nhien Long, 26 years old, is an agri-machine driver. They live in K'am Samnar Leu village, Kandal province.

Eight people have formed a village bank and selected Siem T. as the village bank loan president. The members of this village will use their portions of the loan to support their different purposes.

Siem is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare rice field. Her husband also works on the farm. Siem, however, does not have enough money to grow her rice. So she has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes, 32, is married with four children between the ages of 2 and 13. She owns a small local bar selling locally produced beer called “sorghum beer". She buys it in five jerry-cans of 20 litres each and sells it to the local people. Besides selling the local beer, she also roasts goat meat which the local people enjoy, especially in the evenings after a day of hard work on their farms.

Agnes has requested a loan to expand her business. She will buy other equipment for her beer garden such as tables, cups and bottles and increase her beer stocks for the Christmas season. She hopes to continue to grow her business and will invest any profit back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase more equipment and stock.

loans.name: Fredesminda

texts.es:
Fredesminda de 27 años de edad, esta joven no tiene hijos, vive con su esposo su esposo quien trabaja como asesor de crèdito el cual la ayuda con los gastos familiares ya que son bien unidos y responsables , ella labora como docente de primaria en la Escuelita colonia Los Pintos en el Municipio de Nueva Guinea, es una persona esforzada que ha obtenido lo que tiene con sacrificio, el cual desea seguir progresando en la vida.  

Solicita su segundo crèdito para invertirlo en compra de  materiales de construcciòn para reparar la cocina de su vivienda, de esta manera brindar mayor seguridad a sus bienes y aumentar el valor comercial de su vivienda. 

Su mayor sueño en la vida  es estar bien con Dios, que su familia permanezca bien unida y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Fredesminda is 27 years old.  This young woman doesn't have any children.  She lives with her husband who works as a loan consultant and helps with the family expenses since they are very united and responsible.

Fredesminda works as an elementary school teacher in Colonia Los Pintos School, in the town of Nueva Guinea.  She is a very dedicated person who has obtained everything she has through hard work and sacrifice and who would like to continue making progress in life.

Fredesminda is requesting her second loan to invest in buying building materials to fix up the kitchen in her house so that she can provide her belongings with more safety and increase the commercial value of her home.  Her biggest dream in life is to be in good standing with God, for her family to remain close and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To fix up her kitchen

loans.name: Trust In God Development Group - Kampala

texts.en:
38-year-old Robinah N. has been selling fruits, vegetables and soft drinks in Kireka, Kampala for the past 6 years. 

The happily married mother of two says she started this business because of the influence of one of her closest friends. Her friend persuaded her not to just sit at home. Her friend's reasoning was that Robinah could not bring value to her life by just being a housewife.
