Robinah, who comes across as a God-fearing, hard-working and affable lady, says her business profits are to the tune of 100,000 shillings per week. Robinah says that, with this loan, she is going to revamp her business. Robinah is affiliated with the Trust in God development group in Kampala.

loans.use: To renovate her business

loans.name: Lach

texts.en:
Mrs Lach S. was born in 1980 and is a married woman living in Ta Skor village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr Soeung Sal, earn their living fishing. At the moment they don't have enough fishing supplies to support their business, so Mrs Lach S. would like to ask for a loan to buy fishing nets and a fishing boat. 

The couple has five children. Three of them are attending the local school and the others are too young to study or work. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets and a fishing boat

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita J. is from the village of P-4, Carangan, Ozamiz City. She is 32 years old. Nenita is married and has one school-aged and one infant child. To make a living, Nenita owns and operates an "okay-okay" (used clothing sales) business. She has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 25,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Nenita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. This will be the 1st loan taken by Nenita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

 About PMPC:

 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her second-hand clothing business

loans.name: Fredy Ariel

texts.es: El Sr S.  labora como analista contable  es  acompañado, tiene tres personas a su cargo,  es el primer  del crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, da gracia la oportunidad que le brindan con  este  desembolso, para reparación del sistema eléctrico, mano de obra, en su vivienda
texts.en: Mr. S. is an accounting analyst and he is married. He has three individuals in his care. it is the first loan he has through Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner).  He is thankful for the loan that he is granted and it will be used to repair the electrical system of his house and to hire someone to do it.

loans.use: To carry out home improvements.

loans.name: Julio Moises

texts.es:
Julio Moises M. M. tiene 22 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y  con los hijos solteros en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO ENMANUEL se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Juan  pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 17 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, trigo, papas en grandes cantidades y a la cría de animales como chanchos y gallinas.

Julio  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la cría de chanchos y gallinas. Compra sus productos en Comercial Silva cada fin de semana por la comida de los animales y los vende en la feria de los jueves en la Ciudad de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz trigo, papas y  compra de  animales además para insumos de alimentación e insumos para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener terreno para sembrar.

Le gusta hacer deporte y salir con la familia.
texts.en:
Julio Moises M. M. is 22 years old and married.  He lives with his wife and their single children in the Guaranda canton in the Bolívar province.  He has five children.  

The members of the Grupo Enmanuel Community Bank can be found in the San Juan precinct, which is in the Guaranda canton.  This bank has 17 members, farmers who grow large quantities of short cycle corn, wheat, and potatoes.  They also raise animals like pigs and chickens.

He buys his products at Comercial Silva every week end.  He buys food for the animals, and he sells them on Thursdays at the fair in the city of Guaranda.

He is requesting the loan to plant corn, wheat, and potatoes.  He will also buy animals and supplies to feed the animals and for his crops.  The support of the loan would financially help supply him with the necessities.

The challenges he faces are pest infestation, diseases, and climate change.

His dream is to have a field to sow.

He likes playing sports and going out with his family.

loans.use: to plant corn, wheat, and potatoes, and to buy animals

loans.name: Juana Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SOL Y LUNA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana; la socia tiene 32 años de edad, soltera; la socia termino la carrera de biología en la universidad nacional del Cusco y desea titularse lo más antes posible para poder buscar un buen trabajo, a la vez la socia vende ropa para damas y ella lo distribuye de manera independiente a sus amistades, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para poder titularse en la universidad.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Juana, 32, is a member of the “SOL Y LUNA” (Sun & Moon) communal bank which is located in Cusco District, belonging to Cusco Province and Cusco Department.

She’s single.  She completed her career in Biology at the Cusco National University and wants to graduate as soon as possible so that she can look for a good job.  She also sells women’s clothes independently among her friends.  She is a very cheerful person with a strong drive to continue moving forward.

She is asking for a loan to pay graduation fees at the university.  She is happy for the loan and commits to repay.

loans.use: to pay her university graduation fees.

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu M. is a divorced woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Tatu has operated a food stall for the past three years, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She cooks chapatti (flat bread), beans and rice for sale. Tatu has been able to provide for her children’s basic needs and education from her earnings.

Tatu decided to join Yehu to access funds to boost her business. With a loan of 20,000 KES she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour and sacks of beans.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour and sacks of beans

loans.name: Dario

texts.en:
Dario C. is from the village of Militar, Tukuran Zambo del sur. He is 50 years old. Dario is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Dario raises fish for sale. Dario has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Dario joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dario is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing nets used for fishing. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Dario from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.ar:
محمد في عمر 32 سنة متزوج وهو اب لأربع اولاد يعمل في بيع اللحوم والخواريف له في عمله 15 سنة يحب عمله ويسعى الى دعمه وتطويره يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء خواريف لتسمين الخواريف الاخرى ودعم عمله بالملحمة زبائنه هم من جيرانه واقاربه واصدقائه يعاني من بعض الصعوبات المادية وله خبرة طويلة في عمله يحلم بامتلاك ملحمة خاصة اكبر حتى يزيد من مدخوله
يريد ان يؤمن مستقبل جيد لأولاده وتعليمهم بأفضل الطرق
texts.en: Mohamad is 32 years old and married with four children. He has fifteen years of experience selling mutton and other types of meet to his relatives, neighbors, and friends. He dreams of one day owning his own, larger butchery so that he can secure a better income and therefore provide his children with a better education. In the meantime, he was interested in applying for a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase more sheep and to procure fodder to fatten up the sheep he already has.

loans.use: to purchase fodder and sheep for his butchery.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es: La Sra. Consuelo vive en la zona de el Dorado de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, es casada, tiene cuatro hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar. Ella se dedica a la repostería, panadería y pastelería desde hace 10 años, ella trabaja medio tiempo en una pastelería y en las tardes trabaja en su casa, hace todo tipo de pasteles, tortas, masitas, etc. Este es su tercer crédito en la institución donde ha demostrado un buen comportamiento de pago, este tercer crédito es para comprar una batidora industrial, otro horno y compra de víveres. Ella es una persona trabajadora que se levanta a las 6 de la mañana para iniciar su labor diaria y termina a las ocho de la noche, su deseo de la Sra. Consuelo es el de tener su propia pastelería y el ver a sus hijos profesionales y personas de bien, es una persona trabajadora y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Ms. Consuelo lives in the El Dorado area of the city of Santa Cruz. She is married and has four school age children. She has been working at a bakery for over 10 years. She works part-time in a cake shop and in the evening, she works from home making all types of cakes, pies, and pastries. This is her third loan with the institute, where she has demonstrated responsibility with her payments. This loan will be used to purchase an industrial mixer, another oven, and some provisions. She is a very hardworking person who gets up at 6 in the morning to start her day, then she finishes at 8 in the evening. Ms. Consuelo's wish is to open up her own cake shop and to see her children become upright professionals. She works hard and is grateful to the institute for the support they have given her in the form of a loan.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial mixer and other goods.

loans.name: Ammie

texts.en:
Ammie is a hardworking entrepreneur living in the Philippines. She is 39 years old and married. Ammie has three school-aged children. Ammie's spouse works as a tricycle driver and operator. 

Ammie and her husband have been in the business of motorcycle transport for almost 15 years. Each month, Ammie earns 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). She plans to use this loan to pay for franchise renewal and plans to invest in her rice vending business to boost her profits. 

Ammie has been a client of ASKI for three years. In the future, Ammie would like to educate all her children in order for them to have a brighter future someday.

loans.use: to pay for franchise renewal and to invest in her rice vending business.

loans.name: Nhor

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhor and her husband have been spending their lifetime with cultivating rice on their existing farmland in Kompong Cham Province. Rice is an essential product vital to Cambodian people. Mrs. Nhor learned to do this from her grandmother and she is very widely known in this sector since before she was married. The family also raises a few pigs at home to generate extra profit. 

Mrs. Nhor and her husband have 2 single children who are studying in public school. Mrs. Nhor will be using the loan to buy 2 cows to assist her in plowing, as her current cows are getting old and don't support her in the field.

loans.use: to buy two cows to assist in plowing

loans.name: Menecia

texts.en:
Menecia's main source of income comes from fattening pigs for sale. She is 41 years old, married, and has three grown-up children. She is from the village of Santa Cruz, Benito Soliven, Isabela. She has been in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP (~$166) monthly.

She joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Menecia is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase hog feed and breeding livestock. 

In the future, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed and breeding livestock.

loans.name: Keyma

texts.en: Keyma is 27 years old and lives in Jacob Town. She is married and has one child. She has been selling charcoal for four years now and started with the help of her husband. She is requesting a loan to purchase 50 more bags of charcoal for her business. She plans to buy land in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase 50 bags of charcoal for her business

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es: El señor: Feliciano convive con la señora: Eulalia con la cual tienen 2 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar y viven en la comunidad de quebrada portuguesa, comunidad distante a 4 kilómetros de la Guardia. Viven de la agricultura, a través de la siembra de sus productos: maíz, yuca, maní, frijol y verduras. Ellos lograron conseguir su parcela y desde hace 3 años y desde entonces se  que se dedican a la agricultura, el dinero del  credito lo utilizaran el lo que implica el preparado de la tierra la compra de semillas para la siembra de maiz,  trabaja junto a su esposa y después comercializan sus productos en el mercado de  la comunidad, el Sr. Feliciano es una persona muy trabajadora agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado. En la foto el Sr Feliciano esta en compañia de su esposa.
texts.en: Sr. Feliciano and Sra. Eulalia have two school-aged children.  They live in Quebrada Portuguesa, a rural community some 4 kilometers from La Guardia.  They make their living from farming, growing and selling crops such as maize, yucca, peanuts, beans and vegetables.  They got the farm 3 years ago and have been farming ever since.  They will use this loan to prepare land for their next maize crop.  Sr. Feliciano and Sra. Eulalia work the land together and sell their crops at local markets when the crops are ready for sale.  Sr. Feliciano is a hard-working man and he's grateful for the support he's received from the bank.  He and his wife are pictured together in the attached photo.

loans.use: to buy seeds for his maize farming business.
